title: User
description:
User, The 'User' allows you to add and manage additional guest accounts for other users to use personalized settings when using the device.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and Backup' > 'Users' menu.
3. In the 'Users' menu, you can check the list of users registered on the current device.
4. To add a user or guest, press the 'Add Guest' or '+Add User' button at the bottom.
5. To delete a user, press the name of that user, then select 'Delete User' from the menu.

title: Vibration
description:
Vibration, You can set whether to receive vibration alerts for emergency messages.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' menu of your device.
2. Find and select the 'Safety and emergency' option.
3. Select the 'Wireless emergency alerts' option.
4. Here, enable the 'Vibration' option.

title: Received Emergency Messages
description:
Received Emergency Messages, You can gather and check received emergency messages here.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' menu of your device.
2. Among the items in the 'Settings' menu, please find and select 'Safety and Emergency'.
3. In this section, please find and select the 'Emergency Messages' option.
4. By selecting 'Received Emergency Messages', you can gather and view all emergency messages.

title: Routines
description:
Routines, ## Using routines
Automating your routine means you don't have to do the same thing over and over again. For example, you can automatically change sound settings based on where you are and run routines with optimized phone settings.

## Add routine
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your phone.
2. Select ‘Mode and Routine’ > ‘Routine’ tab.
3. Tap the + icon to add your own routine, or select the compass icon, check the recommended routines, and select the routine you want.
4. To run the routine manually, set the condition to Run manually. This option only appears when no conditions are set.

## Using recommended routines
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your phone.
2. Select ‘Mode and Routine’ > ‘Recommendation’ tab.

## Run routine
For routines that run automatically, the action you set is automatically executed when the conditions of the added routine are detected.
A routine whose routine execution condition is set to run manually can be run whenever the user wants by pressing a button.
To run it manually, click the action icon for the desired routine.
To run it as a widget, tap the routine under Manual Routines and then select More → Set as Widget → Add.
A widget is added to the home screen, and you can run the routine by tapping the widget.
To stop a running routine, tap the routine below in the Routines tab and select Stop, or tap the running widget on the home screen.

title: Settings - Sound & Vibration - Volume Normalization
description:
Settings - Sound & Vibration - Volume Normalization, You can reduce volume differences between audio content. The content volume is automatically adjusted by increasing the volume of content with low volume. Prevent the sound from suddenly becoming too loud or too quiet while playing media.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Sound and Vibration’ > ‘Sound Quality and Sound Effects’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Volume Normalization’ menu.
4. You can enable or disable the ‘Loud Normalization’ effect. Settings are saved and managed for each speaker, earphone, and BT.

title: Text-to-Speech
description:
Text-to-Speech, This is a feature that reads out the text displayed on the device screen in voice.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'TalkBack' > 'Settings' menu.
3. Here, you can check the 'Text-to-Speech' feature.

In detailed settings, you can adjust speaking speed and pitch, and change the language or engine to use. After setting this up, you can hear the text appearing on your device screen in voice.

In this menu, you can change the following detailed settings:
 - 'Default Engine'
 - 'Language'
 - 'Speech rate'
 - 'Pitch'

title: Notification by Light
description:
Notification by Light, When you get a call or text message and the screen blinks, it means that the 'Notification by Light' function is activated.
This function informs users who cannot hear the sound that a notification has been received through the screen or camera flashlight so that they can check the notifications without missing them.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Please find the 'Accessibility'> 'Advanced Settings' menu and select it.
3. You can check the 'Notification by Light' function here.

title: Time to take action
description:
Time to take action, If the volume control window or popup window does not disappear from the screen and remains for too long, please check if the wait time value before taking action is set too long.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here you can check the 'Time to take action' feature.

This feature is provided for users who have difficulty recognizing and operating items that disappear from the screen after being displayed for a certain period of time.

title: Screen zoom
description:
Screen zoom, If the response speed of keyboard input and screen touch is too slow, check if the zoom shortcut function is set to triple tap.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Go to 'Accessibility' > 'Vision enhancements' > Select 'Magnification'.
3. Here, you can check and change the 'Magnification shortcut' settings.

The zoom function enlarges the screen for users with low vision to check the contents of the screen. If this function is set to triple tap, the response speed of keyboard input and screen touch can be affected.

title: Mute all sounds
description:
Mute all sounds, If there is no sound, including call ringtones, coming from the terminal, please check if the 'Mute All Sounds' feature is enabled.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Hearing enhancements' menu.
3. Here, you can check the 'Mute all sounds' feature.

This feature is designed to prevent situations where users with hearing disability cause inconvenience to others around them due to sounds coming from their device by blocking all sounds from the terminal.

title: Assistant menu
description:
Assistant menu, The auxiliary menu helps users who find it difficult to press the terminal's buttons. They can perform gestures with a simple touch.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Interaction and dexterity' menu.
3. Here, you can check the 'Assistant menu' feature.

title: Voice Access
description:
Voice Access, Using the Voice Access feature, you can control all items visible on the screen with various voice commands.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Interaction and dexterity' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Voice Access' feature.

title: Tap duration
description:
Tap duration, If a round shape appears where you touch and the screen does not respond well, check if the press time or ignore repeated touches feature is turned on.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Interaction and dexterity' menu.
3. Here, you can check the 'Tap duration' and 'Ignore repeated touches' features.

This feature adjusts the touch time for users who may experience unintended touches due to hand tremors or have difficulty with touch.

title: Hearing aid support
description:
Hearing aid support, By utilizing the hearing aid support menu, you can connect your current hearing aid to the device in various ways to hear the sound better through phone.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Hearing enhancements' menu.
3. Here, you can check the 'Hearing aid support' feature.

The hearing aid compatibility menu is a feature that delivers the other party's voice well to the hearing aid during phone calls, and if the hearing aid supports Bluetooth functionality, you can connect it to the device through the Bluetooth hearing aid menu to hear all sounds from the device directly through the hearing aid.

title: Hearing enhancement
description:
Hearing enhancement, Galaxy devices come equipped with a variety of features that can be used by hearing-impaired individuals.

‒ 'Live caption': feature generates captions by recognizing sounds from media.
‒ 'Real Time Text': feature allows you to confirm what the other person is saying during a conversation in real life.
‒ 'Hearing aid support': helps you hear better by connecting your hearing aid to the device.
‒ 'Mute all sounds' feature: prevents all sounds from occurring on the device.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' > 'Hearing enhancements' menu.
3. Here you can find various accessibility features related to hearing.

Additional explanations about the various accessibility features provided by Galaxy can also be found on the Samsung.com Accessibility homepage.
http://www.samsung.com/accessibility

title: Relumino outline
description:
Relumino outline, Galaxy is equipped with various features for low-vision users.

Basic features include,
‒ 'Font size and style': feature that allows adjusting the font size.
‒ 'Screen layout and zoom': feature that  adjusts the screen size.
‒ 'Zoom': feature that enlarges the actual displayed screen as is.
‒ 'Magnifier': feature that uses the camera to zoom in on the contents of documents or menus.
Additionally, it has a feature,
‒ 'Relumino outline': feature that thickens the outlines of objects in videos or images to help recognize objects.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Please find the 'Accessibility'> 'Vision enhancements' menu and select it.
3. Here, you can find 'Relumino outline' menu.

Additional explanations of the various accessibility features provided by Galaxy can also be found on the Samsung.com Accessibility website.
http://www.samsung.com/accessibility

title: Accessibility
description:
Accessibility, Accessibility is a feature that helps all users to use all functions of the device equally without experiencing difficulties due to physical or situational constraints. 
Through these features, people with disabilities can use the same functions as non-disabled people. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app of the device. 
2. Find and select the 'Accessibility' menu. 

Here, you can check the accessibility features. 

 Further explanations about various accessibility features provided by Galaxy can also be found on the Samsung.com Accessibility website. 
http://www.samsung.com/accessibility

title: Show notifications on the cover screen
description:
Show notifications on the cover screen, You can change whether notifications are displayed on the cover screen.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your mobile phone.
2. Select the 'Notification' > 'Cover screen' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Show notifications' menu.

title: Automatic Off Time
description:
Automatic Off Time, This menu allows you to change the automatic off time setting of the cover screen. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Cover Screen' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Automatic Off Time of Cover Screen' menu here. 

In the detail settings, you can set the time when the cover screen turns off automatically.

title: Quick response from the cover screen
description:
Quick response from the cover screen, This is a menu where you can change the quick response phrase for notifications on the cover screen.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your mobile phone.
2. Select the 'Notification' > 'Cover screen' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Quick response' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can edit the list of phrases to be sent as quick responses on the cover screen.

title: Widget
description:
Widget, This menu allows you to change the widget settings on the cover screen. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Cover Screen' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Widget' menu here. 

In the detail settings, the widget list settings to check on the cover screen can be changed.

title: Widgets
description:
Widgets, This menu lets you change the settings of the cover screen. You can change the clock design on the cover screen or change the notification display settings. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD' menu.
3. Select 'Widgets'.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - S Pen Input Mode
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - S Pen Input Mode, Samsung DeX can turn out to be a useful feature for changing the S Pen input mode of the connected display.
Available on pen-supported devices.

## Follow the steps below to change the S Pen input mode:
1. Launch 'Samsung DeX' on your device.
2. Launch the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select 'S Pen input mode'.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Default Audio Output Settings
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Default Audio Output Settings, This feature is useful for “playing sound through a connected TV or monitor by default when Samsung DeX starts.”

## How to enter settings
1. Run ‘Samsung DeX’ on the terminal.
2. Launch the ‘Settings’ app on the connected display.
3. Select ‘Samsung DeX’.
4. Select ‘Set default audio output’.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad Gestures
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad Gestures, Samsung DeX is useful for settings that allow you to tap with three or four fingers.

## How to enter settings
1. Run 'Samsung DeX' on your terminal.
2. Run the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select 'Mouse & Trackpad'.
5. Select 'Touchpad Gestures'.
6. You can specify the touchpad gesture actions for 'Tap with three fingers' and 'Tap with four fingers'.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad auto-run
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad auto-run, This feature is useful for setting up the touchpad when Dex is running.

## How to enter settings
1. Run ‘Samsung DeX’ on the terminal.
2. Launch the ‘Settings’ app on the connected display.
3. Select ‘Samsung DeX’.
4. Select ‘Mouse & Trackpad’.
5. Select ‘Auto-run touchpad’.

title: Samsung DeX - Additional Settings
description:
Samsung DeX - Additional Settings, The steps below will guide you on how to customize the mouse and trackpad color using Samsung DeX.

## How to enter settings
1. Run 'Samsung DeX' on the device.
2. Run the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select 'Mouse & Trackpad'.
5. Select 'Additional Settings'.

Once you reach here, you can set the following functions in the submenu:

1) Pointer speed: You can set the speed in the form of a scroll bar.
2) Wheel scroll speed: You can set the wheel scroll speed.
3) You can turn on and off the function that can reflect acceleration in cursor movement.
4) You can specify the size and color of the cursor pointer.
5) You can designate the primary mouse button as the left or right button.
6) Auxiliary button: You can set the function of the auxiliary button. You can open the menu by activity, or set it to view the app screen, home, recent, back, view notifications, open quick settings, open apps, etc., or you can choose not to use it by not setting it.
7) Wheel button: The function of the wheel button can also be set as the auxiliary button function.
8) The settings of Additional button 1 and Additional button 2 can also be set as the auxiliary button or wheel button.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad Scroll Direction
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Touchpad Scroll Direction, Here's how you can change the touchpad scroll direction.

## How to enter Settings
1. Run 'Samsung DeX' on your device.
2. Run the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select 'Mouse & Trackpad'.
5. Select 'Touchpad Scroll Direction'.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Mouse & Trackpad
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Mouse & Trackpad, Samsung DeX is useful for settings related to mouse and trackpad.

Available on pen-supported devices.
## How to access settings
1. Launch 'Samsung DeX' on your device.
2. Launch the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select 'Mouse & Trackpad'.

title: Dex Settings - Screen larger/smaller
description:
Dex Settings - Screen larger/smaller, This feature is useful for changing the screen zoom of a connected display.

## How to enter settings
1. Run ‘Samsung DeX’ on the terminal.
2. Launch the ‘Settings’ app on the connected display.
3. Select ‘Samsung DeX’.
4. Select ‘Larger/smaller screen’.

title: Samsung DeX Settings - Font Size
description:
Samsung DeX Settings - Font Size, You can use Samsung DeX to change the font size of the connected display.

## How to enter Settings to execute it:
1. Please run 'Samsung DeX' on your device.
2. Run the 'Settings' app on the connected display.
3. Please select 'Samsung DeX'.
4. Select ‘Font Size’.

title: Screen timeout for connected display
description:
Screen timeout for connected display, This feature is useful in relation to setting the screen timeout after inactivity. 

## How to enter setting.
1. Please run 'Samsung DeX' on your device. 
2. Run the 'Settings' app on the connected display. 
3. Select 'Samsung DeX'. 
4.  select 'Screen timeout for connected display'.

title: Allow multiple S Pens
description:
Allow multiple S Pens, You can use another S Pen while keeping the basic S Pen in your phone. The battery usage will increase.

##How to set up multiple S Pens
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'More S Pen settings' > 'Allow multiple S Pens'.

Here, you can set the option to use multiple S Pens.

title: When S Pen is removed
description:
When S Pen is removed, You can set it so that nothing happens when you separate the S Pen, without opening Air Command or executing Note writing. 

##How to set it so nothing happens when separating the S Pen
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu > Select 'When S Pen is removed' option.
4. Here, select the option 'Do nothing'.

title: S Pen to text
description:
S Pen to text, The text input feature with the S Pen allows you to write directly on the screen without showing the Samsung keyboard. This feature can be turned on or off. Use the S Pen to enter text in search boxes, address bars, and text fields. Handwritten text will be converted to typed text. 

##How to set up text input with the S Pen 
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'S Pen to text'.

You can continue to erase, add, or modify the converted text using S Pen. You can display a screen that shows how to edit. You can show the handwriting toolbar.

title: S Pen unlock
description:
S Pen unlock, You can set up screen unlock with the S Pen.
To use this feature, set up a secure screen lock method.

##How to set up unlock with the S Pen
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'More S Pen settings' > 'S Pen unlock'

Here, you can set up unlock with the S Pen.

title: Settings - Useful Features - S Pen - Air Command
description:
Settings - Useful Features - S Pen - Air Command, Air command is a feature that allows you to quickly launch S Pen functions and frequently used applications.

## How to set up Air Command related menus

1. Run the 'Settings' app on the Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Useful Features' menu.
3. You can find the 'S Pen' menu here.
4. Select the Air Command menu.

Here, you can use various apps and S Pen functions quickly and conveniently with one menu. You can also move the menu by reducing it to a button and dragging it.

title: Screen off memos
description:
Screen off memos, Easily write notes even when the screen is off. 

##How to set up Screen Off Memo
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'S Pen' menu > Select 'Screen off memos'.

Here, you can turn the Screen Off Memo feature on and off.
While holding the pen button, tap the screen twice with the S Pen to immediately create a new note.

title: Quick notes
description:
Quick notes, By pressing the pen button and tapping the screen twice with the S Pen, you can immediately create a new note.

##How to set up the Quick Note menu
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'S Pen' menu. 
4. Select the 'Quick notes' option.

You can turn 'Quick notes' settings on and off.

title: Vibrations
description:
Vibrations, You can enable vibration when inserting or removing the S Pen from the phone.

##How to set vibration when inserting/removing the S Pen
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'More S Pen settings' > Select 'Vibrations'.

title: Show Air command icon
description:
Show Air command icon, A floating icon that opens the Air Command menu can be displayed. When you bring the S Pen close to the screen, the floating icon will appear.

##How to enable the Air Command icon display
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Go to the 'S Pen' menu > Select 'Air command'.
4. Select 'Show Air command icon'.

Here, you can turn the Air Command icon display on and off.

title: Warn if S Pen is left behind
description:
Warn if S Pen is left behind, You can receive a warning notification when you move while holding a phone with the screen turned off and the S Pen separated. 

##How to set up notifications when leaving the S Pen
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'More S Pen settings' > Select 'Warn if S Pen is left behind'.

Here, you can set up notifications for leaving the S Pen in the additional S Pen settings.

title: Shortcuts
description:
Shortcuts, Create notes, view all notes, Smart Select, Write after capture, PENUP

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Go to the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'Air command' > Tap on 'Shortcuts'.

Here, you can add various apps to the shortcut menu.

title: Keep S Pen connected
description:
Keep S Pen connected, Keep the S Pen connected to enable Air Actions immediately upon removal. 

##How to keep the S Pen connected
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Enter the 'S Pen' menu.
4. Select 'When S Pen is removed'.

This will increase battery usage.

title: Open Air command with Pen button
description:
Open Air command with Pen button, When you bring the S Pen close to the screen and press the pen button, the Air Command menu opens.

##How to set up the S Pen Air Command menu
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you will find the 'S Pen' menu. 
4. Select 'Air command'.

Within the 'Air command' menu, you can make various settings. Use a variety of apps and S Pen functions quickly and conveniently with a single menu. You can also minimize the menu to a button and drag it around. The menu styles include a 'Standard' style and a 'Compact' style. You can add various apps that can be used in the shortcut menu, turn the Air Command icon display on and off, and open Air Command with the pen button.

title: Manage Air view settings for S Pen
description:
Manage Air view settings for S Pen, ## How to set up S Pen Air View (Preview and Pointer)

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Useful Features' menu.
3. You can find the 'S Pen' menu here.

When you turn on the Air View Pointer, you can see the movement of the S Pen accurately, and when you turn on the Air View Preview, you can bring the S Pen close to the screen to scroll through links, albums, schedules, or preview contents. There are four settings in the menu options: Preview and Pointer, Pointer Only, and Preview Only.

title: Air actions
description:
Air actions, You can use the S Pen like a remote control to open apps, take photos, play videos, and perform various tasks easily without touching the screen. You can check the Air Actions guide through the Discover menu. You can set the app for the Pen Button Long Press menu where you can check the various Air Actions gestures. 

##How to Set Up S Pen Air Actions
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'S Pen' menu. 
4. Select 'Air actions'.

When you enter the 'Air actions' menu, you can use various settings menus for the 'Air actions' function.

title: Sounds
description:
Sounds, You can set sound effects when writing with Spen on the screen.

##How to set Spen sound :
1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. You can find the 'S Pen' menu here > Select 'More S Pen settings'.
4. Turn on 'Sounds' option.

You can set it in the additional Spen settings menu.

title: Network mode
description:
Network mode, You can set the network information to be displayed in the status bar.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Connections'.
3. Select 'Mobile networks' here.
4. In 'Network operators', you can choose either 'Available networks' or 'Active networks' to be shown in the status bar.

title: Access Point Names
description:
Access Point Names, You can check the currently set APN list or create a new APN.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Connections'.
3. Select 'Mobile networks' here.
4. Select the 'Access Point Names' menu.

You can check the current APN list and create a new APN.

title: Switch to LTE when battery low
description:
Switch to LTE when battery low, when the battery is low,you can set up to switch to LTE. 5G is turned off to save the battery, if the battery goes below 15%. In some cases, 5G icons may be displayed on the status bar but are not used. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Please find 'Connections' and choose. 
3. Select 'Mobile networks' here. 
4. You can turn off and turn on 'Switch to LTE when battery is low'.

title: Billing cycle and data warning
description:
Billing cycle and data warning, You can set the start date for data usage measurement, data warning, and data limit on your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Data usage' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Billing cycle and data warning' menu.

title: Mobile data usage
description:
Mobile data usage, Here is how to check data usage by app on your device:

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device. 
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Data usage'. 
3. Here, you can find the 'Mobile data usage' menu. 

The data usage displayed here is measured by the device and may differ from the usage measured by your service provider.

title: Confirm mobile data connection
description:
Confirm mobile data connection, This provides a pop-up for mobile data usage during booting so that users can select it. 

1. Open 'Settings' App on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Connections'> 'Data usage' menu. 
3. Here, you can find the 'Inquire whether to connect to the network when booting' menu.

title: Mobile data
description:
Mobile data, You can access the internet using mobile data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Data usage'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Mobile data' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of your device's screen to open the 'Quick settings panel' and toggle the 'Mobile data' icon to turn the feature on or off.

title: Allowed networks for Apps
description:
Allowed networks for Apps, In the app, you can set it to use only Wi-Fi, only mobile data, or both. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device. 
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Data usage' menu. 
3. Here, you can find the 'Allowed networks for apps' menu.

title: Data saver
description:
Data saver, Data Saver mode restricts app background data usage to reduce data consumption. When this option is enabled, the Data Saver mode icon appears in the status bar.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Data usage' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Data saver' menu.

In this menu, you can additionally set the following options:
 - 'Turn on now'
 - 'Apps that can always use data'

title: Do Not Disturb
description:
Do Not Disturb, The "Do Not Disturb" feature is a function that sets all calls and notifications to silent (no sound) except for items set as exceptions by the user.
Even if you have set the notification sound and volume, if Do Not Disturb is enabled, sounds from calls, texts, alarms, etc. are blocked, allowing you to maintain a quiet environment.
You can also set a specific time period to automatically activate Do Not Disturb, or turn it on according to specific situations such as meetings or exercise.
Additionally, it is possible to set up to receive calls or messages from favorite contacts or contacts registered in the exception list.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your mobile phone.
2. Select the 'Notification' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Do Not Disturb' menu.

Alternatively, you can open the 'Quick Settings' panel by swiping down from the top of the mobile phone screen and tap the 'Do Not Disturb' icon to turn the feature on or off.

title: Apps that can always use data
description:
Apps that can always use data, This is where you set specific apps to always use mobile data.
Generally, apps are deactivated or switched to a restricted state after a certain period to prevent them from using large amounts of data in the background or consuming excessive mobile data. However, in this menu, you can select specific apps to remove these restrictions and allow the apps to always use data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Apps that can always use data' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions for apps to always use data.

title: Device admin Apps
description:
Device admin Apps, Device manager apps can add password entry steps or security policies, remotely lock or reset the device, and disable various features including the camera.
They are mainly used to protect work-related data and should only grant device manager permissions to trusted apps.

You can check device manager apps here and grant or revoke permissions.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Device admin apps' menu.

2. Select 'Connections'> Select 'Bluetooth'> More View options> Select 'Advanced settings'.
3. You can find the 'Bluetooth Permission Request' menu here.

title: Screen resolution
description:

2. Select the 'Display' settings.

title: Adaptive colour tone

Face recognition., Learn about the face recognition feature in detail.

description:
Brighten the screen in the dark for face recognition, The screen lights up for a while when you try to recognize your face in a dark place for smooth identification.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Here, you can find the "Lighten the Screen in the Dark" menu.

description:
How to enable facial recognition only with open eyes, Here's how to enable facial recognition only with open eyes to make it safer.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Here, you can find the "Recognition only when your eyes are open" menu.

title: Keep the lock screen until you push the screen
description:
Keep the lock screen until you push the screen, When unlocked by face recognition, the lock screen is maintained until the screen is pushed. Turn off this feature to display the last screen you were using right away.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Keep the lock screen until you push the screen' menu.

title: Unlock with face
description:
Unlock with face, Instead of drawing patterns, entering PINs, or passwords, you can unlock the screen by face recognition.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Unlock it in the way you set it according to the instructions on the screen.
4. You can find the Unlock with Your Face menu here.

When the function is activated, the device can be is unlocked by recognizing your face and entering a separate lock method when you look straight at the screen from the lock screen. If your face is not recognized, enter the preset screen lock method.

title: Delete additional registered faces
description:
Delete additional registered faces, You can delete additional registered face data.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Unlock it in the way you set it according to the instructions on the screen.
4. Here, you can find the 'Delete Additional Registered Face' menu.

title: Add alternative appearance to enhance recognition
description:
Add alternative appearance to enhance recognition, To improve face recognition accuracy, press to register your face additionally for better recognition accuracy. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'Biometrics' > 'Face recognition' menu. 
3. Here, you can find the 'Add alternative appearance to enhance recognition' menu. 
 
When you select the item, the process to register your face will begin.
Adjust the position of the device so that your face fits within the frame on the screen. Once your face is properly recognized, the registration will be completed.

title: Delete Face Data
description:
Delete Face Data, You can delete registered face data.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Unlock it in the way you set it according to the instructions on the screen.
4. You can find the 'Delete Face Data' menu here.

Selecting an item deletes the registered face data and disables all face-related features.

title: Multi window for all apps
description:
Multi window for all apps, Apps allowed on cover screen' feature is a setting provided through the 'Labs' feature, allowing you to use certain applications even when the phone cover is closed.
To activate this setting, follow these steps:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Labs'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Apps allowed on cover screen' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can activate the desired apps from the list of provided apps.

title: Multi window for all apps
description:
Multi window for all apps, Use main screen navigation on cover screen' is a setting that belongs to the 'Labs' feature.
If you activate this setting, you will be able to use the navigation bar of the main screen (home button, recent apps button, back button, etc.) on the cover screen of your device as well. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Labs' menu.
3. Here, you will find the menu 'Use main screen navigation on cover screen'.

In other words, it's convenient because you can use the 'Use main screen navigation on cover screen' without opening the cover.

title: Wi-Fi network notifications
description:
Wi-Fi network notifications, You can be notified when an unencrypted public Wi-Fi network is detected nearby.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Wi-Fi' > Tap on the More option > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Wi-Fi network notifications' menu.

title: Show Wi-Fi pop-up

1. Open the 'Settings' app.

3. Here, you can find the 'Sync with Samsung Cloud' menu.

Please note that the same Samsung account is required.

This menu is only available when 'Automatic time zone' is turned off.

title: Work Profile Location
description:
Work Profile Location, The 'Location for work profile' menu is a setting on Android devices that provides location information to work accounts. This setting allows work accounts to access the user's location.
Generally, this setting is used when utilizing an account issued by a workplace or school for work purposes.

*Please check if a work profile is installed on your device. If a work profile is installed, then:
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Location'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Location for work profile' menu.

*Enabling this option allows the account to access the user's location information.

Please note that location services consume a lot of battery, so it is advisable to turn them off when not needed. Also, to protect privacy, it is important to share location information cautiously.
Additionally, please be aware that on some devices or OS versions, the name or location of this menu may vary or may not exist at all.

This feature only works when Wi-Fi is turned on.

title: Bluetooth
description:
Bluetooth, You can enable broadcast sound using AuraCast.

##Description of the setting
You can broadcast the music or sound from your device with AuraCast. Anyone within the signal range can listen to your broadcast.

##How to use this setting
When you press 'Start broadcast,' all media playing on your device will be broadcasted for others to hear.

##How to access this setting
'Settings' -> 'Connections' -> 'Bluetooth' -> Tap on More view option->'Broadcast sound using Auracast' -> 'Start broadcast'.

##Additional Information (Cautions, Restrictions, and Tips)
To listen to your broadcast, connect to a device that supports Bluetooth LE Audio, such as speakers or headphones. Others can also listen to the broadcast using a device that supports Bluetooth LE Audio. Check the user manual of your audio device manufacturer for connecting to the AuraCast broadcast.

title: Android version
description:
Android version, This is a menu where you can check the version of Android OS installed on the device. Android OS is a mobile operating system developed by Google and is used in numerous smartphones around the world.

2. Select the 'About phone'> 'Software information' menu.

description:
IMEI information, Provides information about the device's built-in hardware ID, the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI). The IMEI is the identification number of the wireless communication equipment, and each device is assigned a unique number. Use this number to separate devices, or to query for information about a particular device. In the 'IMEI Information' menu, you can check the IMEI number of your mobile phone. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'About phone'> 'Status information' menu.

description:

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD'> 'Always On Display' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Erase background' menu here. 
 
In the detail settings, only the main targets in the AOD background can be displayed. Optimized for human or animal-centered photography.

title: Show Lock screen wallpaper
description:
Show Lock screen wallpaper, Set the option to cover the wallpaper together on the AOD screen. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD'> 'Always On Display' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Show Lock screen wallpaper' menu here. 
 
In the detail settings, you can select the option to display the wallpaper on the AOD screen.

title: Roaming clock
description:
Roaming clock, Set the dual clock to appear on the lock screen when roaming. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Roaming clock' menu here. 
 
In the detail settings, you can adjust the current time and date. You can also turn on the time setting automatically, or manually set it to the desired city and time zone.

title: Touch and hold to edit
description:
Touch and hold to edit, Set up to edit the screen by long pressing on the lock screen.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your mobile phone.
2. Select the 'Lock Screen and AOD' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Long Press to Edit' menu.
4. You can turn this feature on and off through its menu switch.

title: Always On Display
description:
Always On Display, Set the screen to display information while the screen is turned off.
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Always On Display' menu here.

title: Extend Unlock
description:
Extend Unlock, When the product recognizes a trusted place or device, the screen lock is automatically unlocked and you can set it to remain unlocked. 
For example, if you set your home address as a trusted place, the location is recognized when you go home and the screen lock is automatically unlocked. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Extend Unlock' menu here. 
 
If you select an item, you will see settings that skip keeping the lock screen in certain situations. For example, there are options such as specifying a trusted place or device.

title: Settings - Lock screen and AOD - Screen lock method
description:
Settings - Lock screen and AOD - Screen lock method, If you choose a screen lock method such as a pattern, PIN, password, or biometric information, you can protect personal information stored on the product by preventing others from easily accessing it. Once you set a screen lock, you must unlock the product using the lock method you set each time you turn on the screen.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your phone.
2. Select the ‘Lock screen and AOD’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Screen lock method’ menu.

In detailed settings, you can select one of various lock methods such as pattern, PIN, and password.
Just select the locking method you want and set it.

This setting allows you to enhance security by using the locking method you choose when locking the screen on your phone.

title: Lock screen and AOD
description:
Lock screen and AOD, When you turn off the screen by pressing the side button, it automatically locks. It is locked even if the screen is automatically turned off because the product has not been used for a certain period of time. To unlock the lock screen, push the screen in any direction with the screen on. If the screen is off, press the side button first. Or double-click the screen. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Lock screen and AOD' menu. 
 
If you select the item, you can select information to be displayed on the lock screen, how to unlock it, and information to be displayed on the AOD.

title: App shortcuts
description:
App shortcuts, Certain key combinations of physical keyboards can be specified as application shortcuts. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'General management'> 'Physical keyboard'> 'Customise keys' menu. 
3. You can find the 'App shortcuts' menu here.

title: Customize keys
description:
Customize keys, You can set specific keys on the hardware keyboard to user-specified keys.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Physical keyboard' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Customize keys' menu.

title: Change language shortcut
description:
Change language shortcut, You can assign a shortcut key to change the hardware keyboard input language.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Physical keyboard' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Change language shortcut' menu.

You can assign keys such as 'Shift + Space', 'Control + Space', or 'Left Alt + Shift' as the language switch shortcut. 
Multiple keys can be assigned.

title: Keyboard shortcuts
description:
Keyboard shortcuts, Here is how you can get your device to display descriptions of hardware keyboard shortcuts on the screen:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Physical keyboard' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Keyboard shortcuts' menu.

In the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, you can check the shortcuts set for executing specific functions and apps.

title: Display Screen Keyboard
description:
Display Screen Keyboard, This is a menu where you can change the settings for displaying the screen keyboard even when using a hardware keyboard.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General' > 'Hardware Keyboard' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Display Screen Keyboard' menu.
4. The settings can be changed according to the On/Off switch configuration.

title: Factory data reset
description:
Factory data reset, You can reset the device. All data, including files and downloaded apps, will be deleted.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Factory data reset' menu.

The following data will be deleted from the device:
- 'Google account'
- 'System and app data'
- 'Settings'
- 'Downloaded apps'
- 'Music'
- 'Pictures'
- 'All other user data'
- 'Service provider apps and content'
- 'Private keys stored in Samsung Blockchain Keystore'

title: Reset accessibility settings
description:
Reset accessibility settings, This feature allows you to revert accessibility settings to their original state.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Reset'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Reset accessibility settings' menu.

You can reset all accessibility settings.
Settings related to keyboard and text size, as well as accessibility settings for downloaded apps, will not be reset or changed. Personal data will not be affected.

title: Reset Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings
description:
Reset Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings, This feature resets Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings to their default state. Using this feature will delete network profiles, saved Wi-Fi passwords, and the list of paired Bluetooth devices.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Reset Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings' menu.

All Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings will be reset and this action cannot be undone.

title: Reset mobile network settings
description:
Reset mobile network settings, This is the process of resetting all settings related to the mobile network, to their initial state. In other words, it means returning network-related settings such as network type, APN settings, and network priority to their original state.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Reset mobile network settings' menu.

Doing this will reset all the mobile network settings.

title: Reset all settings
description:
Reset all settings, Here are the steps to reset the product setting value:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Reset all settings' menu.

Everything will be reset except for the following items:
- 'Security settings'
- 'Language settings'
- 'Accounts'
- 'Personal data'
- 'Settings for downloaded apps'

title: External storage transfer
description:
External storage transfer, Back up data to a USB storage device or SD card. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'External storage backup' menu.

You can restore data on this device or another device using Smart Switch.

title: Temporary cloud backup
description:
Temporary cloud backup, Back up data to Samsung Cloud without storage limits for up to 30 days or restore backed up data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Reset' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Temporary cloud backup' menu.

title: Add language
description:
Add language, You can add a language to use on your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Language' menu.
3. Here, you can find the '+ Add language' menu.

title: Use 24-hour format
description:
Use 24-hour format, This is the setting to use the time display in either 12-hour or 24-hour format.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Date and time' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Use 24-hour format' option.

title: Set time zone based on location
description:
Set time zone based on location, We use the device's location information to check the time zone. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Date and time'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Set time zone based on location' option.

This can help find the correct time zone if the mobile network provides the wrong time zone.

title: Automatic time zone
description:
Automatic time zone, We use the time zone that is provided by the network. To enable this setting:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Date and time' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Automatic time zone' menu.

title: Automatic date and time
description:
Automatic date and time, Here is a way to use the date and time provided by the network.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Date and time' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Automatic date and time' option.

title: Microsoft SwiftKey Keyboard
description:
Microsoft SwiftKey Keyboard, The Microsoft SwiftKey Keyboard settings offer predictive input and auto-completion features. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Keyboard list and default' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Microsoft SwiftKey Keyboard' menu.

This keyboard learns your typing habits and preferences to provide a personalized experience.

title: Google Voice Typing
description:
Google Voice Typing, You can input text with your voice instead of a keyboard, or execute simple commands.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'General management' > 'Keyboard list and default' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Google Voice Typing' menu.

title: Keyboard button on navigation bar
description:
Keyboard button on navigation bar, When a feature is enabled, a keyboard icon will be displayed in the navigation bar, allowing you to quickly open and close the keyboard.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Keyboard list and default' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Keyboard button on navigation bar' menu.

title: Default keyboard
description:
Default keyboard, This is a settings menu where you can select the default type of keyboard to use on your device.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' > 'Keyboard list and default' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Default keyboard' menu.

title: General management
description:
General management, We offer a menu where you can change basic and general settings of the product or initialize the product.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.

Here, you can see various general settings options such as reset, language and input method, date and time, etc.

title: Reset
description:
Reset, Here are the steps to reset the product settings or delete all data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Reset' menu.

In detailed settings, you can proceed with:
‒ 'Reset all settings'
‒ 'Reset mobile network settings'
‒ 'Reset Wi-Fi and Bluetooth settings'
‒ 'Reset accessibility settings'
‒ 'Factory data reset'.

title: Passwords, passkeys, and autofill
description:
Passwords, passkeys, and autofill, You can set up basic services and manage passwords, passkeys, and autofill for all services.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Passwords, passkeys, and autofill' menu.

In the detailed settings, if you configure services to use 'Passwords, passkeys, and autofill', you can log in to apps or websites with biometric authentication or screen lock, and automatically fill in information such as addresses, passwords, and credit card numbers.

title: Mouse and trackpad
description:
Mouse and trackpad, Set up the usage environment for an external mouse or trackpad.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Mouse and trackpad' menu.

In this menu, you can configure the following detailed settings:

- 'Pointer speed': Adjust the pointer movement speed when using a mouse or trackpad.
- 'Wheel scrolling speed': Adjust the scroll speed when using the mouse wheel scroll.
- 'Enhance pointer precision': Adjust the mouse cursor speed to match your manipulation speed.
- 'Pointer size and color': Enlarge the pointer for better visibility when using a mouse or touchpad. You can also change the pointer color.
- 'Primary mouse button': Set the primary button of the mouse. You can set the primary button to left or right according to your preference.
- 'Secondary button': Set the secondary button of the mouse.
- 'Middle button': Set the wheel button of the mouse.
- 'Additional button 1': Configure the additional button 1 of the mouse. You can select one of the following settings: (No Action, View Apps Screen, Home, Recent, Back, View Notifications, Open Quick Settings, Open App, etc.)
- 'Additional button 2': Configure the additional button 2 of the mouse. You can select one of the following settings: (No Action, Forward, View Apps Screen, Home, Recent, Back, View Notifications, Open Quick Settings, Open App, etc.)

title: Physical keyboard
description:
Physical keyboard, Configure the usage environment of the external keyboard.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Physical keyboard' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can configure shortcuts or special keys for the hardware keyboard.

title: Keyboard list and default
description:
Keyboard list and default, You can select the type of keyboard to use by default on your device and configure additional keyboard options, in the detailed settings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Keyboard list and default' menu.

title: Date and time
description:
Date and time, You can set the way you want your device to display the time and date.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Date and time' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can adjust the date, time, time zone, etc.

title: Language packs
description:
Language packs, You can manage the list of language packs used in AI features provided on your mobile phone, such as voice input, text reading, and translation.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Language packs' menu.

In the detailed settings, a list of language packs that are installed or available for use after installation is provided.
By pressing the download button, you can download the desired language pack, or you can free up storage space on your device by deleting installed language packs through the 'Edit' menu.

title: App languages
description:
App languages, You can set different languages for each app installed on your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'General management' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'App languages' menu.

When you select this item, a screen will appear where you can choose the language to use for each app separately from the system language.
Select the desired language and press 'confirm', and the language of the app will change.

title: Language
description:
Language, Guide on How to Set the Language on Galaxy Devices

Galaxy smartphones come with the regional language of the country where they are released, as well as globally widespread languages like English, French, and Spanish. However, it is difficult to install additional languages beyond those that are pre-installed.

Fortunately, a variety of input languages are available. Now, let's explain how to check and change the language on your device.

##How to Check and Change the Language in Use on Your Device
1. Go to 'Settings' 
2. Select 'General management' > 'Language' to see the list of additional languages available.
You can add a new language by selecting the '+ Add language' button.
Press the edit button and change the order of the language list to change the system language.

##How to Delete an Added Language
1. Go to 'Settings'
2. Select 'General management' > 'Language' > 'Edit'
Here, find the language you want to delete.

Additionally, starting from Android 13(T) OS, there is a new feature called 'App Language' that allows you to set different languages for each app! This feature is very convenient as you can select languages separately for each app.

title: Only record top screen in Flex mode
description:
Only record top screen in Flex mode, When using the screen recording function in Flex mode, only the top screen is recorded when you start the screen recording.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Only record top screen in Flex mode'.

This is how you can set whether to record only the top screen when using the screen recording function in Flex mode.

title: Save screen recordings in
description:
Save screen recordings in, You can check the storage location of the screen recording file. Create a new folder by pressing the 'add' button in the screen recording folder, or save the file here by pressing the 'done' button.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Save screen recordings in'.

You can set the storage location of the file generated after screen recording.

title: Show taps and touches
description:
Show taps and touches, When recording the screen, the area where the user touches the screen can be indentified. This can particularly be useful for videos that require touch area confirmation.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Show taps and touches'.

With this, you will be able to check the parts where the user touches the screen while recording.

title: Selfie video size
description:
Selfie video size, You can adjust the size of the self-recorded video. It is divided into 5 sizes, from 'Small' to 'Large'.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Selfie video size'.

You can follow these steps to adjust the size of the video when recording a self-video.

title: Video quality
description:
Video quality, You can select the video quality to be saved when recording the screen. There are three levels: High (1080p), Medium (720p), and Low (480p).

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Video quality'.

This is how you can select the video quality when using the screen recording feature.

title: Record sound
description:
Record sound, You can modify the settings related to the sound recorded during screen recording (you can choose not to record sound, record only the device's media sound, or record both media sound and sound input from the microphone).

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Record sound'.

You can set whether to record sound when using the screen recording feature.

title: Save screenshots in
description:
Save screenshots in, You can check the storage location of a screenshot. Create a new folder by pressing the add or plus button in the screenshot folder or save files here by pressing the 'done' button.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on the Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Save screenshots in'.

With this, you can set the location to save the captured images.

title: Format
description:
Format, You can choose the storage format for screenshots. Here's how:

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Format'.

title: Save original screenshots
description:
Save original screenshots, Even if you edit a screenshot, you can restore it to its original in the Gallery, but it uses more storage space.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Save original screenshots'.

You can set whether to save the original image in addition to the edited image after capturing.

title: Delete after sharing
description:
Delete after sharing, When sharing captured images, you can automatically select the option to delete after sharing.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 
4. Select 'Delete after sharing'.

You can set whether to delete the original image after sharing the captured image.

title: Hide status bar and navigation bar
description:
Hide status bar and navigation bar, When capturing a screen, you can hide the status bar and navigation bar on the captured screen.

 1. Run the 'Settings' app on the Galaxy device. 
 2. Select the 'Advanced Features' menu. 
 3. Here you can find the 'Screen Capture and Screen Recording' menu. You can set whether to hide the status bar and navigation bar after capturing.

You can also use this method if you only want to capture the app screen.

title: Show toolbar after capturing
description:
Show toolbar after capturing, When you take a screenshot, a toolbar appears that allows for various additional tasks such as editing and sharing. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device. 
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu. 
3. Select the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu.
4. Here, you will find the 'Show toolbar after capturing' option.

You can set whether to display the toolbar after capturing.

title: About advanced intelligence
description:
About advanced intelligence, With advanced intelligence and superior machine learning technology, you can utilize various features on Galaxy devices. You can interpret in real-time during calls, generate summaries of notes and web pages, and edit photos in new ways.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Galaxy AI' menu.

If you don't follow these rules, your system will be hampered.

title: Data processing only within the device (on-device mode)
description:
Data processing only within the device (on-device mode), To enhance your privacy when using Enhanced Intelligence features, you can set your data to be processed only on your device. Some features of enhanced intelligence require processing data online to provide better results.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Galaxy AI’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Data processing only on device’ menu.

title: Touchpad gesture help
description:
Touchpad gesture help, This section provides an explanation of gestures when using the touchpad in Flex mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Flex mode panel' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Touchpad gesture help' menu.

title: Navigate your screen
description:
Navigate your screen, You can change the position of the scroll wheel on the touchpad of the Flex Mode panel to suit your preference.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Flex mode panel' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Scroll wheel position' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can change the 'Scroll wheel position' option to the right or left.

title: Auto show panel when folded
description:
Auto show panel when folded, If you set the 'Auto show panel when folded' feature to 'on' for each app, the Flex mode panel will automatically appear when entering Flex mode while using that app.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Flex mode panel' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Auto show panel when folded' menu.

In the detailed settings, if you want to automatically show the Flex mode panel for all apps that support Flex mode, activate the 'All supported apps' option.

title: Method to power off the device
description:
Method to power off the device, Here's how to power off your device:

Press the ## button to turn off the power
If you press the side button and the volume down button at the same time, the power off or restart menu will appear. You can select the option you want here.

## Pull down the top bar to turn off the power
You can choose to power off or restart by pulling down the top bar and selecting the power icon.

## Force power off
If the screen freezes due to a temporary error, etc., press and hold the side button and volume (down) button simultaneously for more than 7 seconds to automatically reboot.

## Power off with the side button
You can quickly launch power options by setting the 'Press and hold' option during 'Side button' settings.
The 'Press and hold' option will perform the user-selected action when the side button is pressed and held for more than 2 seconds.

To use this feature, set it as follows.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Useful features’ > ‘Side button’ menu.
3. Here, you can find the menu.

title: Dark mode apps
description:
Dark mode apps, Dark Mode App' feature allows you to select apps that will always use dark mode. Even if the phone is set to light mode, dark mode will always be applied, and if you set the app to use light mode in its settings, it won't be affected by this setting.
To use this feature, set it up as follows.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Labs'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Dark mode apps' menu.

*This feature may not be supported on some devices.

title: Landscape view for portrait apps
description:
Landscape view for portrait apps, Landscape view for portrait apps' feature allows apps locked in portrait mode to display in landscape mode when the device is held horizontally. You can either maintain the app's original aspect ratio or adjust the ratio to display in full screen.
To use this feature, set it up as follows.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Labs' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Landscape view for portrait apps' menu.

*This feature may not be supported on some devices.

title: Multi window for all apps
description:
Multi window for all apps, The multi-window support feature for all apps allows you to use the pop-up screen and split-screen features in all apps, including those not designed for multi-window on mobile phones.
To use this feature, set it up as follows.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Labs' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Multi window for all apps' menu.

*This feature may not be supported on some devices.

title: Palm swipe to capture
description:
Palm swipe to capture, Swipe to capture' feature allows you to capture the screen by placing the side of your hand on the screen and swiping from right to left or vice versa. The captured screen can be viewed in the gallery. 
To use this feature, set it up as follows.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. You can find the 'Palm swipe to capture' menu here.

The screen cannot be captured while using some apps and features.

title: Alert when phone picked up
description:
Alert when phone picked up, Alert when phone picked up' feature will notify you with a vibration if there are missed calls or unread messages when you pick up your phone.
To use this feature, follow the steps below.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. You can find the 'Alert when phone picked up' menu here.

title: Palm touch to turn off screen
description:
Palm touch to turn off screen, Turn off the screen with a palm touch' is a feature that allows you to turn off the screen by touching it with your palm.
To use this feature, follow the steps below.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Palm touch to turn off screen' menu.

It does not work when the keyboard is displayed on the screen.

title: Double tap to turn off screen
description:
Double tap to turn off screen, Double tap to turn off screen' is a feature that allows you to turn off the screen by double-tapping an empty space on the home or lock screen of your device.
To use this feature, please set it up in the following way.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Double tap to turn off screen' menu.

title: Double tap to turn on screen
description:
Double tap to turn on screen, Double tap to turn on screen' is a feature that turns on the screen when you double-tap the device's screen.
To use this feature, follow the steps below.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Double tap to turn on screen' option.

title: Lift to wake
description:
Lift to wake, The 'Lift to wake' feature automatically turns on the screen when you lift your phone.
To use this feature, set it up as follows.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. You can find the 'Lift to wake' menu here.

title: Mute with gestures
description:
Mute with gestures, Mute with gestures' is a feature used to quickly mute sounds on your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' menu.
3. You can find the 'Mute with gestures' menu here.

When this feature is enabled, if you flip your device over or cover the screen with your hand when an alarm, notification, or media sound plays, the sound and vibration will automatically be turned off. This can be particularly useful during meetings or in public places when you get a sudden call or notification.

title: Full screen in Split screen view
description:
Full screen in Split screen view, Hide the status bar and navigation bar to see the screen of each app in a better way. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Multi window' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Full screen in Split screen view' menu.

To see the hidden status bar and navigation bar again, swipe the screen from bottom to top or top to bottom.

title: Full screen in Split screen view
description:
Full screen in Split screen view, You can press the window handle to display the menu. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' > 'Multi window' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Show multi window menu with 1 window' menu.

*This feature is not supported on the cover screen.

title: Swipe to change to pop-up screen
description:
Swipe to change to pop-up screen, You can change to a pop-up screen by sliding the top corner of the screen to the center.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Useful Features’ > ‘Multi Window’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Slide to change to pop-up screen’ menu.

You can change the pop-up motion recognition area to your preferred size by changing the size of the top corner area.
The default corner area size is level 2, and you can set the size from level 1 to level 5.

title: Swipe for split screen
description:
Swipe for split screen, You can change to split screen by swiping from the side or bottom of the main screen with two fingers or by swiping from the bottom of the cover screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Advanced features' > 'Multi window' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Swipe to split screen' menu.

title: Screenshots and screen recordings
description:
Screenshots and screen recordings, You can change the screen capture and screen recording settings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can configure the 'Screenshots and screen recordings' menu. 

##In the 'Screenshots' menu, you can set options like: 
‒ 'Show toolbar after capturing'
‒ 'Delete after sharing'
‒ 'Hide status and navigation bars'
‒ 'Save original screenshots'
‒ 'Format'
‒ 'Save screenshots in'. 

##In the 'Screen recordings' menu, you can configure settings like:
‒ 'Record sound'
‒ 'Video quality'
‒ 'Selfie video size'
‒ 'Show taps and touches'
‒ 'Only record top screen in Flex mode'
‒ 'Save screen recordings in'. 

##You can take screenshots using the following methods: 
- Press the side button and volume down button simultaneously.
- Go to 'Settings' > 'Advanced features' > 'Motions and gestures' > Turn on the 'Palm swipe to capture' feature, and swipe the edge of your hand across the screen to capture. 

##You can start screen recording using the following method: 
- Pull down the top bar to reveal the 'Screen recorder' feature. Turn it on, and recording will start after 3 seconds.

title: Useful features
description:
Useful features, You can activate useful features provided by the device and set the usage environment for each feature.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Useful Features' menu.
3. Here, you can set various useful features such as 'Motion and Gestures', 'One-handed Operation Mode', and 'Laboratory'.

title: Dual Messenger
description:
Dual Messenger, Log in to your favorite social app with your second account. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Dual Messenger' menu here. 
 
In the detailed settings, you can select an app to use as a dual messenger from the currently installed messenger apps. 
You can select the app you want and use it as a dual messenger. 

If you set it like this, you can create another same messenger account on your phone and use it for different purposes.

title: Video brightness
description:
Video brightness, You can watch videos with brighter and clearer colors than the original. Here is how to set the video brightness feature:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. You can find the 'Video brightness' menu here.

In detailed settings, if you select the 'Bright' option, you can choose the apps to support.

This menu can be set as follows:
##Normal
Play videos with the same brightness and color settings as your phone.

##Bright
Brighten the screen and enhance the colors while watching videos.

However, this feature may not be supported by some apps.

title: One-handed mode
description:
One-handed mode, One-Handed Operation Mode' is a feature that reduces the screen size to make it easier to operate the device with one hand. Using this mode, the screen size is reduced, making it convenient for users with small hands or when using the device in narrow spaces.

The method to activate 'One-Handed Operation Mode' is as follows:
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'One-handed mode' menu.

The operation method can be set as follows:
##Gesture
If you select the 'Gesture' option, you can activate 'One-handed mode' by swiping down from the center edge of the bottom of the screen.

##Button
If you select the 'Button' option, you can activate 'One-handed mode' by double-pressing the home button.

title: Motion and Gesture
description:
Motion and Gesture, You can turn on/off the Motion and Gesture feature or set up its usage environment.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Useful Features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Motion and Gesture' menu.

By selecting this item, you can view and change various motion and gesture settings such as 'Swipe with hand to capture', 'Double tap to turn off screen', 'Pick up to turn on screen', 'Mute with gesture', etc.

By setting it this way, it becomes possible to operate more conveniently and intuitively through 'Motion and Gesture' on your device.

title: Settings - Useful features - Multi window
description:
Settings - Useful features - Multi window, You can set how to run Multi-Window and the usage environment when running it.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Useful Features’ menu.
3. You can find the ‘Multi Window’ menu here.

In the menu, you can set the slide-to-split screen change and slide-to-pop-up screen settings, which are functions that allow you to enter multi-window mode through gestures, and you can also select a function that allows you to view the split screen wider.

title: Settings - Useful Features - Flex Mode Panel
description:
Settings - Useful Features - Flex Mode Panel, When you close the device and launch the Flex Mode panel, the app you are using will be displayed at the top of the screen and useful controllers when using the app will be displayed at the bottom.
The Flex Mode panel can be launched or hidden with the button on the navigation bar.

## How to set up
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Useful Features’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Flex Mode Panel’ menu.

※ The flex mode panel can only be used in apps that support multi-window. To use the flex mode panel, you must activate the screen auto-rotation option.
※ Flex mode panels are only available in apps that support multi-windows, and screen auto-rotation options must be activated to use Flex mode panels.

title: Labs
description:
Labs, You can use the new features provided in the device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Labs' menu.

When you select this item, various experimental features that you can try out will be listed. Additionally, you can activate and use the desired features.

title: Bixby
description:
Bixby, "Bixby" allows you to intuitively and conveniently execute various functions and services through voice commands. You can call Bixby by saying "Hi Bixby" or by long pressing the side button.

##How to Set Up Bixby
Check your Bixby usage environment and set it up according to your preference.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Advanced Features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Bixby' menu.

By selecting this item, you can set up and check Bixby according to your usage environment.

##How to Update Bixby
You can check for updates and app information of Bixby in 'Bixby App Info'.
1. Go into the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced Features' from the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby' within 'Advanced Features'.
4. Choose 'Bixby App Info' within ‘Bixby’.

##Languages and Voice Styles for Bixby
You can talk to Bixby in various languages and use more voice styles. Check out various voice styles supported for each language, and choose a style that suits your preference.
1. Go into the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced Features' from the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby' within ‘Advanced Features’.
4. Choose ‘Languages & Voice Styles’ within ‘Bixby’.

title: Video call effects
description:
Video call effects, You can use the features of Samsung Camera in apps that support the 'Video Call Effects' feature. 

## Samsung Camera Features in Basic Video Call Apps
1. Please start a video call.
2. Select 'Filter'.
