3. Here, you can set various filters such as background effects and color tone effects.

## Samsung Camera Features in Other Video Call Apps
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Useful Features' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Video Call Effects' menu.

When using the camera in supported apps, if you run the 'Quick Panel', you can turn off and on various camera effects such as background effects, automatic framing, color tone, and skin correction selected in the 'Settings' app.

title: Side button
description:
Side button, Select the app or function you want to run with the side button.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Useful features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Side button' menu.
4. Here, select the desired action from the options of 'Double press' or 'Long press'.

The 'Double press' option allows you to select the following actions or detailed functions of the application, and the user-selected action will be performed when the side button is pressed twice quickly. 
- 'Camera'
- 'Flashlight'
- 'Magnifying glass'
- 'Voice recording'
- 'Samsung Notes'
- 'Samsung Capture'
- 'Modes and routines'
- 'Open application'

The 'Long press' option allows you to select the following actions, and the user-selected action will be performed when the side button is pressed and held for more than 2 seconds. 
- 'Digital assistant'
- 'Bixby'
- 'Power off menu'


Setting it up this way will allow you to use the side button of your phone in more diverse and useful ways.

title: Galaxy AI
description:
Galaxy AI, The Galaxy AI menu offers advanced AI-based enhanced intelligence features on Galaxy devices, learning and understanding users' daily life patterns and habits to provide a more convenient and personalized user experience. Including many AI-based features, it helps in increasing user convenience and efficiency. 

##To use this feature, set it up as follows:
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Galaxy AI' menu.

Here, you can use the features related to 'Galaxy AI'.
These Galaxy AI (enhanced intelligence) features continuously evolve with updates, allowing them to be optimized to meet users' requirements.

title: Recent access
description:
Recent access, Check the information of apps that have recently requested location information of your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Recent access' menu.

title: Bluetooth scanning
description:
Bluetooth scanning, Even if Bluetooth is turned off, the app uses Bluetooth for accurate location tracking.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' > 'Location services' menu.
3. You can enable the 'Bluetooth scanning' feature under 'Improve accuracy'.

title: Wi-Fi scanning
description:
Wi-Fi scanning, Even when Wi-Fi is turned off, the app uses Wi-Fi for accurate location identification.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' > 'Location services' menu.
3. You can enable the 'Wi-Fi scanning' feature under 'Improve accuracy'.

title: Location
description:
Location, You can change the settings regarding the use of location information.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the device's screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and tap the 'Location' icon to turn the feature on or off.

title: Location services
description:
Location services, Allow the use of Wi-Fi or Bluetooth to improve location accuracy even when Wi-Fi or Bluetooth is turned off. You can also check the list of location services in use by the product.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' > 'Location services' menu.

When you select the relevant item, menus related to location services and items to improve location accuracy will appear.
To further enhance location accuracy, please enable these 2 settings:
‒ 'Wi-Fi scanning' 
‒ 'Bluetooth scanning'

title: App Permissions
description:
App Permissions, You can check the list of apps that have permission to access your device's location information and change permission settings.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Location' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'App Permissions' menu.

There are three types of app permissions for location information:
1. "Allow Only While Using App" means that permission is granted to access location information only while using the app.
2. "Always Allow" means that permission is granted for the app to access location information even when you're not using it.
3. "Not Allowed" means that under no circumstances does the app have permission to access location information.

title: Data roaming
description:
Data roaming, Set up to use data services even while roaming abroad.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Mobile networks' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Data roaming' menu.
* The menus provided may differ depending on the device.

By activating 'Data roaming', you can use data services even while roaming abroad.

title: Network operators
description:
Network operators, You can select a mobile operator in the roaming area.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Connections'> 'Overseas roaming' menu.
3. You can find the 'Select roaming mobile carrier' menu here.

If you activate the function by pressing the automatic selection switch, the mobile carrier is automatically selected based on the current location when the product is powered on.
In addition, if you disable the function by pressing the automatic selection switch, you can directly select the desired mobile carrier.

title: Bluetooth Search History
description:
Bluetooth Search History, Bluetooth Search History
  A. Description of the Setting
    It displays a list of apps that excessively search for nearby Bluetooth devices when the screen is off.

  B. How to Utilize this Setting
    To reduce battery usage, you should decrease the search frequency, and you can either delete the apps listed or turn off Bluetooth-related features in the app settings.

  C. How to Access this Setting
    Select the notification that has been issued:
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Bluetooth' > More options from 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Bluetooth Search History' menu.

  D. Additional Information (Warnings, Restrictions and Tips)
    Depending on the app, there may not be an option to turn off Bluetooth-related features. 
     In this case, you can change it to not allow near device permissions of the app.

title: Block registration request pop-up
description:
Block registration request pop-up, Block registration request pop-up

## Description
- This function blocks the connection request popup when a connection request is received from an unwanted device.

# # # How to use
- The block button of the pairing popup is activated when the pairing popup appears while the Bluetooth setting app is closed (background).
- When the block button is activated, press the block button to no longer pop up the device.

## How to enter
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Bluetooth
4. Select 'Advanced Settings' from More View (⋮) menu
6. Block registration request pop-up

## Cautions, Constraints and Tips
- In the case of BLE devices, the Bluetooth address may be continuously changed, so the registration request pop-up blocking function is not supported.

title: Bluetooth control history
description:
Bluetooth control history, ##Check Bluetooth Usage History by App
A. Setting description
If there are apps installed on the user's device that have performed actions to turn the Bluetooth function on/off, you can check the history.

B. How to use this setting
1. If the Bluetooth is automatically turned on/off in an unwanted situation, you can use this feature to verify which app turned the Bluetooth on/off.
2. If you think a specific app is using Bluetooth too frequently, you can select that app and move to 'Accessibility Permission Management' to restrict Bluetooth permissions for that app.

C. How to enter this setting
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Bluetooth' > 'Advanced settings' in the More Options menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Bluetooth control history' menu.

title: Ringtone synchronization
description:
Ringtone synchronization, The 'Bell Sound Synchronization' function sets whether to use the ring tone of the terminal when answering a call from the connected Bluetooth device.

# Setup entry path
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Bluetooth
4. Select 'Advanced Settings' from More View (⋮) menu at the top of the screen
3. Ringtone synchronization

# How to set
Turn on ringtone synchronization to use the terminal's ringtone when answering a call from a connected Bluetooth device.
Turn off ringtone synchronization to use the ringtone of the Bluetooth device when answering a call from the connected Bluetooth device.

However, if the Bluetooth device does not support ringtone synchronization, the ringtone of the Bluetooth device is played even when ringtone synchronization is turned on.

title: Music Share
description:
Music Share, How to listen to music on Bluetooth speaker from a friend's device.

How to use this setting
1. Make sure your device and the Bluetooth speaker are connected.
2. Open settings on your device, select device connections, and then turn on the Music Share switch.
 When you select Music Share, you can use additional features such as setting the sharing target.
3. Select your speaker from the Bluetooth device list on your friend's device.
4. Accept the connection.

 Your speaker will be shared.

How to access this setting
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Bluetooth' > 'Advanced settings' menu in the More options.
3. You can find the 'Music Share' menu here.

Additional information (Precautions, limitations, and tips)
 Both Wi-Fi and Bluetooth must be turned on for both devices while listening to music.

title: Sync with Samsung Cloud
description:
Sync with Samsung Cloud, ##Synchronization with Samsung Cloud in the Bluetooth menu of connection settings
A. Explanation of the setting itself
1. It is available after logging into 'Samsung Cloud'.
2. You can securely back up and restore Bluetooth data from your device or previous devices.

B. How to use this setting
1. Through this feature setting, you can retrieve and save devices with usage history from the same account devices.

C. How to access this setting
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Bluetooth' > 'Advanced settings' in the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Sync with Samsung Cloud' menu.

D. Additional information (cautions, limitations, and tips)
1. Synchronization is possible for registered Galaxy Home speakers and Galaxy Buds devices. For backup/restoration of other devices, use the 'Smart Switch' app.
2. Be cautious as synchronization may be delayed if the network environment is unstable or unavailable.

title: Prioritize real-time traffic
description:
Prioritize real-time traffic, The real-time traffic prioritization feature prioritizes real-time performance-critical traffic, such as online games or VoIP/Video Calls, among the various devices connected to the hotspot, minimizing the delay in data transmission/reception caused by other traffic.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering' > 'Mobile Hotspot'.
3. Select the option 'Prioritize real-time traffic'.

*Here, you can activate/deactivate this feature by using it's toggle button.
When using this feature, other internet usage may experience delays, so it is recommended to enable this feature only when using real-time games or VoIP/Video Calls.

title: One-time password
description:
One-time password, One-Time or disposable passwords prevent hotspot password leakage by providing separate passwords to share one-time with others. This one-time password is automatically updated every time you turn on your mobile hotspot, preventing the reuse of shared previous one-time passwords.

##How to turn on One-Time or disposable password function:
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Mobile hotspot and tethering' > 'Mobile Hotspot'.
3. Activate 'One-time password' by selecting an item.
4. Turn on your mobile hotspot and share the password generated by 'One-time password' with others.

##How to turn off One-Time or disposable password function:
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Mobile hotspot and tethering' > 'Mobile hotspot'.
3. Please disable 'One-time password'.

title: Auto Hotspot
description:
Auto Hotspot, Hotspot Auto-Launch provides a feature that allows devices requiring an internet connection to turn on and connect to a hotspot directly, without the user needing to operate the hotspot device.

To use the Hotspot Auto-Launch feature, both the hotspot terminal and the terminal you want to connect to the hotspot must be logged into the same Samsung account or included in a family group.

##How to Turn On the Hotspot Auto-Launch Feature:
- On the hotspot terminal
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Log in to your Samsung account.
3. Select 'Connections' > 'More connection settings'.
4. Enable the 'Nearby device scanning' feature.
5. Go back to 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering' > 'Mobile Hotspot'.
6. Enable 'Auto Hotspot' here.

- On the terminal requiring an internet connection
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Log in to your Samsung account.
3. Select 'Connections' > 'More connection settings'.
4. Enable the 'Nearby device scanning' feature here.
5. Go back to 'Connections' > 'Wi-Fi'.
6. Select the hotspot that appears at the top of the Wi-Fi search list, and the hotspot will turn on and connect.

##How to Turn Off the Hotspot Auto-Launch Feature:
Disable 'Auto Hotspot' on the hotspot terminal.

title: Ethernet tethering
description:
Ethernet tethering, Ethernet tethering is a feature that provides internet to other devices using my device as a Wi-Fi router.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on my device.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Ethernet Tethering' menu. The Ethernet tethering menu will be disabled if the Ethernet adapter is not connected.

To use Ethernet tethering, simply connect the adapter and turn on the switch.

title: USB tethering
description:
USB tethering, USB tethering refers to connecting a mobile device with internet access to another device using a USB cable. 

By using this feature, the mobile device provides internet connectivity, allowing the connected device to share the internet. USB tethering is particularly useful for devices where mobility is important, such as laptops or tablets. Additionally, a wired connection can offer more stable internet access compared to wireless connections. To use this feature, first navigate to 'Mobile Hotspot' or 'Tethering Settings' on your mobile device, then connect the mobile device to the other device you want to connect to the internet with a USB cable and enable USB tethering.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering'.
3. You will find the 'USB tethering' menu here.

The 'USB tethering' menu will be disabled if the USB cable is not connected.
To use USB tethering, please connect the USB cable.

title: Explanation of the 'Bluetooth Tethering' settings menu
description:
Explanation of the 'Bluetooth Tethering' settings menu, You can use your device's internet connection with other devices via Bluetooth.

A. Description of the setting

  This feature allows users to connect their device, which is connected to a network, to another device via Bluetooth and share their network (LTE, Wi-Fi data) with the other device.

  Similar tethering features include USB tethering and mobile hotspot.

B. How to use this setting

  You can enable data usage by connecting devices that have difficulty connecting to a network on their own, such as laptops, tablets, or car navigation systems, via Bluetooth tethering.

C. How to access this setting

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.

2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering' menu.

3. You will find the 'Bluetooth Tethering' menu here.

D. Additional information (precautions, limitations, and tips)

  Data sharing is available at a relatively slower speed compared to LTE or Wi-Fi.

  Since this function shares the user's data network, caution is needed regarding data charges.

title: Mobile Hotspot
description:
Mobile Hotspot, A mobile hotspot is a feature that allows a mobile device with an internet connection to act like a wireless router, providing an internet connection to other devices via Wi-Fi. It can be particularly useful for mobile devices like laptops and tablets that require internet connectivity.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Mobile Hotspot' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and turn the feature on or off by pressing the 'Mobile Hotspot' icon. Please note that using mobile data may incur charges due to data consumption.

title: Data usage
description:
Data usage, You can check your data usage or set your mobile data usage limits.
When data usage reaches the set limit, you can set it to disconnect your mobile data automatically. You can also use Data Saving mode to restrict sending or receiving data from some apps running in the background.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on my device.
2. Select the 'Connection' menu.
3. You can find the 'Use Data' menu here.
4. When the item is selected, various pieces of information related to the mobile data can be checked.
5. In particular, activating 'Data Saving Mode' can reduce data usage by restricting apps from using data in the background.

Use this feature to effectively manage data usage on your device.

title: Wi-Fi data usage
description:
Wi-Fi data usage, Data is consumed while using Wi-Fi. This occurs when visiting websites, using apps, or utilizing cloud services. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Data usage' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Wi-Fi data usage' menu.

Generally, Wi-Fi data usage varies depending on network speed, quality level, and the type of services being used.

title: Automatically update system settings
description:
Automatically update system settings, You can have the system settings automatically change so that you can use the network connection function smoothly.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your device. 
2. Select the ‘Connection’ > ‘Other connection settings’ menu. 
3. Here you can find the ‘Automatically update system settings’ menu.

title: Ethernet
description:
Ethernet, You can use the Ethernet adapter to use wired Internet and change network settings.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on my device.
2. Select the 'Connection'> 'Other Connection Settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'Ethernet' menu here.

This feature is disabled when the Ethernet adapter is not connected.

title: Private DNS
description:
Private DNS, You can enable secure, private DNS.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your device. 
2. Select the ‘Connection’ > ‘Other connection settings’ menu. 
3. Here you can find the ‘Private DNS’ menu.
4. When you select an item, a detailed settings screen is provided where you can select 'Disable', 'Automatic', and 'Private DNS Provider Host Name'.

title: VPN
description:
VPN, You can access private networks such as schools and companies by setting up VPN (Virtual Private Network) on your device. "VPN" stands for Virtual Private Network and is a function to strengthen security and protect personal information when using the Internet on Galaxy devices. Using VPN encrypts Internet communication, making it safe from outside wiretapping or hacking. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on my device. 
2. Select 'Connect'> 'Other Connection Settings'. 
3. You can find the 'VPN' menu here. 
4. Select an item, select ‘Add VPN Profile’ in The View option, and enter VPN Service Provider information. At this time, the server address, account name, password, etc. received from the provider are required. 
5. If you select the VPN after saving, it will be connected, and from then on, you can select and connect from the saved VPN list.

title: Printing
description:
Printing, You can print photos or documents by connecting your product to a printer. You can search for available printers and directly add the printer you want to print to.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your device. 
2. Select the ‘Connection’ > ‘Other connection settings’ menu. 
3. Here you will find the ‘Print’ menu.

title: Installing a Network Certificate
description:
Installing a Network Certificate, The "Network Security Certificate" setting is a feature required for certificate installation when using the certificate method for enterprise Wi-Fi connections.

# Here's how you can install network certificates:
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Wi-Fi
4. Select More View (⋮) and 'Advanced Settings'
5. Installing a Network Certificate

After entering the menu, you can select and install a certificate. Additionally, you can only set certificates that you have already saved.

title: Settings - Connections - Hotspot 2.0
description:
Settings - Connections - Hotspot 2.0, Hotspot 2.0 is a function that automatically connects to Hotspot 2.0 Wi-Fi network.

## Operating Conditions
1. Wi-Fi must be turned on.
2. When a specific Hotspot 2.0 profile saved by the user is installed and Wi-Fi matching the profile is searched, it is automatically connected.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connect'> 'Wi-Fi'.
3. Select 'More (⋮)' in the upper right corner.
4. Select 'Advanced Settings'.
5. You can find the 'Hotspot 2.0' menu here.

title: Wi-Fi usage record
description:
Wi-Fi usage record, In the 'Wi-Fi Usage History' menu, each app can last turn on or off Wi-Fi. The user's personal on or off history is not shown here.

The confirmation method is as follows.
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Wi-Fi
4. Enter 'Advanced Settings' from More View (⋮) menu
5. Wi-Fi usage record

title: Network management
description:
Network management, The 'Network Management' setting allows you to delete saved Wi-Fi networks or change auto-connect options.

You can only enter the path below with Wi-Fi turned on.
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Wi-Fi
4. Enter 'Advanced Settings' from More View (⋮) menu
6. Network management

title: Wi-Fi Direct
description:
Wi-Fi Direct, The 'Wi-Fi Direct' setting is used when a connection between devices supporting Wi-Fi Direct is required. It is based on Wi-Fi Direct technology.

The way to enter the setting is as follows.
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Connection
3. Wi-Fi
4. Click More View (⋮) at the top of the screen to select 'Wi-Fi Direct'

However, please note that the 'Wi-Fi Direct' setting can be used only when the Wi-Fi function is activated in advance.

title: Settings - Connection - Suspicious Network Detection
description:
Settings - Connection - Suspicious Network Detection, Suspicious network detection is a function that notifies when suspicious actions are detected in a Wi-Fi network.

When this feature is enabled, the Wi-Fi packet is analyzed to notify the user of whether to block it or not when malicious access that can infringe on privacy is identified.
In particular, suspicious tasks can be automatically detected when connecting to APs used by many people, such as public Wi-Fi.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connect'> 'Wi-Fi'.
3. Select 'More View' in the upper right corner.
4. Select 'Intelligent Wi-Fi'.
5. You can find the 'Suspicious Network Detection' menu here.

If you have a Wi-Fi network that is detected as a suspicious network but is considered safe, you can register as an exception network and set it not to receive notifications in the future.

Exception network registration cannot be done individually, and suspicious actions can be detected and registered as a trusted network when notifications appear.

※ This function only works when Wi-Fi is turned on.

title: Intelligent Wi-Fi
description:
Intelligent Wi-Fi, Here is how you can set useful features related to Wi-Fi:
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'Wi-Fi' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Intelligent Wi-Fi' menu in the More options.

title: Suspicious network detection
description:
Suspicious network detection, The 'suspicious network detection' function is responsible for informing when suspicious activity is detected in the current Wi-Fi network. This feature analyzes Wi-Fi packets to identify malicious approaches that can infringe on personal information and lets users decide whether to block them or not. In particular, it automatically detects suspicious activities when accessing APs that are used by multiple people, such as public Wi-Fi.

# How to set
Please note that this setting is only possible when Wi-Fi is enabled.
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Select 'Connect'
3. Select 'Wi-Fi'
4. Select 'Intelligent Wi-Fi' by pressing the More View (⋮) button
5. Set 'Suspicious Network Detection' option
Networks that are considered safe can be registered as exception networks and can be set to not receive notifications from moving on.

title: Real-time data priority processing
description:
Real-time data priority processing, Use the network first for tasks that need to run continuously, such as games and video calls. The use of background data lowers the priority. Performance improvements are made when real-time and background apps are used at the same time.

However, it only applies to Wi-Fi connections.

The setting method is as follows.
1. Select 'Connect' from 'Settings'
2. Select 'Wi-Fi'> 'More View'> 'Intelligent Wi-Fi'
3. Select 'Real-time Data Priority Processing'

title: Settings - Connections - Wi-Fi auto turn on/off
description:
Settings - Connections - Wi-Fi auto turn on/off, When you come to a place with frequently used Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi will automatically turn on, and when you move to another location, Wi-Fi will automatically turn off.
It operates automatically for frequently connected Wi-Fi networks, and you can also manually add networks of your choice.

## How to set up
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select ‘Connect’ > ‘Wi-Fi’.
3. Select ‘More (⋮)’ at the top right.
4. You can find ‘Intelligent Wi-Fi’ > ‘Turn Wi-Fi on/off automatically’.

※ This setting works only when you have a SIM card, and the location option is turned on.

title: Settings - Connections - Switch to faster and more stable Wi-Fi
description:
Settings - Connections - Switch to faster and more stable Wi-Fi, This setting allows you to automatically switch to a faster or more stable Wi-Fi network when one is found nearby.

You can set it as follows.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on the device.
2. Select the 'Connections'> 'Wi-Fi' menu.
3. Select 'More (⋮)' in the upper right corner.
4. Select 'Intelligent Wi-Fi'.
5. You can find the 'Switch to faster and more stable Wi-Fi' menu.

You can use Wi-Fi more smoothly by activating the settings.
Please note that this function works for the saved Wi-Fi networks, and the network changes only when the screen is turned off so as not to interrupt your device usage.

title: Settings - Connections - Switch to mobile data
description:
Settings - Connections - Switch to mobile data, This feature automatically switches to mobile data when the Wi-Fi connection speed is slow or unstable.
When Wi-Fi quality improves, it will automatically reconnect to your Wi-Fi network. This is useful when you need uninterrupted Internet use.

## How to set up
1. Run the settings menu.
2. Select ‘Connect’ > ‘Wi-Fi’.
3. Select ‘More (⋮)’ in the top right.
4. You can find the menu in ‘Intelligent Wi-Fi’ > ‘Switch to mobile data’.

Please note that this feature only works when Wi-Fi is turned on and that charges may apply depending on your plan when switching to mobile data.

title: Hotspot auto run connection
description:
Hotspot auto run connection, The hotspot auto-run connection functions automatically or after user consent connects to the surrounding Samsung account mobile hotspot when the Internet is not available.

## How to turn on the hotspot auto run connection function
- From hotspot terminal
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Log in to Samsung account.
3. Find and select 'Connection'> 'Other Connection Settings'.
4. Activate the 'Find peripheral devices' function.
5. Select the "Connect"> "Mobile hotspot and tethering"> "Mobile hotspot" menu again.
6. Activate 'Automatically Run Hotspot' within 'Mobile Hotspot'.

- On terminals that need Internet connection
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Log in to Samsung account.
3. Find and select 'Connection'> 'Other Connection Settings'.
4. Activate the 'Find peripheral devices' function.
5. Select "Connect"> 'Wi-Fi' again.
6. Select 'Intelligent Wi-Fi' in More View.
7. In Hotspot Auto Run Connection, select Ask Before Connecting or Always.

## How to turn off hotspot auto run connection function
Select 'Hotspot Auto Run Connection' as 'No' on terminals that need Internet connection.

title: Remove all eSIMs
description:
Remove all eSIMs, You can delete all eSIMs.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections' > 'SIM manager' > 'More SIM ' menu.
3. Select the 'Remove all eSIMs' menu.

Here, you can delete all eSIMs.

title: Lock eSIM settings
description:
Lock eSIM settings, Protect your eSIM settings using screen lock.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Connections' > Select 'SIM manager'.
3. Select the 'More SIM settings' menu here.
4. Tap on the 'Lock eSIM settings' menu.

Here, you can use your screen lock to protect your eSIM settings:
‒ 'Add eSIM'
‒ 'Remove eSIM'
‒ 'Remove All eSIMs'.

title: Data switching
description:
Data switching, When two SIM cards active, please enable this option here.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'SIM manager' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Data switching and backup calling' menu.

If you cannot use mobile data with the SIM for mobile data, it switches to the other SIM.

title: More SIM settings
description:
More SIM settings, You can configure additional SIM cards.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Connections' > Select 'SIM manager'.
3. Select the 'More SIM settings' menu here.

Here, you can choose from: 
‒ 'SIM card security'
‒ 'Lock eSIM settings'
‒ 'Remove all eSIMs'

title: Message
description:
Message, When two SIM cards are active, you can set the primary SIM for messages. Here, two SIM cards refer to USIM or eSIM.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'SIM card manager' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Messages' menu.

When two SIM cards are active, you can set the SIM for 'Messages' under 'Primary SIM card' here.

title: Add eSIM
description:
Add eSIM, To connect to a mobile network without a physical SIM card, download an eSIM.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'SIM manager' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Add eSIM' menu.

By selecting this item, you can search for and add a newly issued eSIM, or use the 'Transfer SIM from another device', 'Scan QR code', or 'Search for eSIMs' menu to add an eSIM.

title: Contactless payments
description:
Contactless payments, You can use the downloaded payment-related app that utilizes NFC functionality as a payment method, such as for public transportation.

To make payments using NFC functionality on the product, you must first register with the corresponding mobile payment service. For detailed instructions on how to register for the service, please contact the service provider.
##The method for using contactless payment is as follows:
1. Go to 'Settings' > 'Connections' > 'NFC and contactless payments' > Turn it on.

Bring the NFC antenna part on the back of the product close to the NFC card reader.
##To set the default payment app:
1. Go to 'Settings' > 'Connections' > 'NFC and contactless payments' > 'Contactless payments' >  'Payment' and then choose the desired app.

title: Read/write NFC tags
description:
Read/write NFC tags, You can check the tag information by placing the product close to the NFC tag. 

1. On the setting screen, select ' Connections'>'NFC and Contactless Payment', and press the switch to turn on the function. 
2. Press the switch of 'NFC tag', read/write to turn on the function. 
3. Put the NFC antenna on the back of the product close to the 'NFC tag'.
 The tag information appears.
'NFC tag' information cannot be received or read on the lock screen or off screen.

title: Connection setup
description:
Connection setup, You can change various connection settings such as Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc. Select a connection on the Settings screen.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connection' menu.

Here, you can see various other connection settings at a glance, such as 'Wi-Fi', 'Bluetooth', 'NFC', and 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering'. You can change the settings you want by selecting each item.

title: International Roaming
description: International Roaming, Overseas roaming refers to a function that allows domestic telecommunications companies to provide services overseas. 1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device. 2. Select the 'Connection' menu. 3. You can find the 'Overseas Roaming' menu here. 4. When you select the item, you can see various settings related to overseas roaming. 5. If you turn on automatic selection in roaming carrier selection, the optimal mobile network will be automatically selected. 6. If you turn off automatic selection, you can manually select the carrier to roam with. If you are going abroad, be sure to turn on roaming and activate data roaming. However, it is recommended that you carefully monitor your data usage to avoid excessive charges due to mobile data usage.

title: Mobile Hotspot and Tethering
description:
Mobile Hotspot and Tethering, You can share your mobile data with other devices using the Mobile Hotspot and Tethering feature.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Mobile Hotspot and Tethering' menu.

When you activate the feature, your device will work like a router, allowing other devices to connect to the internet. Additionally, you can change detailed settings such as the SSID or password in 'Mobile Hotspot Settings'.

title: SIM Manager
description:
SIM Manager, You can change SIM card usage and other settings.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Connect’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘SIM Manager’ menu.
4. Once you select an item, you can turn the SIM card on or off and add or delete eSIM.
5. Additionally, you can set a SIM for calls, a SIM for messages, and a SIM for mobile data, and you can also change the PIN number.

title: Airplane mode
description:
Airplane mode, For safety during flight, communication-related functions are restricted in 'Airplane mode' while other functions can continue to be used.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connections' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Airplane mode' menu.

Alternatively, you can pull down the top of your device's screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and toggle the 'Airplane mode' icon to turn the function on or off.

title: Ultra Wideband (UWB)
description:
Ultra Wideband (UWB), The ultra-wideband function is a technology that enables accurate distance measurement with a counterpart instrument, using a wide frequency band.
The technology may be used for a vehicle digital key service, etc.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Please select 'Connection'.
3. You can find the 'UWB' menu here.

In order to use the Ultra Wideband (UWB) function, both devices must support this function.

title: NFC and contactless payment
description:
NFC and contactless payment, The product can read near field communication (NFC) tags, including information such as contacts and URLs. You can also download payment-related apps using NFC functions and use them as payment methods, such as using public transportation.

## Check NFC tag information
You can check the tag information by placing the product close to the NFC tag.
Please follow the following steps to check NFC tag information.

1. On the Settings screen, select 'Connection' -> 'NFC and Contactless Payment' and press the switch to turn on the function.
2. Press the switch on 'Read/Write NFC Tag' to turn on the function
3. Put the NFC antenna on the back of the product close to the NFC tag
The tag information appears.
* NFC tag information cannot be received or read on the lock screen or off screen.


## NFC payment
To pay using the NFC function in the product, you must first register with the mobile payment service. For more information on registering for the service, contact the service provider.
Please follow the following steps to pay with NFC function.

1. On the setting screen, select 'Connection' -> 'NFC and Contactless Payment' and press the switch to turn on the function
2. To set up a payment app to use as a default, click 'Connection' -> 'NFC and Contactless Payment' -> 'Basic Wallet App' on the settings screen and select the app you want.
3. Keep the NFC antenna on the back of the product close to the NFC card reader.

title: Bluetooth
description:
Bluetooth, You can connect to a nearby Bluetooth device and listen to music or make phone calls through that device.

There are three settings methods as follows.
1. You can find the ‘Settings’ app > ‘Connection’ > ‘Bluetooth’ menu.
2. Swipe down from the top of the screen to open the ‘Quick Settings window’ and tap the ‘Bluetooth’ icon to turn the function on or off.
3. You can also enter the menu through the Bluetooth icon on the top Quick panel.

Here's how to register a new device:
1. Enter pairing mode by referring to the device’s manual.
2. On the Bluetooth settings screen, press the ‘Search’ button to search for the device you want to register.
3. If the device appears in the ‘Connectable devices’ list, select it and register it. If the device is already registered, you can select it from the ‘Registered Devices’ list to connect.

title: Wi-Fi
description:
Wi-Fi, You can use Wi-Fi to connect to nearby wireless networks for internet access or to connect with other wireless network devices.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Connections'.
3. You can find the 'Wi-Fi' menu here.
4. When you activate the 'Wi-Fi' feature, your device will search for nearby 'Wi-Fi' networks.
5. Select the 'Wi-Fi' network you want to connect to and enter additional information if necessary.
6. Once connected, it automatically connects to the internet.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of your screen to open the 'Quick Settings' window and press the 'Wi-Fi' icon to turn this feature on or off.

Please be aware that when using open 'Wi-Fi' networks provided in public places or cafes, there is a risk of personal information leakage.

title: Special access permissions
description: Special access permissions, This is the menu that manages special access permissions for the apps installed on your device.The setting method is as follows:1. Run the 'Settings' app2. Select the 'Apps' menu3. Tap on the menu option (3 dots)4. You can view the 'Special access' menu here

title: Full screen alerts
description:
Full screen alerts, You can receive notifications that appear in full screen in the app.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Full screen alerts' menu.

When you select an item, you can change the permissions for the apps.

title: Turn screen on
description:
Turn screen on, Manage permissions to prevent each app from turning off or dimming the screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Turn screen on' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions for the apps.

title: Wi-Fi control
description:
Wi-Fi control, This app grants permissions to turn Wi-Fi on and off, find and connect to Wi-Fi networks, add and delete networks, and start a device communication-only hotspot.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Wi-Fi control' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: VR Help Service
description:
VR Help Service, The VR Help Service feature is a menu that can provide permissions for VR connections.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Applications' > 'Special Access' menu from the more options.
3. Here you can find the 'VR Help Service' menu.
4. By selecting the item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Usage data access
description:
Usage data access, The app monitors how often other apps are used and checks service providers, language settings, and other usage data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Usage data access' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Alarms & reminders
description:
Alarms & reminders, This app allows you to set alarms and schedule time-based tasks. This permission allows the app to run in the background, which may increase battery usage.
If you disable this permission, existing alarms and time-based schedules set by this app will not work.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Alarms & reminders' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions for the apps.

title: Install unknown apps
description:
Install unknown apps, To protect against malicious apps, your device is set to only allow the installation of apps from approved sources such as the Play Store or Galaxy Store by default. Installing apps from other sources can damage your device and data. To install apps from other sources, please allow the sources from the list below.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you will find the 'Install unknown apps' menu.

By selecting the item, you can change the permissions for the apps.

title: Use premium text messaging service
description:
Use premium text messaging service, Premium SMS is a short code number (3-6 digits) used for messaging and usually a menu that allows you to change permissions to charge end users a premium price per SMS.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Special Access’ menu in ‘Application’ > More options.
3. Here you can find the ‘Use premium text messaging service’ menu.

If you select an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Picture-in-Picture (PIP)
description:
Picture-in-Picture (PIP), After you use an app or while leaving the app, if you want to watch a video, etc., this app will allow you to create a photo (PIP) window in the picture. This window will be displayed above the screen of the other app you are using.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'More view' > Tap on the 'Special access' option.
3. Here, you can find the 'Picture-in-picture' (PIP) menu.

You can change the permissions of the apps, by selecting an item.

title: Notification access
description:
Notification access, Notification access is a special feature in Android that allows other apps to read and access notifications.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' from the More options menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Notification access' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Manage media
description:
Manage media, Choose an app that can modify or delete media files on your device or connected storage without verification. Photo and video, as well as music and audio permissions, are required.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' option in the 'More' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Manage media' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Allow Do Not Disturb Permission
description:
Allow Do Not Disturb Permission, This menu allows you to check or change the Do Not Disturb permissions for your apps.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Click on the three vertical dots located in the top-right corner of the 'Apps' settings. 
3. Select 'Special Access'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Do Not Disturb Permission' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the Do Not Disturb permissions for specific apps.

title: Accessing all files
description:
Accessing all files, In certain apps, you can read, modify, and delete all files on the device or connected storage. If you allow this permission, you can also access files that are not related to the app, without getting notifications from that app.The setting method is as follows:

1. Run the 'Settings' app
2. Select 'Apps' > Tap on the menu option (3 dots) > 'Special access' menu in The View option
3. You can find the 'All files access' menu hereIf you select an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Change system settings
description:
Change system settings, This menu supports choosing whether to allow any app to change system settings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' option in the 'More' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Modify system settings' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Appear on top
description:
Appear on top, You can allow an app to always appear above other apps. In this case, it may interfere when using other apps.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Special access' option in the 'More' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Draw over other apps' menu.

By selecting this item, you can change the permissions of the apps.

title: Flash screen
description:
Flash screen, When accessing text on the screen in the digital assistant app, you can light up the screen edges.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Choose default apps' > 'Digital assistant app'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Flash screen' menu.

title: Analyse on-screen images
description:
Analyse on-screen images, You can set whether to allow the digital assistant app to capture and use images of the screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Choose default apps' > 'Digital assistant app'.
3. Here you can find the 'Analyze on-screen images' menu.

title: Analyse on-screen text
description:
Analyse on-screen text, To provide relevant information, allow the digital assistant app to analyze the text displayed on the screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Apps' > 'Choose default apps' > 'Digital assistant app'.
3. Here you can find the 'Analyze on-screen text' menu.

title: Digital Assistant App
description:
Digital Assistant App, Digital assistant apps collect information displayed on your device screen to provide you with the help you need. To open the digital assistant app, select the app to launch when you press and hold the side button.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select ‘Application’ > ‘Select default app’
3. Here you can find the ‘Digital Assistant App’ menu.

title: Settings - Applications
description:
Settings - Applications, From the app list, you can manage the apps installed on your device and change their settings.
You can check usage information for each app, change notification and permission settings, and delete or disable unused apps.

## Application information
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Application’ menu.
3. To change the settings of a specific application, select the application and change the desired settings on the ‘Application Information’ screen that appears.

## Select default app
You can choose to use the app instead of your browser when you visit supported web addresses.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Application’ menu.
3. Select the ‘Select default app’ menu.

Here you can choose which browser app or phone app you want to use by default.

Additionally, you can set the app to run by default when you select a link.
For example, if you want to use an Internet browser instead of the YouTube app when selecting a link to the YouTube app, you can do the following:

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Application’ menu.
3. Select the ‘Select default app’ menu.
4. Select ‘Open Link’.
5. In ‘Installed apps’, find and select the app you want to modify.
6. Here you can turn on or off the ‘Open supported links’ item.

You can change the default app to your browser through this setting.
For example, when selecting a YouTube link, you can choose whether to use the YouTube app or an Internet browser.

title: Choose default apps
description:
Choose default apps, This is the menu to set up the apps used for making calls, sending messages, and navigating to websites.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Apps' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Choose default apps' menu.

By selecting an item, you can change the 'Digital assistant app', 'Browser app', 'Phone app', 'Home app', and 'SMS app'.

title: Samsung app settings
description:
Samsung app settings, Samsung app settings menu provides a collection of settings for the default apps installed on the device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Apps' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Samsung app settings' menu.

When you select an item, a list of default apps provided by Samsung will be displayed. You can select the desired app to go to the app settings screen.

title: Permission manager
description:
Permission manager, Some apps require access or permission to use key information on your device to function properly. To check the permissions set for each app, open the settings and select the application. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Apps' menu.
3. You can find the 'Permission manager' menu in More option.

After selecting the app you want to check, select permissions. You can view the list of permissions and change whether permissions accordingly.

title: Hide Notifications
description:
Hide Notifications, If you turn on the 'Hide Notifications' setting, you can't see the notifications on the lock screen.

The method of setting to hide notification contents is as follows.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notification'> 'Lock Screen Notification' menu.
3. You can find the Hide Notification menu here.

title: Show even while screen is off
description:
Show even while screen is off, Here's how you can toggle the 'Show when screen is off' setting in the notification popup style brief view settings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Notification pop-up style' menu. > Choose 'Brief' view.
3. Here, you can find the 'Show even while screen is off' menu.

title: Apps to show as brief
description:
Apps to show as brief, In the notification popup style settings, you can set which apps to display briefly. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Notification pop-up style' menu. > Choose 'Brief' view.
3. Here, you can find the 'Apps to show as brief' menu.

When set to Brief View settings, it means that the notification popup will show the content concisely.

title: Notification pop-up style
description:
Notification pop-up style, Select the notification pop-up style and change the related settings.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notification' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Notification pop-up style' menu.
4. Select an item to choose 'Brief' or 'Detailed' view.

Additionally, you can also change settings such as 'Add light notification effect', 'Set light notification effect color by keyword', and 'Show even when the screen is off'.

title: Messages
description:
Messages, You can receive calls and messages from added contacts even when Do Not Disturb mode is on. Here's how you can set the additional allowance for message items:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Calls and messages' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Messages' menu.

title: Repeat callers
description:
Repeat callers, Even when Do Not Disturb mode is on, you can receive calls and messages from added contacts.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Calls and messages' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Repeat callers' menu.

If a call comes in and then another call from the same number comes in within 15 minutes, the phone will ring.

title: Calls
description:
Calls, You can receive calls and messages from added contacts even when Do Not Disturb mode is on. Here's how you can set additional allowances for calls:
 
1. Launch the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Calls and messages' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Calls' menu.

title: Hide status bar icons
description:
Hide status bar icons, This is the setting for hiding notifications in 'Do not disturb' mode. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Hide notifications' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Hide status bar icons' menu.

You can toggle the setting for not showing icons in the status bar when the screen is on.

title: Don't show pop-up notifications
description:
Don't show pop-up notifications, This is the setting to hide notifications in 'Do not disturb' mode. 
 
1. Launch the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Hide notifications' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Don't show pop-up notifications' menu.

You can turn on and off the setting to not show popup notifications when the screen is on.

title: Hide from notification panel
description:
Hide from notification panel, How to hide notifications in 'Do not disturb' mode. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Hide notifications' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Hide from notification panel' menu.

You can toggle the setting to hide notifications when the screen is on.

title: Turning Off App Icon Badge
description:
Turning Off App Icon Badge, When the screen is on while in Do Not Disturb mode, you can set "Turn Off App Icon Badge" to prevent the badge on the app icon from being displayed. This is a setting within the Do Not Disturb settings to hide notifications. You can turn on and off the "Turn Off App Icon Badge" setting when your screen is on.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do Not Disturb' > 'Hide Notifications'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Turn Off App Icon Badge' menu.

title: Do not disturb - hide notification
description:
Do not disturb - hide notification, Hide notifications in Do Not Disturb settings.
You can set the hide notification feature here. However, major notifications such as device activity and status are always visible.

## Hide full screen notification
You can turn on and off the Hide Full Screen Notification setting when the screen is turned off.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb'> 'Hide Notification' menu.
3. You can find the Hide Full Screen Notification menu here.

## Turn off app icon badge
When the screen is turned on while using Do Not Disturb mode, you can set the app icon badge off to make the badge of the app icon invisible.
You can turn the app icon badge off setting on and off when the screen is on.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb'> 'Hide Notification' menu.
3. You can find the 'Hide app icon badges' menu here.

## Hide from notification window
You can turn the Hide setting on and off in the notification window when the screen is on.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb'> 'Hide Notification' menu.
3. You can find the Hide from Notification Panel here.

## Do not display pop-up notification
You can turn the pop-up notification off setting on and off when the screen is on.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb'> 'Hide Notification' menu.
3. You can find the 'Don't show pop-up notifications' menu here.

## Do not display icons on status bar
When the screen is on, you can turn on and off the Do not display icons on the status bar.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb'> 'Hide Notification' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Hide status bar icons' menu.

title: Reminders
description:
Reminders, You can set reminders to sound and vibrate even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Alarms and sounds'.
3. Here you can find the 'Reminders' menu.

title: Calendar events
description:
Calendar events, You can set calendar events to sound and vibrate even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Alarms and sounds'.
3. You can find the 'Calendar events' menu here.

title: Touch sounds
description:
Touch sounds, You can set the touch sound and vibration to be turned on even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Alarms and sounds' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Touch sounds' menu.

description:
Media sound, You can set media sound to be audible and vibrate even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.

title: Alarms
description:
Alarms, You can set alarms to ring and vibrate even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' > 'Alarms and sounds' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Alarms' menu.

title: Alarm and sound menu
description:
Alarm and sound menu, Enable 'Do Not Disturb mode' to disable all sound and vibration notifications.
However, the Alarm and Sound setting allows you to listen to sounds or feel vibrations for certain items even in the Do Not Disturb mode.

The way to enter the settings is as follows.
1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Notification
3. Do not disturb.
3. Alarm and sound

title: App notifications
description:
App notifications, Select the apps to receive notifications even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' menu.
3. You can find the 'App notifications' menu here.

With this feature, you can add certain apps to allow notifications even in 'Do not disturb' mode.

title: Calls and messages
description:
Calls and messages, You can receive calls and messages from added contacts even when 'Do not disturb' mode is on.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Do not disturb' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Calls and messages' menu.

Through this function, you can add contacts and items to allow in 'Do not disturb' mode.

title: Adding a Schedule
description:
Adding a Schedule, You can add and set a schedule for when the "Do Not Disturb" mode will be activated. If you add a specific schedule and leave the setting on, the "Do Not Disturb" mode will continue during that schedule.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Notifications' > 'Do Not Disturb'.
3. Through the 'Add Schedule' menu, you can add a schedule for when the "Do Not Disturb" mode will be activated, and you can also turn off an already added schedule.

title: Set period
description:
Set period, The 'Set Period' menu is a function that sets the period to maintain the 'Do Not Disturb' mode when activating the 'Do Not Disturb' mode.
You can choose between 'until you turn it off directly', '1 hour', and 'always ask', and '1 hour' can be adjusted by the user himself.
When the Do Not Disturb notification mode is activated according to the value set here, it can be maintained for a set period of time.

# Setting path
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notify'> 'Do Not Disturb' menu.
3. You can find the 'Set Period' menu here.

title: Notifications on app icons
description:
Notifications on app icons, You can view notifications by long-pressing the app icon.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' > 'App icon badges' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Notifications on app icons' menu.

title: Advanced Settings
description:
Advanced Settings, Change advanced settings related to notifications.
Advanced settings for notifications include sorting notifications, categorizing notifications, notification history, conversations, floating notifications, displaying app icons in notifications, recommending reply or action buttons to notifications, showing snooze button, repeating notification sounds, app icon badges, managing notification categories for each app, and setting disaster text messages.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Notification’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Advanced Settings’ menu.

title: Manage notification categories by app
description:
Manage notification categories by app, 'Manage notification categories by app' is a menu that sets the 'notification category' menu to be displayed on the app notification setting screen.
When you turn on 'Manage notification categories by app', you can see the 'notification category' menu at the bottom of the app notification settings and set notifications for each notification category.
Since the category list within the notification category is created by each app, the list delivered by each app will be displayed.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notification'> 'Advanced Settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'Manage notification categories by app' menu here.

title: App icon badges
description:
App icon badges, You can set the app icon badge for notifications.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'App icon badges' menu.

Select an item to set the badge style to 'Number' or 'Dot', or press and hold the app icon to view notifications.

title: Show snooze button
description:
Show snooze button, You can display the reminder button when expanding the notification card.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Show snooze button' menu.

title: Show notifications icons
description:
Show notifications icons, You can display the icon shown in the notification card or notification popup as the app icon.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Show app icon in notifications' menu.

title: Floating notifications
description:
Floating notifications, You can set notifications to be displayed as floating notifications (bubbles, smart pop-ups).

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Floating notifications' menu.

title: Conversations
description:
Conversations, You can check the notification category items designated for conversations in the app.
You can change the settings related to each conversation.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Conversations' menu.

When you select an item, you can see the list of conversations for which you have changed the notification settings.
You can change the detailed notification settings for each conversation.

title: Notification history
description:
Notification history, You can check recently dismissed notifications and notification history from the past 24 hours.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' > 'Advanced settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Notification history' menu.

When you activate this feature, you can check 'Recently dismissed' notifications and notifications from the 'Last 24 hours'.

title: Battery level display
description:
Battery level display, You can set the display of remaining battery power in the status bar.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Notification’ > ‘Status Bar’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Show battery level’ menu.

title: App notification
description:
App notification, Change settings related to app notifications. Select Notifications in the Settings screen.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' menu.
3. You can find the 'App notifications' menu here.

You can set whether to receive notifications by app, notification method (sound, vibration, etc.), and what to display in the notification window.

title: Notification Pop-up Style
description:
Notification Pop-up Style, There are two types of notification pop-up styles: Brief View and Detailed View.
You can select a notification pop-up style and change related settings.
In the Brief View, you can use the Edge lighting style and specify colors by keywords.
In the Detailed View, all notification pop-ups are displayed in detail.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notifications' menu.
3. You can find the 'Notification Pop-up Style' menu here.

title: App Notification Settings
description:
App Notification Settings, You can manage notification settings for all apps installed in the 'App Notification' setting.
You can set the reception, sound, vibration, etc. of notifications for each application, and you can also adjust the way notifications are displayed on the lock screen or top bar.
You can also set the app's notifications to silent or not to receive notifications. This feature makes it convenient to select and receive only the necessary notifications.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notification' menu.
3. You can find the 'App Notification' menu here.

You can change the notification settings for apps installed here.

title: Wireless emergency alerts
description:
Wireless emergency alerts, Disaster alert messages are a feature that allows you to receive warning notifications on your device in the event of a natural disaster.
You can change the settings related to receiving disaster alert messages.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Safety and emergency' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Wireless emergency alerts' menu.

You can make detailed settings related to receiving disaster alert messages by selecting the items and using the provided settings menu.

title: Emergency contact
description:
Emergency contact, Emergency contacts are contact information of people you have designated in advance so that you can contact them quickly in an emergency situation. When a user starts sharing an emergency, a message will be sent to emergency contacts, and emergency contacts can also be displayed on the lock screen for easy contact in emergency situations. As emergency contacts, you can set up people who can help you, such as family, friends, and neighbors, and there is no limit to the number.

## How to add emergency contacts

### Enter in the settings app
1. Run the Settings app.
2. Select the ‘Safety & Emergency’ menu.
3. Select the ‘Emergency Contacts’ menu.
4. Select the ‘Add Emergency Contact’ menu, enter the information, and press the Done button.

### Enter in the Contacts app
1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Select ‘My Profile’ at the top.
3. Find and select the ‘Emergency Contact’ menu at the bottom of the menu.
4. Find and select the ‘Add emergency contact’ menu at the bottom, enter the information, and press the Done button.


## Edit and delete emergency contacts
If you want to edit or delete an emergency contact that has already been registered, you can long-press the entered item and select Edit or Delete.
1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Select ‘My Profile’ at the top.
3. Find and select the ‘Emergency Contact’ menu at the bottom of the menu.
4. Press and hold the item you want to delete and select ‘Delete’.

## View emergency contacts on lock screen
To view emergency contacts on the lock screen, swipe the phone button on the lock screen and click the 'Emergency Call' button. At the top of the keypad that appears, you can check the emergency contacts you have set and make a call.

title: Settings - Safety and Emergency - Medical Information
description:
Settings - Safety and Emergency - Medical Information, Medical information is a function that records your health-related information so that you can use it in an emergency. This information can also be displayed on the lock screen so that it can be easily shared with medical staff. Additionally, you can also enter, edit, and delete from the Settings menu and My Profile in Contacts. For medical information, you only need to enter the information you need. This information depends on the user's choice, and there is no problem even if you do not enter it.

## Access path in setting
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Safety and Emergency' menu.
3. You can find the "Medical Information" menu here, and you can enter, edit, and delete it.

## Access path from the Contacts app
1. Run the 'Contacts' app.
2. Choose My Profile.
3. Select 'Medical Information' for the emergency information at the bottom of My Profile.
4. You can find the "Medical Information" menu here, and you can enter, edit, and delete it.

Medical information can be viewed on the lock screen if it is set to view medical information immediately in an emergency. This setting is the 'Show on Lock Screen' option at the bottom of the medical information entry screen. When this option is turned on, the user-entered medical information is displayed on the lock screen.

To view medical information on the lock screen, swipe the phone button on the lock screen, click the 'Emergency Phone' button, and click the medical information button at the bottom of the keypad that appears at this time.

title: Emergency SOS
description:
Emergency SOS, Calling Emergency Numbers:
In an emergency, you can press the side button 5 times to get help.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Safety and emergency' menu.
3. Here you will find the 'Emergency SOS' menu.

You can change the way you call emergency numbers and set up emergency contacts to be called.

title: Emergency Situation Sharing
description:
Emergency Situation Sharing, You can share your location and other information with your emergency contacts.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Safety and Emergency' menu.
3. Choose the 'Emergency Situation Sharing' menu.
4. Register an 'Emergency Contact' to share emergency situations with.
5. Once you select 'Start Emergency Situation Sharing', your location and other information will be shared with your emergency contacts.

title: Last update menu
description:
Last update menu, Check the information of the recently updated software.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Software update' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Last update' menu.

* If there are no recently completed updates, this feature may not be supported.

title: Settings - Software Updates - Automatic downloads
description:
Settings - Software Updates - Automatic downloads, You can choose when to automatically download software updates.

## How to set up
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select ‘Software Update’.
3. Select ‘Automatic Download’.

Here you can set the software to automatically download only when connected to Wi-Fi by selecting 'When connected to Wi-Fi'.

※ Even if you select ‘Never’ or ‘When connected to Wi-Fi’, important updates can be downloaded using mobile data.
※ Even if you select ‘Use Wi-Fi or mobile data’, your mobile carrier may not allow updates using mobile data in certain situations.
※ This feature may not be supported on some models.

title: Download and install
description:
Download and install, You can manually update the Product Software.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Software update' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Download and install' menu.

When you select an item, it compares the current software version you are using with the latest version, and if an update is needed, it will start the download and then proceed with the installation.
By setting it this way, you can always keep your device's software up to date, ensuring optimal performance and stability.

After completing the download, you can delay the installation through the scheduled installation on the installation confirmation screen.

title: Software update
description:
Software update, With FOTA (Firmware Over The Air) service, you can update the software of the product or change the settings for updates.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Software update' menu.

title: Play the vibration sound when the phone rings.
description:
Play the vibration sound when the phone rings., To make it easier to know when you have a call, you can play the incoming call vibration as sound.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration'> 'Vibration Intensity' menu.
3. You can find the 'Play Vibration Sound When Calling' menu here.

title: Sound quality optimization
description:
Sound quality optimization, When you wear headphones or Buds, you can experience optimized sound quality that gives you a complete experience.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration'> 'Sound Quality and Sound Effects' menu.
3. You can find the 'Sound Quality Optimization' menu here.
4. You can choose an age-specific option or find the optimized sound quality for yourself through a simple test.

title: UHQ upscaler
description:
UHQ upscaler, Wearing headphones makes the sound of music and videos clearer.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sounds and vibration' > 'Sound quality and effects' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'UHQ upscaler' menu.

When you enable this feature, it converts regular quality audio to high quality audio output.

title: Equaliser
description:
Equaliser, You can change the Equalizer settings that are applied during media playback.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sounds and vibration' > 'Sound quality and effects' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Equalizer' menu.

You can set predefined equalizers or custom equalizer effects. Settings are saved and managed separately for speakers, earphones, and bluetooth.

title: Dolby Atoms
description:
Dolby Atoms, Experience Dolby Atmos audio that resonates in all directions. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Sounds and vibration' > 'Sound quality and effects' menu. 
3. Here, you can find the 'Dolby Atmos' menu. 
4. Enable the 'Dolby Atmos' effect and set it to:
‒ 'Auto'
‒ 'Movie'
‒ 'Music'
‒ 'Voice'

The settings are saved and managed separately for speakers, earphones, and bluetooth.

title: Media volume control
description:
Media volume control, You can set the volume button to adjust only the media volume.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Sounds and Vibration'> 'Volume' menu.
3. You can find the 'Media Volume Control' menu here.

※ If the ringtone is not adjusted with the volume control keys, check the 'Media Volume Control' menu.

title: System vibration intensity
description:
System vibration intensity, Adjust the system vibration intensity.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration'> 'Vibration Intensity' menu.
3. You can adjust the system vibration intensity here.

title: System sound theme
description:
System sound theme, This is a menu that allows you to change the theme of various system sounds such as touch feedback, charging, sound mode change, Samsung keyboard, phone keypad, volume button, battery shortage notification, etc.

You can choose the theme you want from Galaxy, peaceful, enjoyable, and retro.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration'> 'System Sound' menu.
3. You can find the 'System Sound Theme' menu here.

title: Isolate app sound playback
description:
Isolate app sound playback, Media sounds played in a specific app are played individually on a connected speaker or Bluetooth headset.
For example, you can listen to the navigation app's guidance voice through the product's speakers while simultaneously running the music app to listen to music through the car's Bluetooth speakers.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app on your mobile device.
2. Select the ‘Sound and Vibration’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘App sound isolation playback’ menu.

After activating 'Turn on now', select the app you want to play sound individually and press the back button.
Select the device that will play the sound of the selected app.

title: Sound quality and effects
description:
Sound quality and effects, Set audio quality and sound effects.
By applying various effects such as Dolby and EQ according to user preferences during media playback, you can experience a better audio experience.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sounds and vibration' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Sound quality and effects' menu.

title: Vibration intensity
description:
Vibration intensity, Adjust the intensity of vibration notifications

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sounds and Vibration' menu.
3. You can find the 'Vibration Intensity' menu here.
4. When you select an item, settings are provided to individually adjust the vibration intensity for incoming phone reception, notification, and touch sound, etc.

In this menu, you can check the following information.
- 'Phone'
- 'Notifications'
- 'System'
- 'Media'

title: System vibration
description:
System vibration, You can select actions to receive feedback with vibration, and set vibration intensity.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your mobile device.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration' menu.
3. You can find the 'System Vibration' menu here.

In this menu, vibration feedback can be set for the following actions.
- Touch feedback.
- Dial keypad.
- Samsung Keyboard
- Charging.
- Navigation Gestures.
- Camera feedback.

title: Settings - Sound and Vibration - Notification Vibration
description:
Settings - Sound and Vibration - Notification Vibration, Change the device's notification vibration settings.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration' menu.
3. Select the 'Notification Vibration' menu.

You can change the intensity and type of notification vibration in this menu.

title: Volume
description:
Volume, The 'Volume' menu in Settings adjusts the volume of the product depending on the situation.

## How to enter the menu
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration' menu.
3. You can find the 'Volume' menu here.

In this menu, you can check the following information.
- 'Bell Sound': You can adjust the volume of the ring tone that occurs when receiving a call.
- 'Media': You can control the volume generated when listening to music or watching videos.
- 'Notification': You can adjust the volume of sound generated by notifications such as text.
- 'System': You can adjust the sound volume of the systems like menu touch or charging sound.
- 'Call notification during call': You can adjust the volume generated when receiving a call during a call.

## How to adjust the sound size
You can control the volume by pressing the volume button on the side of the product, or you can control the volume by pressing the volume button and pressing the 'More View' icon at the top of the button.

title: System sound
description:
System sound, Select the sound that is played when performing certain actions, such as connecting the charger.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sounds and Vibration' menu.
3. You can find the 'System Sounds' menu here.

In this menu, you can check the following information.
- 'Touch Feedback': You can turn on or off the sound that plays when you touch the menu.
- 'Dial keypad': You can turn on or off the sound generated when you touch the phone dial keypad.
- 'Samsung Keyboard': You can turn on or off the sound that plays when typing Samsung Keyboard.
- 'Charge': You can turn on or off the sound generated at the start of charging.
