- 'Screen Lock/Unlock': You can turn on or off the sound that plays when the screen is locked or unlocked.

title: Notification sounds
description:
Notification sounds, In Notification sound, you can set the default notification sound for your mobile device.
When you select an item, you can hear various notification sounds. Select and set the notification sound you want.

## How to enter the menu
- ‘Settings’ > ‘Sound & Vibration’ > ‘Notification sounds’

title: Ringtone
description:
Ringtone, The ringtone menu allows you to set various ringtones on your device.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration' menu.
3. You can find the 'Bellsori' menu here.

If you select an item, you can check various ringtones and alarm sounds that can be set. Select and set the ring tone you want.

title: The phone also vibrates when it rings
description:
The phone also vibrates when it rings, Set the ring tone and vibration to sound together when receiving a call.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Sound and Vibration' menu.
3. When set to Sound mode, you can find the 'Vibration When the Phone Rings' menu here.

title: Sound mode
description:
Sound mode, Set the product to sound, vibration, or silent mode.

1. Scroll down from the top of the screen to open the Quick Panel.
2. You can adjust the sound settings by clicking the speaker shape icon.

title: Call vibration
description:
Call vibration, Change the vibration settings for incoming calls.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Sounds and vibration' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Call vibration' menu.

By selecting an item, you can check various phone vibrations that can be set on your phone.
Choose and set the desired phone vibration.

title: System sound volume
description:
System sound volume, Try setting a media volume limit to protect your hearing when using headphones or Bluetooth devices. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select 'Sounds and vibration' > 'Volume' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Media volume limit' menu under More options(⁝).

title: Samsung Cloud settings
description:
Samsung Cloud settings, In the settings of the Samsung Cloud app, you can configure or check the following:

 - 'Show Samsung Cloud on Apps screen'
 - 'Enhanced data protection'
 - 'Privacy Notice'
 - 'Permissions'
 - 'Download personal data'
 - 'Erase personal datal
 - 'About Samsung Cloud'
 - 'Contact us'

How to access settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Samsung Cloud' menu.
3. Select the 'Settings' menu from the more options.

※ The paths to access Samsung Cloud or supported features may vary depending on the device, OS, or country.

title: Display Samsung Cloud on Apps Screen
description:
Display Samsung Cloud on Apps Screen, You can display Samsung Cloud on the Apps screen. 
When you select the Samsung Cloud icon, you can directly access the Samsung Cloud app from the Apps screen.

1. Go to 'Settings' screen and select 'Samsung Account' 
2. Select 'Samsung Cloud' and then choose 'Settings' under the 'More' option
3. Choose 'Display Samsung Cloud on Apps Screen

※ The paths to access Samsung Cloud and supported features may vary depending on the device, OS, and country.

title: Delete account
description:
Delete account, This is the menu to withdraw your Samsung account.
If you withdraw your account, the data of backup or synced linked services may be deleted.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Profile info' menu.
3. You can find the 'Delete account' menu in More options.

title: Work
description:
Work, You can find the work information for Samsung account users here:
You can enter job title, department, and company name.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung account'.
3. Choose the 'Profile info' menu.
4. Here, you can set the 'Work' menu.

title: Status message
description:
Status message, This is the user status message for your Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Profile info' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Status message' menu.

title: Nickname
description:
Nickname, This is the nickname for Samsung account users.
It can be used in Samsung account-linked services like Contact.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Profile Information' menu.
3. You can find the 'Nickname' menu here.

title: Country or region
description:
Country or region, You can check the country or region set for Samsung Account users. The features or services available may vary depending on the country or region.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Profile Information' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Country or Region' menu.

title: Language
description:
Language, You can set the language used for Samsung Account newsletters and notifications. We support 71 languages, including Korean.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Profile Information' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Language' menu.

title: Phone number
description:
Phone number, Please follow the steps below to find the user's phone number for the Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Profile info' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Phone number' menu.

title: Date of birth
description:
Date of birth, Here, you can find the birthdate of the Samsung account user:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Profile info' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Date of birth' menu.

title: Explain 'Name' in Samsung Account
description:
Explain 'Name' in Samsung Account, This is the username of your Samsung account.  It is used in your Samsung account profile and for identity verification and can be used across all services linked to your Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Profile Info'.
3. You can find the 'Name' menu here.

title: Google
description:
Google, To check the Google account linked with your Samsung account:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Profile info' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Google' menu.

title: Email
description:
Email, This is your Samsung account email ID.
It is used as your Samsung account ID. Please use an email account that can receive confirmation emails.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Profile Information' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Email' menu.

title: Collection and Use of Personal Information for Advertising and Marketing
description:
Collection and Use of Personal Information for Advertising and Marketing, Navigate to the settings menu for the collection and use of personal information for advertising and marketing purposes. The main purposes of utilization are as follows:
- Delivering news about products and services, purchasing or usage solicitation
- Providing event information and benefits
- Providing advertisements during service use

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Security and Privacy Protection' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Collection and Use of Personal Information for Advertising and Marketing' menu.

title: Providing Personal Information to Third Parties for Marketing Purposes
description:
Providing Personal Information to Third Parties for Marketing Purposes, This is a consent and management menu for providing your Samsung Account's personal information to third parties for marketing purposes. If you do not wish to provide your information, you can select disagreement in the corresponding menu. There are no disadvantages when providing personal information to third parties for marketing purposes. The corresponding content and company may be added. At Samsung.com, we utilize your personal information.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung Account' > 'Security & Privacy Protection' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Provide Personal Information to Third Parties for Marketing Purposes' menu.

title: Samsung Privacy Website
description:
Samsung Privacy Website, This is a website that discloses the collection and use of Samsung's personal information.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account'> 'Security & Privacy' menu.
3. You can find the 'Samsung Privacy Website' menu here.

Or

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security & Privacy'> 'Other Personal Information Settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'Samsung Privacy Website' menu here.

You can manage your personal information for Samsung Account-based services by logging into the website.

title: Account recovery methods
description:
Account recovery methods, You can set up a recovery phone number and email address to use when suspicious activity is detected on your Samsung account, or if your Samsung account is locked.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung account' > 'Security and privacy'.
3. Here you can find the 'Account recovery methods' menu.

title: Recent Account Activity
description:
Recent Account Activity, You can now check the history of your logins with your Samsung account. You can review up to 20 instances of recent login activity or security changes within the past year.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung account' > 'Security and Privacy' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Recent Account Activity' menu.

title: Password
description:
Password, You can change the password of your Samsung account in the menu below:

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' > 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Here, select the 'Password' menu to change the password of your Samsung account.

title: Settings - Samsung Account - Contact Us
description:
Settings - Samsung Account - Contact Us, You can make inquiries about your Samsung account.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account'> 'More'> 'Help' menu in the upper right corner.
3. You can find the 'Contact Us' menu here.

title: Reset password.
description:
Reset password., This is how you can reset the password:

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account'> 'More View'> 'Help' menu in the upper right corner.
3. You can find the 'Find Password' menu here.

title: Help menu of Samsung account
description:
Help menu of Samsung account, The Help function by Samsung account supports password search and inquiry.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung Account' menu.
3. You can find the Help menu in the More View menu in the upper right corner.

title: Linked accounts
description:
Linked accounts, You can check third-party accounts linked to your Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Linked accounts' menu.

title: Samsung Apps and services
description:
Samsung Apps and services, We inform you of the apps and services that you can use with your Samsung account.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Samsung apps and services' menu.

title: Settings - Samsung Account - Samsung Find
description:
Settings - Samsung Account - Samsung Find, Go to the Samsung Find settings menu where you can check the location of your device that is logged into your Samsung account.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung Account' menu.
3. You can find the 'Samsung Find' menu here.

title: Galaxy sharing
description:
Galaxy sharing, This is a feature that allows you to share content with family or friends connected through a Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Galaxy sharing' menu.

title: Samsung Cloud
description:
Samsung Cloud, Go to the settings screen of Samsung Cloud using your Samsung account.
You can sync gallery photos and videos, Samsung Notes, and contacts on Samsung Cloud, and back up/ restore data.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Samsung Cloud' menu.

title: Security and privacy
description:
Security and privacy, "Security and privacy" menu is one of the features provided by Samsung account. It focuses on enhancing user security and privacy. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Security and privacy' menu.

This menu includes options like changing the password, checking logged-in devices, setting up two-step verification, configuring marketing information reception, and the privacy policy.

title: Places
description:
Places, You can save your places such as home, work, school, car, etc. in your Samsung account and use them in Bixby, Reminders, etc. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Places' menu.

title: Devices
description:
Devices, You can check the information of the devices that are logged in with your Samsung account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Devices' menu.

title: Settings - Samsung Account - Family
description:
Settings - Samsung Account - Family, You can create and use a family group for your Samsung account.
You can view the members of your family group and use family health data or shared album services.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung Account' menu.
3. You can find the 'Family' menu here.

※ Family deletion can only be performed by the administrator.

title: Profile Information
description:
Profile Information, You can check and edit the profile information of your Samsung account. The profile of the Samsung account is automatically created when the account is set up. There is no limit to the number of times you can change your profile information. Also, the profile information of your Samsung account is always synchronized.

 1. Run the 'Settings' app.
 2. Select the 'Samsung Account' menu.
 3. Here, you can find the 'Profile Information' menu.

title: Samsung account
description:
Samsung account, The Samsung account is an integrated account service that allows you to use various Samsung services with a single account, on mobile devices, TVs, Samsung Electronics websites, and more.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung account' menu.

For a list of services available with a Samsung account, please check the Samsung account website (account.samsung.com).

title: Notification when accessing clipboard
description:
Notification when accessing clipboard, How to adjust notifications when you access text, images, and other content copied from the app.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Control and Notification' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Notifications When Accessing the Clipboard' menu.

title: Microphone usage in apps
description:
Microphone usage in apps, Allow the app to use the microphone if you have the right permissions.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Control and Notification' menu.
3. You can find the 'Use Mike' menu here.
4. If you turn on the microphone usage menu, you can use the microphone in the app, and if you turn it off, you can not use the microphone in the app.

title: Disaster text message
description:
Disaster text message, In the event of a natural disaster, you can receive warning notifications such as evacuation instructions. This service is provided in collaboration with the National Emergency Management Agency, network providers and device manufacturers.
Disaster text is a feature that allows you to receive warning notifications on your device when a natural disaster occurs. In the event of a natural disaster, you can receive warning notifications such as evacuation instructions.
This service is provided in collaboration with the National Emergency Management Agency, network providers and device manufacturers.
*If there is a problem with your device or network conditions are poor, you may not receive notifications.

You can manage whether to allow disaster text alerts and disaster text preferences in the settings.

## Enter the disaster text menu
1. Select the More icon in the Messages app.
2. Select the ‘Settings’ menu.
3. Select the ‘Disaster Text’ menu.

## ## Enter disaster text menu 2
1. Run the Settings app.
2. Select the ‘Safety & Emergency’ menu.
3. Select the ‘Disaster Text’ menu.

## Setting alarm on/off
You can turn on/off the ‘Emergency Disaster Text’, ‘Missing Alert Text’, and ‘Safety Information Text’ alerts respectively.
Message app > More > Settings > Disaster text > Alarm settings to turn on/off each notification

## Check received disaster text messages
You can collect disaster texts received so far.
Messaging app > More > Settings > Disaster text > Received disaster text

## Setting up disaster text settings
You can manage detailed settings for disaster text notifications.
Message app > More > Settings > Disaster text message > Disaster text message settings for individual settings

title: Google Play system update
description:
Google Play system update, This is the latest security update from Google. Please update now for safe and stable use of the device. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'> 'Updates' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Google Play system update' menu here.

title: Security update
description:
Security update, Please install security updates to keep your cell phone safe. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'> 'Updates' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Security update' menu here.

title: Google Play Protect
description:
Google Play Protect, "Google Play Protect" is one of the security features provided by the Google Play Store. This feature is designed to protect your device from malicious software and hacking attacks.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and Privacy' > 'App Security'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Google Play Protect' menu.
4. In the upper right corner of Google Play Protect menu, you can turn the app scanning feature with 'Play Protect' on or off.

title: App protection
description:
App protection, To check regularly for malicious software or suspicious activity, turn on the following features. If there is a problem, you will be notified.
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'>'App security' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Google Play Protect' menu here.

title: Add fingerprint
description:
Add fingerprint, In order to use the fingerprint recognition function, fingerprint information must be registered and stored in the product.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Fingerprint' menu.
3. Please register your fingerprints according to the instructions on the screen.
4. After registering the fingerprint, click 'Check the registered fingerprint' to check whether the fingerprint is registered and with the designated name.

title: Face registration
description:
Face registration, Please register your face in the product and use the face recognition function.
To increase face recognition, register your face indoors or in the absence of direct sunlight.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. Check the instructions on the screen and press Continue.
4. Set the screen lock method.
5. Adjust the position of the product so that the face enters the frame on the screen.

If the face is recognized properly, the registration is completed.

title: Show switching effect when unlocking
description:
Show switching effect when unlocking, You can turn off/on the screen switching effect when unlocking with biometrics.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Lock Screen and AOD' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Show screen change effect when unlocking' switch.

This option is only available when biometric unlock is turned on.

title: Settings - Fingerprints
description:
Settings - Fingerprints, You can set your fingerprint as the screen lock method.
To use your fingerprint, you must first set the screen lock method and register your fingerprint.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Screen Lock and Biometrics' menu from 'Security and Personal Information Protection' or 'Lock Screen and AOD'.
3. You can find the 'fingerprint' menu here.

You can set the following detailed items in the menu.


### Add fingerprint
In order to use the fingerprint recognition function, fingerprint information must be registered and stored on the product.

Here's how you can set it up:
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and Privacy'.
3. Select 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'.
4. Choose the Fingerprint menu.
5. Please register your fingerprints according to the instructions on the screen.
6. After registering the fingerprint, click 'Check the registered fingerprint' to check whether the fingerprint is registered with the designated name.

※ Up to 4 fingerprints can be registered.


### Check registered fingerprint
You can scan your fingerprint to see if it is registered and what name it is designated by.
The setting method is as follows.
1. Select 'Settings'> 'Security and Personal Information Protection'.
2. Select 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'.
3. Choose Fingerprints.
4. Select 'Check registered fingerprints' and scan the fingerprints you want to check.


### Unlock fingerprint
Instead of drawing patterns, entering PINs, or passwords, you can unlock the screen by recognizing fingerprints.
The setting method is as follows.
1. Select 'Security and Personal Information Protection' on the 'Settings' screen.
2. Select 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'.
3. Choose Fingerprints.
4. You can turn the settings on/off by pressing the switch in 'Unlock Fingerprint'.


### Keep the lock screen until you push the screen
When you unlock with your fingerprint, the lock screen is maintained until you push the screen.
The setting method is as follows.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and Privacy'.
3. Select 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'.
4. Choose the Fingerprint menu.
5. Here, you can find the 'Keep the lock screen until you push the screen' menu.

title: Face recognition
description:
Face recognition, You can set up face recognization and set it to unlock the screen.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Face Recognition' menu.
3. In order to use face recognition, the screen lock method must be set first.
4. After registering the face, set the 'face recognition' functions.

title: Offline search for lost Galaxy devices
description:
Offline search for lost Galaxy devices, Participate in Galaxy Find Network. If you participate in the Galaxy Find Network, it helps you find Galaxy devices that others have lost,
If you lose your device (network is disconnected), you can check your location with the help of the device that participated in the surrounding Galaxy Find Network.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Protection of Lost Devices' menu.
3. You can find the 'Find Offline' menu here.

## Encrypt offline location information
When activated, you can securely encrypt and store location information stored on the server. You can only check after going through identity verification (PinCode).

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Protection of Lost Devices'> 'Find Offline' menu.
3. Here, you can find the "Encrypt Offline Location Information" menu, and if the "Menu is turned on," you can also set the "PIN Initialization" menu.

title: Allow this cell phone (tablet) to be found
description:
Allow this cell phone (tablet) to be found, You can set up to find or control your mobile phone (tablet) remotely in case your device, such as a mobile phone or tablet, is lost or stolen.

If you have registered your Samsung account on your device and turned on the 'Allow me to find this phone (tablet)' setting, you can use the service, and you can check the location of your device by logging in with your Samsung account on another mobile device or PC.

In case of theft or loss, you can check the location of your device and control it via features like ringing, locking, tracking location, deleting data, and increasing battery time.

If the device is powered off, it tells you the location information where the device is powered off.

## How to set up on mobile device
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Security & Privacy' > 'Lost Device Protection' > 'Find My Device' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Allow to Find This Cell Phone (Tablet)' menu.

## How to find My Device on PC
1. Go to the SmartThings Find website (https://smartthingsfind.samsung.com).
2. You can check the device location.

title: Send last location
description:
Send last location, This setting helps you find your lost device by checking the last location before it was turned off. If you enable this setting, the last location before the device is turned off or runs out of battery is saved on the server. 

1. Go to the 'Settings' menu of the device.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'Lost device protection' > 'Find My Mobile' section.
3. Here, you can find the 'Send last location' option.

title: Wi-Fi certificate
description:
Wi-Fi certificate, A Wi-Fi certificate is a digital certificate used to enhance security when accessing a wireless network and is a security measure for safely connecting to the network. 
When using the network, it allows access only to those with the appropriate certificate, protecting user personal information from external threats and supporting safe use of the network. 
 
You can install the App certificate file stored on your device for use as a Wi-Fi certificate. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' > 'Install from phone storage'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Wi-Fi certificate' menu. 
 
By selecting this item, you can install the certificate files stored on your device as Wi-Fi certificates.

title: VPN and app user certificate
description:
VPN and app user certificate, VPN and app user certificates are digital certificates used to enhance security when accessing VPN networks, serving as a means of securing connections to VPN networks.
When using a VPN network, it allows access only to appropriate certificate holders, protecting user information from external threats and ensuring safe use of the VPN network.

You can install the app certificate files stored on your device for VPN and app certificate use.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' > 'Install from phone storage'.
3. Here you can find the 'VPN and app user certificate' menu.

By selecting an item, you can install the certificate files stored on your device as VPN and app certificates.

title: CA certificate
description:
CA certificate, A CA certificate is a digital certificate issued by a trusted certification authority, serving as a security measure necessary to establish a secure communication channel between a server and a client. 
It is used to ensure the safety and reliability of information in an online environment, such as verifying the identity of a website or encrypting emails. 
 
You can install the CA certificate file stored on your device. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' > 'Install from phone storage'. 
3. Here, you can find the 'CA certificate' menu. 
4. By selecting the item, you can install the CA certificate file stored on your device.

title: Galaxy system apps
description:
Galaxy system apps, Security updates and performance enhancements, as well as new features, will be automatically installed from Samsung.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Galaxy system app update' menu.

title: Settings - Security & Privacy - App Pinning
description:
Settings - Security & Privacy - App Pinning, By pinning an app to the screen, you can use it without being interrupted by other functions. While it is locked, the use of functions such as calls and messages is limited.

## Menu path
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Security and Privacy’ > ‘Other Security Settings’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Pin App’ menu.

You can use this feature by activating ‘Pinning App’.

## How to use after activating app pinning
1. Open the app.
2. Press the recent apps button. (If you are using gestures, swipe the screen from bottom to top and pause for a moment.)
3. Tap the icon at the top of the app and select ‘Pin this app.’

title: Trust agents
description:
Trust agents, Apps set as security administrators can unlock the device without the user having to enter a PIN, password, or lock pattern when certain conditions are met, such as a Bluetooth device being connected or being in a specific location.
Only set trusted apps as security administrators. If you set too many apps as security administrators, others may have access to sensitive data on your device.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Trust agents' menu.

title: Certificate management app
description:
Certificate management app, You can access the certificate management app installed on your device to control installed certificates and remove the certificate management app.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings'.
3. Here you can find the 'Certificate management app' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can make additional settings such as 'Control installed certificates' and 'Delete certificate management app'.

title: Clear credentials
description:
Clear credentials, This will remove all certificates from your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and Privacy' > 'More Security Settings'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Clear credentials' menu.

title: Install from device storage
description:
Install from device storage, Please install the certificates stored in the storage.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Install from phone storage' menu.

title: User certificates
description:
User certificates, The user certificate is a certificate that the user has directly installed on the device through the 'Install certificates from device storage' menu.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'User certificates' menu.

title: View security certificates
description:
View security certificates, Displays a trusted CA certificate.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'View security certificates' menu here.

title: Make passwords visible
description:
Make passwords visible, When entering the password, the entered characters are briefly displayed.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Make passwords visible' menu.

title: Manage apps from unknown sources
description:
Manage apps from unknown sources, In general, it is safe to only install apps through official app stores such as the Play Store or Galaxy Store. However, sometimes you need to install an app using an apk file downloaded externally. App management from unknown sources provides information on apps downloaded and installed from external sources.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Security and Privacy’ > ‘Other Security Settings’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Manage apps from unknown sources’ menu.
4. Among the apps you have installed so far, you can check and manage apps that you do not remember exactly where you got them from or that are suspicious.

title: How to install apps from unknown sources
description:
How to install apps from unknown sources, In order to protect against malicious apps, it is defaulted that only apps from approved sources such as Play Store and Galaxy Store can be installed. Installing apps from other sources can damage your device and data. To install apps from other sources, allow sources from the list below.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Other Security Settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Install an app with an unknown source' menu.
4. If you select an item, you can set whether it will allow you to install apps from unknown sources.
5. It is recommended to activate it only when necessary and disable it normally to strengthen security.

title: Samsung Block chain Keystore
description:
Samsung Block chain Keystore, This function safely stores and manages the user's private key through a distributed ledger system using blockchain technology. This allows users to safely store and transfer cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'> 'More security settings' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Samsung Blockchain Keystore' menu here.

title: Enhanced data protection
description:
Enhanced data protection, Enhanced data protection is a security feature of Samsung that values user privacy. By using this feature, specific user data is stored with end-to-end encryption technology applied. End-to-end encrypted data can only be accessed on user devices that support enhanced data protection, and no one, including Samsung, can access it.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More security settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Enhanced data protection' menu.

title: Secure Wi-Fi
description:
Secure Wi-Fi, Secure Wi-Fi is a service that protects Wi-Fi network connections. By encrypting the data that travels over a Wi-Fi network, it prevents tracking of applications and websites, so you can use Wi-Fi networks safely. 
For example, if you use an unsecured Wi-Fi network in a public place like a coffee shop or airport, Secure Wi-Fi automatically turns on so others cannot hack your credentials or track your app and website activity. 
 
To use secure Wi-Fi 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'> 'More security settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'Secure Wi-Fi' menu here.
 
When you select an item, you can use the feature by pressing the Protect button. 
 
* If you are using it for the first time, you can use the function after pressing the Keep" button to accept the terms of use and permissions.

title: Secure Folder
description:
Secure Folder, The Secure Folder moves personal content such as photos, contacts and apps from your device to a separate secure space to ensure they are safely protected from others' view. It can protect your personal content and apps even when the device is not locked.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security & Privacy Protection' > 'Other Security Settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Secure Folder' menu.

Once you select an item, you will go through a login and authentication process. Once authenticated, you can place the desired apps or files in the Secure Folder for protection.
By setting this up, you can keep sensitive information and materials securely on your device.

title: Delete personal data
description:
Delete personal data, To delete your customized service data, press the button below. Some data that needs to be stored according to relevant laws may not be deleted, but it will be deleted immediately after the storage period.

To delete personal data, select [Data Deletion] from [Manage My Information] on the Samsung Privacy Website.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account' > 'Security and Privacy' > 'Customized Services' menu.
3. You can find the 'Delete Personal Data' menu here.

title: Download personal data
description:
Download personal data, To download personal data, select [Manage My Information > Download Data] on the Samsung privacy website.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select ‘Samsung Account’ > ‘Security & Privacy’ > ‘Customized Service’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Download personal data’ menu.

title: App Customization Settings
description:
App Customization Settings, In Customized Services, select an app to customize. It is possible to make a particular app provide custom services and actions based on the activities and interests of the user.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account'.
3. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection' menu.
4. Select 'Customized Service'.
5. Select the app you want to customize in 'App Customization Settings'.

The changes made here apply only to this mobile phone.

title: Data management
description:
Data management, Select the information you want to use to provide customized content and recommendations for customized services. This setting applies to all devices logged in with your Samsung account. You can select data to utilize for customized services such as call/message history, visit history, and search data.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Samsung Account'> 'Security and Personal Information Protection'> 'Customized Service' menu.
3. You can find the 'Manage Data' menu here.

title: Update location data sharing method
description:
Update location data sharing method, You can see which apps have changed how your location data is shared.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Security & Privacy’ > ‘Other Personal Information Settings’ menu.
3. Here you can find the ‘Update location data sharing method’ menu.

Here you can check apps that have changed their location data sharing method.
This could be an app that didn't share location data before or is now sharing data for advertising or marketing purposes.

title: Security & Privacy - Android Customization Services
description:
Security & Privacy - Android Customization Services, We use services provided by Google to recommend personalized content based on your app usage patterns.
(For example, text you typed in one app will appear as search suggestions when you use another app.)

1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Security & Privacy' > 'More Privacy Settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Android Personalization Services' menu.
4. When you select an item, you can see a detailed description of the service.

title: Send diagnostic data
description:
Send diagnostic data, You can set your consent for providing diagnostic and usage data.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More privacy settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Send diagnostic data' menu.

title: Samsung privacy website
description:
Samsung privacy website, Manage personal data related to Samsung account .
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy'>'More privacy settings' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Samsung privacy website' menu here.

title: Settings - Health Connect
description:
Settings - Health Connect, Now you can share your health and fitness information with multiple applications, and have complete control over your privacy through the Health Connect app.
Apps can send data to Health Connect based on the permissions you set, and Health Connect can store the data on your device for use by other applications.
This allows each connected app to have a better understanding of your health and wellness needs.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select 'Security and Privacy'.
3. Select the 'More Privacy Settings' menu.
4. You can find the 'Health Connect' menu here.

Health Connect has the following detailed settings.
- App permissions: Manages apps that have access to data stored on Health Connect. You can select by tapping an app to review which data you can read or write.
- Data and access: Manages access to data such as sleep, body measurements, and nutrition.
- Data management: You can perform automatic data deletion, data source priority management, unit settings, backup, and restoration.

title: Android System Intelligence
description:
Android System Intelligence, It is a system component within the Private Compute Core that enhances intelligent features across Android while keeping data private.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Security and privacy' > 'More privacy settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Android System Intelligence' menu.

title: Ads
description:
Ads, Ads' menu is a space that provides options related to the ad settings of a Google account. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More privacy settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Ads' menu.

title: Usage & diagnostics
description:
Usage & diagnostics, Allowing your device to send information about how you use and operate your device to Google helps improve the Android experience.
Google uses this information to provide more personalized services to users and to improve products and services for everyone.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'More privacy settings' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Usage & diagnostics' menu.

title: Google Account security
description:
Google Account security, Google Account Security' plays a crucial role in enhancing the safety of your Google account.
It is recommended to periodically visit and check your security settings, and update them if necessary.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' > 'Account security' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Google Account security' menu.

title: Samsung Account Security
description:
Samsung Account Security, The Samsung Account Security menu is one of the features provided by Samsung Account, focusing on strengthening user security and protecting personal information.

## ‘Samsung Account Security’ menu provided
- Password: You can change your Samsung account password.
- Recent account activity: You can check which devices have been logged in with your Samsung account.
- 2-step authentication: You can set up 2-step authentication.
- Collection and use of personal information for advertising and marketing: You can set whether to receive marketing information.
- Privacy Policy: You can check the privacy policy.


## How to enter the ‘Samsung Account Security’ menu
- ‘Settings’ > ‘Security & Privacy’ > ‘Account Security’ > ‘Samsung Account Security’

title: Security and privacy
description:
Security and privacy, You can check the security and privacy status of the product and change the settings.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu.

title: Permission Manager
description:
Permission Manager, You can easily check the functions or data allowed for the app and block unwanted permissions.

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Application’ menu.
3. You can find the ‘Permission Manager’ menu in the More menu at the top right.

title: More security settings
description:
More security settings, Various security settings are provided to protect the user's personal information and device.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'More security settings' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can make additional security settings such as 'Install unknown apps' and 'View security certificates', and you can activate or deactivate each item as needed.

title: Updates
description:
Updates, Check and update the software version of the product. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Updates' menu here.

title: App security
description:
App security, You can inspect apps to keep your product safe from malicious software.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'App security' menu.

title: Account security
description:
Account security, Enhance your device's security with Samsung account and Google account.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Account security' menu.

title: Automatic security risk blocking
description:
Automatic security risk blocking, Automatic security risk blocking protects against security threats, suspicious activities, and personal information risks.
It provides functions such as blocking apps from unauthorized sources, blocking commands delivered to USB cables, blocking malicious images in message apps, and blocking software updates using USB cables.
In addition, it provides additional strong protection with maximum limitations.

To use automatic security risk blocking, select the following menu.
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and Personal Information Protection' menu.
3. Select the 'Automatically Block Security Risks' menu.

* Automatic security risk blocking is provided on Galaxy devices with OneUI 6.0 or higher.

title: Permission usage
description:
Permission usage, Displays the status of apps using Android permissions.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Permission usage' menu by selecting 'Permissions used in last 24 hours'.

title: Show Charging Information
description:
Show Charging Information, If you turn on the 'Show Charging Information' setting, you can check the expected battery charging time on the screen even when Always On Display is turned off or not displayed.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery'> 'Charge Settings' menu.
3. You can find the 'Show Charging Information' menu here.

※ This function may not be supported on some models.

title: Fast wireless charging
description:
Fast wireless charging, You can quickly charge your device using a fast wireless charger.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' > 'Charging settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Fast wireless charging' menu.

* Some models may not support this feature.

title: Fast charging
description:
Fast charging, You can quickly charge your device using a fast charger.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' > 'Charging settings' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Fast charging' menu.

* This feature may not be supported on some models.

title: Adaptive power saving
description:
Adaptive power saving, You can automatically activate power saving mode based on usage patterns.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' > 'Power saving' menu.
3. Choose the 'Adaptive power saving' option in the More options menu.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

title: Battery optimization
description:
Battery optimization, Based on the usage, the battery can be optimized for longer use.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery'> 'Restrict background app usage' menu.
3. Select the 'Battery Optimization' menu in The View option.

title: Never auto sleeping apps
description:
Never auto sleeping apps, You can add apps to the Auto Sleep Exception list to prevent them from automatically entering sleep mode even when not in use.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Battery' > 'Background usage limits' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Never auto sleeping apps' menu.

title: Deep sleeping apps
description:
Deep sleeping apps, You can set the app to ultra-power saving mode to use less battery.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Battery' > 'Background usage limits' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Deep sleeping apps' menu.

title: Sleeping apps
description:
Sleeping apps, You can set the app to sleep mode to use less battery.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Battery' > 'Background usage limits' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Sleeping apps' menu.

title: Put unused apps to sleep
description:
Put unused apps to sleep, You can automatically switch unused apps to sleep mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Battery' > 'Background usage limits' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Put unused apps to sleep' menu.

title: Charging settings
description:
Charging settings, Changing Charging Settings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Charging settings' menu.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

title: Background usage limits
description:
Background usage limits, You can set rarely used apps to use less battery.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Background usage limits' menu.

title: Wireless power sharing
description:
Wireless power sharing, You can charge other devices using the battery of your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Wireless power sharing' menu.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

title: Show battery percentage
description:
Show battery percentage, Displays the remaining battery level in the status bar.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Show battery percentage' menu.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

title: Battery Protection feature
description:
Battery Protection feature, By activating 'battery protection', the phone automatically stops charging when the battery is fully charged, or you can set it to charge only to a certain level.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. You can find the 'Battery Protection' menu here.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.
* Long-term charging cable connection can have a bad effect on the battery. Protect the battery using 'battery protection'.

title: Power saving
description:
Power saving, You can extend battery life by activating power saving mode.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Power saving' menu.

Alternatively, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and tap the 'Power saving' icon to turn the feature on or off.
In this menu, you can set the following options:

- 'Decrease brightness by 10%': You can reduce screen brightness by 10% in power saving mode to use less battery.
- 'Limit CPU speed to 70%': You can limit the CPU speed to 70% in power saving mode to use less battery.
- 'Turn off Always On Display': You can turn off Always On Display in power saving mode to use less battery.
- 'Turn off 5G': You can switch from 5G to LTE in power saving mode to use less battery.
- 'Limit apps and Home screen': In power saving mode, to save maximum battery, only selected apps can be used, all background activities are restricted, and dark mode is applied.

* Some devices and modes may not support this feature and few of the options.

title: Battery
description:
Battery, You can check the available battery usage time and remaining capacity. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Battery' menu.

If the battery level is low, you can also activate the power-saving feature to reduce battery consumption.

title: Dim wallpaper when Dark mode is on
description:
Dim wallpaper when Dark mode is on, This is an option that darkens the wallpaper when dark mode is turned on. It helps reduce eye strain and improves wallpaper visibility.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Wallpaper and style' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Dim wallpaper when Dark mode is on' option.

title: Color palette
description:
Color palette, The color palette provides a standardized set of colors and is intended to offer a consistent experience across the device.
It analyzes the currently set wallpaper or lock screen and generates a palette that best matches it for recommendation.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Wallpaper and style' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Color palette' menu.

title: Settings - Wallpaper & Style - Change Wallpaper
description:
Settings - Wallpaper & Style - Change Wallpaper, You can set the home screen wallpaper and lock screen wallpaper.

## Images and videos that can be set as wallpaper
- Recommendation: Recommended image or video included in the terminal, recommended color, or color image selected through the color picker
- Gallery: User images or videos in the gallery, graphic images included in the terminal
- AI-generated wallpaper: Generated image, lock screen background image that changes depending on the weather and time
- Graphics: Graphic images made up of shapes and lines
- Color: regular color image, gradient image
- Wallpaper service: Wallpaper that changes every time you turn on the lock screen

## How to set up
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select ‘Wallpaper & Style’.
3. Select ‘Change Wallpaper’.

Here you can select various options such as ‘Gallery’, ‘AI Generated Wallpaper’, ‘Graphics’, ‘Colors’, etc.

title: Wallpaper and style
description:
Wallpaper and style, It is used to personalize the wallpaper. Using this menu, you can change the wallpaper or modify the style of the lock screen. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Wallpaper and style'.

Here, you can also adjust the color palette settings or the brightness of the wallpaper.

title: Walking monitor
description:
Walking monitor, You can run the walking monitor to monitor the time spent using the product while walking.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Walking monitor' menu.

title: Driving monitor
description:
Driving monitor, You can run the driving monitor to track the time you use the product while driving.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Driving monitor' menu.

title: Volume monitor
description:
Volume monitor, You can run the volume monitor to protect your hearing when listening to sound.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here, you can find and run the 'Loud listening timer' menu.

title: Screen time goal
description:
Screen time goal, You can set a goal for the amount of time to use your device for a day.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screen time goal' menu.

title: Parental controls
description:
Parental controls, You can restrict the content your children can use and set usage time goals for your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Parental controls' menu.

While using parental controls, the use of the secure folder is restricted.

title: App timers
description:
App timers, You can use the timer function to limit the amount of time you can use the app throughout the day. If you exceed the time limit, the app will be disabled and cannot be used.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'App timers' menu.

title: Digital Well-being and Child Protection - Weekly Report
description:
Digital Well-being and Child Protection - Weekly Report, It shows your digital habits over the past week.

## How to check the weekly report
1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘Digital Wellbeing and Parental Controls’ menu.
3. Find and select the bar graph-shaped ‘Weekly Report’ menu icon in the upper right corner.

Here, you can check your smartphone usage patterns, such as average daily usage time, usage by time period, and most used apps.
Weekly reports can be viewed on the last day of the week after the first run, and notifications can be turned on or off by selecting More (⋮) in the upper right corner.

title: Keep screen on while viewing
description:
Keep screen on while viewing, The front camera of the device recognizes your face and keeps the screen on while you are looking at it.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Screen timeout' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Keep screen on while viewing' option.

title: Enhanced comfort
description:
Enhanced comfort, Adjust the tint and contrast to comfortably view the phone screen at night.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Eye comfort shield' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Enhanced comfort' menu.

When you activate the feature, the tint and contrast are adjusted for comfortable viewing at night.

title: Show recently used apps
description:
Show recently used apps, You can display recently used apps on the taskbar. (The feature is only supported on fold and tablet large screen devices. )

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Display'> 'Taskbar' menu.
3. You can find the 'Show recently used apps' menu here.

If you activate the function, you can display the recently used apps on the taskbar, and you can select up to 2 to 4 apps to be shown.

title: Circle to Search
description:
Circle to Search, You can set up to enable or disable the search function with Circle.
To search the contents on the screen, press and hold the Home button or the navigation handle.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Navigation bar' menu.
3. Here, you can activate the 'Circle to Search' function.

If no assistant app is designated, this menu will not be provided.

title: Assistant app
description:
Assistant app, You can set the Assistant feature to be turned on or off.
To open the Digital Assistant app, swipe inward from one of the bottom corners.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Navigation bar' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Assistant app' menu.

title: More options
description:
More options, You can manage the Home, Back, and Recent Apps buttons, or set up gestures for a larger screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Display' > 'Navigation bar'.
3. Here you will find the 'More options' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can change the 'Button order' or adjust the swipe 'Gesture sensitivity (Main screen)'.

If you are using a case, it may be difficult to use gestures from the edges of the screen. In that case, set the sensitivity to high.
If gestures are recognized unintentionally, try lowering the sensitivity.

title: Navigation type
description:
Navigation type, Home, Back, and Recent Apps buttons can be managed or gestures for wide screens can be set. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select 'Display' > 'Navigation bar' menu. 
 
In the detailed settings, you can change the style of the 'Navigation bar' to 'Buttons' or 'Swipe gestures'.

title: Bold font
description:
Bold font, You can make the default text bold.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Font size and style' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Bold font' option.

When you enable this feature, the text on your phone will be displayed in bold.

title: Font style
description:
Font style, You can change the font. Four default fonts are provided: 'Default', 'SamsungOne', 'Gothic Bold', and 'Roboto'. Additionally, you can download more fonts from the Galaxy Store.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Font size and style' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Font style' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can choose from the four default fonts or the fonts downloaded from the Galaxy Store.

title: Font size
description:
Font size, You can adjust the font size. It can be adjusted in 8 steps from the smallest size to the largest size.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Font size and style' menu.
3. Move the slider to the left or right to make the font smaller or larger.

Alternatively, you can adjust it by saying 'Increase font size' or 'Decrease font size' to Bixby.

title: Screen saver
description:
Screen saver, Set the screen saver to run when the device is charging. The screen saver will run when the screen turns off automatically.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Select the 'Screen Saver' menu.
4. Here you can set the 'Screen Saver' and choose to run it as 'Color' or 'Photo Composition'.

When you activate the function, the screen saver you set will appear while the device is not in use, protecting the screen.

title: Touch sensitivity
description:
Touch sensitivity, Increases sensitivity so that touch is recognized even when using a screen protector on your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Display'.
3. Here, you can find the 'Touch sensitivity' menu.

When this feature is enabled, the sensitivity increases to the point where touch is recognized even if your fingers are wet or you are wearing gloves.

title: Accidental touch protection
description:
Accidental touch protection, When your mobile phone is in a dark place such as a pocket or bag, set it to prevent the screen from being pressed incorrectly.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Accidental touch protection' menu.

title: Continuing App Usage from Cover Screen
description:
Continuing App Usage from Cover Screen, You can set apps to continue using them on the cover screen after closing the folder from the main display.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Continue apps on cover screen' option.

In the detailed settings, all the installed apps will be displayed, and you can activate the apps you want to continue using on the cover screen.
If you want to enable it for all apps, activate the 'All apps' option.

title: How to set the navigation bar
description:
How to set the navigation bar, You can turn the taskbar feature off or on.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. You can find the 'Taskbar' menu here.

When you activate the function, you can check 'Taskbar' at the bottom of the mobile phone screen when you run the app, and you can select and run the app.

This feature is only supported on fold and tablet large screen devices.

title: Edge Panel
description:
Edge Panel, You can use the Edge panel to run frequently used apps or functions.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Edge panel' menu.

When you enable the feature, the 'Edge panel' is activated, allowing you to quickly access various apps or tools by sliding from the edge of the screen. Additionally, you can adjust the 'position' and 'transparency' of the 'Edge panel' and add your desired apps or tools.

In this menu, you can make the following detailed settings:
- 'Panel':
  You can select which panels to display and set 'Hide on lock screen'.
- 'Handle':
  Adjust the position or transparency of the panel.

title: Easy mode
description:
Easy mode, Configure the home screen simply to make the mobile phone easy to use and change the items displayed on the screen to be larger.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Easy mode' menu.

When you activate this feature, the screen changes with large icons and a simple design to help you use your mobile phone easily.

title: Screen timeout
description:
Screen timeout, You can set the time for your device's screen to turn off automatically.
This allows you to conveniently control the time the screen turns off when not in use.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screen timeout' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can select your desired 'Screen timeout' duration.

title: Camera Area
description:
Camera Area, Set the front camera to be hidden from the screen.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Camera area' menu.
4. For the necessary apps, you can set it to 'Auto', 'Show camera area', or 'Hide camera area'.

title: Full screen apps
description:
Full screen apps, You can set the display ratio for each app.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Full screen apps' menu.

In the detailed settings, a list of all installed apps will be displayed, and you can select and use one of the 'Full screen', '16:9', or '4:3' ratios for each app.

title: Font size and style
description:
Font size and style, You can change the font size and style.
1. Go to the 'Settings' menu.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Font size and style' menu.

In the detailed settings, options to set 'Font', 'Bold text', and 'Font size' are provided, allowing you to customize your phone's screen configuration according to your preference. The font types support various downloadable fonts, offering a wide range of choices. You can also ask Bixby to 'Increase font size' or 'Decrease font size'.

title: Screen mode
description:
Screen mode, Change the screen mode to adjust the color and contrast of your device display.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screen mode' menu.

In the detailed settings, you can choose between 'Vivid' or 'Natural' screen modes according to your preference. Additionally, if you set it to 'Vivid', you can further adjust the 'White balance' and sharpness of the screen in the 'Advanced settings'.

title: Eye comfort shield
description:
Eye comfort shield, Limit the blue light on the screen to reduce eye strain.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Eye comfort shield' menu.

Alternatively, swipe down from the top of the screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and tap the 'Eye comfort shield' icon to turn the feature on or off.

When activated, the feature slightly tints the screen yellow to reduce blue light. This setting helps alleviate eye strain. 
• 'Adaptive' mode will automatically adjust the screen's color temperature based on the time of day.  
• 'Custom' mode to set your preferred activation time and color temperature.

title: Motion smoothness
description:
Motion smoothness, Change the screen refresh rate. Setting a higher refresh rate allows you to view the screen more smoothly without stuttering. 
 
1. Open the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Display' > 'Motion smoothness' menu. 
3. Choose the desired screen refresh rate here. 
 
• 'Adaptive': Set the screen refresh rate to automatically adjust up to 120 Hz for vivid animation quality and smooth screen transitions. 
• 'Standard': Set to a standard refresh rate in regular situations to save battery.

title: Adaptive brightness
description:
Adaptive brightness, The system remembers the environment where the user adjusted the screen brightness and sets the screen brightness to automatically adjust according to the surroundings.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Adaptive brightness' menu.

When you enable this feature, the screen brightness automatically adjusts according to the surroundings, making it more comfortable for your eyes and helping to reduce battery consumption.

title: Brightness
description:
Brightness, You can adjust the screen brightness of your device.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Brightness' menu.

This setting is provided with a slider that allows you to adjust the 'Brightness'. You can move the slider left or right to set the desired 'Brightness'.

title: Dark mode settings
description:
Dark mode settings, When using your device at night or in dark places, apply dark mode to reduce eye strain. You can also set a time to use dark mode.
Even if the set time arrives, the screen will not switch to dark mode if it is on. It will change after the screen is turned off.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Dark mode settings' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and toggle the 'Dark mode' icon to turn the feature on or off.

In the detailed settings, you can enable the 'Turn on as scheduled' menu to turn it on at:
→ 'Sunset to sunrise'
→ 'Custom schedule'

title: Screen zoom
description:
Screen zoom, This is a feature that adjusts the size of the screen that the user is viewing. It is used when the content on the screen is too small to see or, on the other hand, when it is too large and cannot be seen on the screen.

On some models, the user can also choose the layout of the screen they are viewing as a multi-view or standard view (single view).

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Display' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Screen zoom' or 'Screen layout and size' menu.

title: App protection settings
description:
App protection settings, You can keep your product safe by checking for malware and suspicious activity. 

##To check malware and suspicious activity:
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Device care' > 'App protection' menu. 
3. You can find the 'App protection settings' menu in the View option. 

##You can set the following options in the 'App protection settings' menu: 
1. Automatically inspect the product every day for malware and suspicious activities. 
2. Check the product for malware and suspicious activities when the app is installed. 

This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

title: RAM Plus
description:
RAM Plus, RAM Plus provides virtual memory using storage space.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device care' > 'Memory' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'RAM Plus' menu.

In this menu, you can change or disable the 'RAM Plus' size.
* This feature may not be supported on some models.

title: Excluded apps
description:
Excluded apps, You can set apps to be excluded from memory cleanup. If added to the excluded apps, they will be excluded from memory cleanup. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Device care' > 'Memory' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Excluded apps' menu.

title: Memory resident apps
description:
Memory resident apps, The memory-resident app always runs in the background. Some apps need to be always running to function properly, but if there are too many memory-resident apps, it can slow down your device. Switching unused memory-resident apps to ultra power saving mode can help improve performance.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Device care' > 'Memory' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Memory resident apps' menu.

In this menu, memory-resident apps are displayed. You can select an app and press the ultra power saving button to switch it to ultra power saving mode.

title: Performance profile
description:
Performance profile, You can choose performance considering the processing speed, battery usage, and temperature of the product. 
→ 'Standard': It balances processing speed, battery usage, and temperature control of the product. 
→ 'Light': It prioritizes battery usage and temperature control over processing speed. 

1. Launch the 'Settings' app. 
2. Select the 'Device care' menu. 
3. Here you can find the 'Performance profile' menu. 

* This feature may not be supported on some models.

title: Auto optimization
description:
Auto optimization, Various optimization tasks such as closing background apps or clearing memory will be automatically performed.
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device care' menu.
3. You can find the 'Auto optimization' menu here.

* This feature may not be supported on some models and modes.

In this menu, you can set the following options.
→ 'Restart when needed': You can set the product to restart automatically when a performance problem occurs.
→ 'Restart on schedule': You can set the product to restart automatically within 1 hour from the set time.

title: Show Device care on Apps screen
description:
Show Device care on Apps screen, You can add device care to the Apps screen. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select 'Device care' > Tap on More view option > 'Settings' menu 
3. You can find the 'Show Device care on Apps screen' menu here.

You can add an icon to run 'Device care' directly on the Apps screen by activating 'Show Device care on the Apps screen'.

title: Maintenance mode
description:
Maintenance mode, You can set up Repair Mode to protect your personal information when your device is up for repairs or servicing.
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device Care' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Repair Mode' menu under Additional Care.

title: Diagnostics
description:
Diagnostics, You can check the status of your phone on Samsung Members.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Device care' > 'Additional Care' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Diagnostics' menu.

In this menu, you can find:
- 'Phone diagnostics'.
- 'App battery usage diagnostics'.
- 'App safety diagnostics'.

* The Samsung Members app must be installed to use this feature.

title: App permissions
description:
App permissions, You can safely protect your device by checking your phone for malware and suspicious activity. 

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Device care'>'App Permissions' menu.

title: Memory
description:
Memory, You can check the memory usage, and by pressing 'Clean now', you can free up memory by clearing non-active apps.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device care' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Memory' menu.

In this menu, you can check the total memory size and available memory size.

title: Storage
description:
Storage, You can check the usage and remaining capacity of your storage space, and secure more storage by identifying and deleting unnecessary files such as those in the recycle bin, unused apps, duplicate files, etc. 

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device Care' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Storage Space' menu.

title: Device care
description:
Device care, You can check battery and storage, memory usage, security status, and optimization management status at a glance and optimize your device.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Device care' menu.
Here, you can run the 'Fix now' or 'Optimize now' features.

title: Connected devices
description:
Connected devices, This feature helps you easily connect with other Galaxy devices from your mobile phone or tablet.
With this feature, you can easily connect Galaxy phones, tablets, watches, and earbuds to use multiple devices more conveniently.

##How to Access Settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.

title: Android Auto
description:
Android Auto, You can connect your mobile to your car to use some features of the product on the car's display.

##How to Enter Settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Android Auto' menu.

* You can check the settings menus of the Android Auto app after it has been updated through the Play Store.

title: Continue apps on other devices
description:
Continue apps on other devices, You can continue using the apps you were using on your device on another device that uses the same Samsung account.
You can paste the content copied from one device to another, or continue using the Samsung Internet and Samsung Notes apps on another device.

##How to Enter Settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Continue apps on other devices' menu.

##How to Use
1. Log in with the same account on both devices you are using.
2. Turn on the 'Continue apps on other devices' setting on both devices.

title: Auto switch Buds
description:
Auto switch Buds, You can set your Galaxy Buds to connect to your device when making or receiving calls or playing media content, even if they are connected to another device. However, both devices must use the same Samsung account, and this feature can only be used when you are wearing the Galaxy Buds.

##How to Access Settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. You can find the 'Auto switch Buds' menu here.

##How to Use
1. Log in with the same account on both devices.
2. Enable cloud sync in advanced Bluetooth settings, or connect and register the Buds on both devices.
3. Turn on the Buds Auto Switch setting.
* It only works when you are wearing the Buds.

title: SmartThings
description:
SmartThings, ##Description of the setting
SmartThings is an app that is compatible with over 100 brands, including Samsung Smart TVs and appliances, allowing you to control all smart devices in one place. You can monitor the status of various connected devices inside and outside your home, control them, and once set up, you can have the devices operate automatically when desired.

##How to access settings
1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. You can find the 'SmartThings' menu here.

* Depending on the specifications of some devices, this feature may not be supported.

title: Call & text on other devices
description:
Call & text on other devices, You can connect your phone to your Tablet, Watch, PC, etc. to exchange calls or messages from your connection device to your phone number. The service is available when the function is activated on both the mobile phone and the connection device, and you can select the phone number, network, etc. you want to use. 
 
How to enter setting? 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu. 
3. You can add a 'Call & text on other devices' tile to the quick panel, touch the tile to turn off or turn on  'Call & text on other devices'', and enter the menu. 
Setting Options: Mobile Phone 
1. If you have more than one phone number available on your phone, press the phone number displayed on the  'Call & text on other devices' setting screen to select the phone number you want to use on your connecting device. You can choose one or both the phone numbers. 
2. You can also set up a network to use, and you can choose between 'Wi-Fi only' or 'Wi-Fi or Mobile network'. 
3. You can turn off and turn on the texting function of the connecting devices on your phone. By activating/disabling the  'Call & text on other devices' or 'Text on Other Devices' switches, you can control the phone or text function of all connected devices at once. You can also control each connected device shown on the list by tapping  'Call & text on other devices' or 'Text on Other Devices'. 
 
Settings Options: Tablet 
1. Enable/disable the 'Use phone function on this tablet' and 'Use message function on this tablet' switches to control phone or text functions. 
2. You can check the connection status with your mobile phone. If 'Call from another device' or 'Text from another device' is activated on the mobile phone, it is displayed as 'Connected', and if all are disabled, it is displayed as 'Not Connected'. 
3. For LTE models, you can also set up a network to use, and you can choose between 'Wi-Fi only' or 'Wi-Fi or mobile network'. 
 
* Mobile phones and connectors must use the same Samsung account, and some functions of phone and message may not be supported depending on the situation.

title: Link to Windows
description:
Link to Windows, You can use the features (notifications, messages, apps, etc.) of your mobile device on a Windows PC and mirror the screen of your mobile device.

##How to set up to use the features (notifications, messages, apps, etc.) of a mobile device on a Windows PC:
  1. Mobile device settings
   - Select 'Settings' > 'Connected devices' > Turn on 'Link to Windows'
  2. Windows PC settings
   - Run the 'Phone Link' app
