Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen on your mobile device to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and tap the 'Link to Windows' icon to turn the feature on or off.

##How to use mobile apps using 'Link to Windows'
  1. Run the 'Phone Link' app > Select 'Apps'
  2. In the 'Apps' menu, you can check 'Recent apps' and 'All apps'
  3. Run the desired app (up to 4 apps can be run)
  4. You can add the desired app to 'Favorites'
  5. Consent to use the app on the mobile device
    - Consent popup: On your mobile device, 'Would you like to start recording or transmitting with Link to Windows? > Click 'Start'

##How to mirror the screen of a mobile device using 'Link to Windows'
  1. Run the 'Phone Link' app > Select 'Apps'
  2. Click 'Open phone screen'
  3. Consent to use mirroring on the mobile device
    - Consent popup: On your mobile device, 'Would you like to start recording or transmitting with Link to Windows?'

##How to set up features on a Windows PC
  - Path: Run the 'Phone Link' app on your Windows PC > 'Settings' > 'Features'
    1. You can turn notifications, messages, apps, calls, and photo viewing on/off
    2. In 'Additional settings', you can turn wallpaper, copy and paste content to other devices, and audio player features on/off

##Precondition settings
  1. Both devices to be connected must be logged into the same Microsoft account
  2. Bluetooth and Wi-Fi settings must be on, and both devices must be connected to the same Wi-Fi

title: Multi control
description:
Multi control, A mouse and keyboard connected to a Samsung computer that supports this feature can be used.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. You can find the 'Multi control' menu here.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the phone's screen to open the 'Quick Settings Window' and tap the 'Multi control' icon to turn the function on or off.

title: Smart View
description:
Smart View, Connects to a TV or monitor that supports screen mirroring to view the product's screen on a large screen.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. You can find the 'Smart View' menu here.

title: Galaxy Wearable
description:
Galaxy Wearable, If you connect the product and the Galaxy wearable device, you can set the wearable device. 
 
1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone. 
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu. 
3. You can find the 'Galaxy Wearable' menu here.

title: Auto sync data
description:
Auto sync data, Your account data is automatically synchronized to always keep the information up to date.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and backup' > 'Manage accounts' menu.
3. Here, you can see a list of accounts registered on the current device.
4. You can change the 'Auto sync data' settings here.

title: Accounts and backup
description:
Accounts and backup, You can synchronize data to the cloud provided by Samsung, or back up and restore product data. You can log in with your Samsung or Google account, or use Smart Switch to transfer or import data to another device.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and backup' menu.

Here, you can manage the accounts registered on the current device or set up to back up or restore data.

title: External Storage Data Transfer
description:
External Storage Data Transfer, You can back up the data from your previous device to a USB storage device or SD card and then restore it in your new Galaxy.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and Backup' menu.
3. Select the 'External Storage Data Transfer' menu to launch Smart Switch.

For more information, visit www.samsung.com/sec/apps/smart-switch.

title: Sending or Receiving Data
description:
Sending or Receiving Data, You can transfer data from your old device to your new Galaxy using Smart Switch.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and Backup' menu.
3. Choose the 'Send or Receive Data' menu to launch Smart Switch.

You can transfer data using the following methods:

■ Transfer data via USB cable
Connect your old device and new Galaxy with a USB cable to transfer data.

■ Transfer data wirelessly
Connect your old device and new Galaxy wirelessly (Wi-Fi Direct) to transfer data.

■ Transfer data using external storage
Back up data from your old device to external storage and then restore it to your new Galaxy.

For more information, visit www.samsung.com/sec/apps/smart-switch.

title: Restore data
description:
Restore data, You can restore the data you backed up to Samsung Cloud to your mobile phone.

1. Run the 'Settings' app on your phone.
2. Select 'Accounts and backup' > 'Restore data' under Samsung Cloud and select the device you want.
3. Select the item you want to restore and press the 'Restore' button.

title: Manage accounts
description:
Manage accounts, You can add and sync accounts to use on products such as Samsung accounts or Google accounts.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Accounts and backup' > 'Manage accounts' menu.
3. Here, you can see a list of accounts currently registered on the device.

##To add an account 
* Press the '+ Add account' button at the bottom and select the service you want to use.

##To delete an account
* Press the name of the account and select 'Remove account' in the steps displayed on the screen.

title: Back up data (Google Drive)
description:
Back up data (Google Drive), You can back up your device's data to Google Drive.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Accounts and backup' > 'Back up data' under 'Google Drive'.
3. Here, you can set up Google Drive backup information.

• Not all data on your device will be backed up during data backup.

title: Back up data (Samsung Cloud)
description:
Back up data (Samsung Cloud), You can back up data stored on your device to Samsung Cloud.

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select 'Accounts and backup' > 'Back up data' menu under Samsung Cloud.
3. Toggle the switch for items you want to back up and then press the 'Back up now' button.
4. Press 'Done'.

* The selected items will be automatically backed up every 24 hours under automatic backup conditions.
  - Automatic backup conditions: While charging, connected to Wi-Fi, and with the screen off.
* Not all data on your device will be backed up. You can check the items that will be backed up by selecting 'Accounts and backup' under the settings screen and then 'Backup data' under Samsung Cloud.
* To view items backed up to Samsung Cloud from another device, select 'Accounts and backup' > 'Restore data' from the settings screen and then choose the desired device.
※ The path to access Samsung Cloud and the supported features may vary depending on the device, OS, and country.

title: Use your cell phone as a toolbar
description:
Use your cell phone as a toolbar, You can configure your tablet's toolbar to display on your phone.
However, this feature is only available on tablets.

##How to Set Up 'Using Your Phone as a Toolbar'
1. Go to Samsung Notes.
2. Go to 'Samsung Notes Settings' in the top left corner.
3. Select the 'Using Your Phone as a Toolbar' option.

title: Secure connection to HTTPS
description:
Secure connection to HTTPS, When visiting certain unencrypted websites, if the site supports encrypted HTTPS, it will automatically connect to that site. Even if the user has directly input http or the access link is in http, if the same page supports HTTPS, it will automatically connect to HTTPS for better security. 

If you do not wish to use this feature, you can deactivate it through separate settings.

Related settings can be found under 'Internet Menu' > 'Settings' > 'Privacy Status' > 'Secure Connection with HTTPS'.

title: Reply suggestions
description:
Reply suggestions, The 'Suggested Reply' function recommends an appropriate reply based on the contents of the notification message received on the cover screen and Watch.

##How to set 'Recommend reply':
1. Open 'Settings'. 
2. Select 'Galaxy AI' option.
3. Select 'Chat assist' menu.
4. Select 'Suggested replies' menu.

Here, you can select the top switch of the screen and turn on and turn off the 'Suggested replies' function.

title: Drawing Assist
description:
Drawing Assist, Awaken the artistic sense within you. Simple sketches can be reborn as great images, and portraits can be changed into various styles such as cartoons and characters.

If you express the image you want to create in words, it will create a great work.

The drawing assist feature can be used in 'Samsung Notes', 'Samsung Keyboard', 'Air Command', 'AI Select', and 'Edge Panel'.

You can change your drawing into a work of art not only with a pen but also with your hand. If you have a hard time drawing, try entering text together.

You can get a better picture by adding colors or textures with text.

Drawing Assist provides various styles to help you get the picture you want.

Drawing Assist settings can be found in the Galaxy Settings menu > Galaxy AI.

## How to use in Edge Panel
1. Select the 'Drawing Assist' feature in the Edge Panel.
2. Draw the desired picture on the panel with your finger or S Pen. You can also load an image or add text.
3. Choose the desired style and press the 'Create' button.
4. Swipe to check the result, and you can save, share, or move to another app.

## How to use in Air Command
1. Select the 'Drawing Assist' feature in Air Command.
2. Draw the desired picture on the panel with your finger or S Pen. You can also load an image or add text.
3. Choose the desired style and press the 'Create' button.
4. Swipe to check the result, and you can save, share, or move to another app.

## How to use in AI Select
1. Select 'AI Select' in the Edge Panel.
2. Select the desired image and then select the 'Drawing Assist' feature from the recommended options.
3. Choose the desired style and press the 'Create' button.
4. Swipe to check the result, and you can save, share, or move to another app.

## How to use in Samsung Internet
1. If you find an image you want to change the style of while using Samsung Internet, press and hold the image.
2. Select 'Drawing Assist' from the menu that appears.
3. Choose the desired style and press the 'Create' button.
4. Swipe to check the result, and you can save, share, or move to another app.

title: Audio Playback
description:
Audio Playback, Audio playback settings are a function that determines where the audio sound is heard. You can choose between speakers and receivers. If you only want to hear the sound in an open place, select the receiver option. To listen with others, select the speaker option.

Try setting it as follows:

1. Open the voice recording app
2. Run voice recording settings
3. Enter audio playback and select speaker or receiver

title: Block back button execution during editing
description:
Block back button execution during editing, You can take advantage of the option to block the back button from running while you are editing in Samsung Notes. When you activate this option, it does not work even if you press the back button in Edit mode.

## Block back button execution during editing setting method:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select Settings option.
3. Turn on/off 'Block Back button while editing' menu.

title: Hide scroll bar while editing
description:
Hide scroll bar while editing, You can take advantage of the scrollbar hide option during editing in Samsung Notes. When this option is enabled, the scrollbar is not exposed in Edit mode.

## Hide scroll bar during editing setting method:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select Settings option.
3. Turn on/off 'Hide scroll bar while editing' menu.

title: Link preview
description:
Link preview, You can utilize the Show web previews option in Samsung Notes.

##How to set up 'Show web previews'
1. Navigate to Samsung Notes.
2. Move to 'Samsung Notes Settings' at the top left.
3. Select 'Show web previews'

title: Show links in notes
description:
Show links in notes, You can set the lock options required to open locked note files from Samsung Notes.

## Password and Biometrics setting method:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select Settings option.
3. Select 'Show links in notes' menu.

title: Fetch note
description:
Fetch note, You can import notes using the 'Import Notes' function from Samsung Notes.

## Import Note setting method:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select Settings option.
3. Select 'Import notes' menu.

title: Samsung Notes Lock Settings
description:
Samsung Notes Lock Settings, You can set the lock options required to open locked note files from Samsung Notes.

1. Go to Samsung Note.
2. Go to 'Samsung Notes Settings' in the upper left corner.
3. Select 'Password and biometrics'.

You can change your password here or set it to use biometrics when locking.

title: Default Note Style
description:
Default Note Style, You can set 'Default Note Style' in Samsung Notes. You can set up default 'style', 'template', and 'color'.

## How to set Basic Note Style: 
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select Settings option.
3. Select 'Default note style' menu.

title: Synchronize shared notes
description:
Synchronize shared notes, You can set how to synchronize shared notes in Samsung Notes when connected to Wi-Fi

## How to set Shared Note Synchronization when connected Wi-Fi or mobile data:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select 'Settings' option.
3. Select 'Sync shared notes using' in the menu and the option needed.

title: Synchronize to Microsoft OneNote
description:
Synchronize to Microsoft OneNote, If you synchronize your Samsung notes with Microsoft OneNote, you can check them on the OneNote app or the Outlook web.

## Sync to Microsoft OneNote setting method:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select 'Settings' option.
3. Select 'Sync to Microsoft OneNote' menu.

title: Synchronize with Samsung Cloud
description:
Synchronize with Samsung Cloud, If you synchronize Samsung Notes with the cloud, you can link it with other devices using the same Samsung account. 

## How to set Sync with Samsung Cloud:
1. Go to 'Samsung Notes' app > Tap on More view option in upper left corner.
2. Select 'Settings' option.
3. Select 'Sync with Samsung Cloud' menu.

title: Bixby Vision displayed on the Apps screen
description:
Bixby Vision displayed on the Apps screen, To run the ‘Bixby Vision’ app, you must find the ‘Bixby Vision’ app icon on the Apps screen.
Once you find the icon, you can click on it and go in to run the app.
If you are having trouble finding the icon, search for ‘Bixby Vision’ in the ‘Search’ window on the Apps screen to find it.

title: Data and access
description: Data and access, Check Health Connect's data 1. Please enter the 'Settings' menu on your phone. 2. Please find and select 'Security and Personal Information Protection' in the 'Settings' menu. 3. Please find and select the item 'Other Personal Information Settings' here. 4. Please find and select the 'Health Connect' item here. 5. Please find and select the 'Data and Access' item here.

title: Photo assist
description:
Photo assist, There is a menu that consists of photo assist function in the photo editor, a photo assist function description, a personal information processing policy and terms of use link, and a Galaxy AI function link. 
If you set the photo assist to enable in that menu, the generative editing function in the adjustment menu will be available. 
If you set the photo assist to disable, you will not be able to use the photo assist function. 
 
In order to use this function, images are processed to Samsung account login and server to provide links to related personal information processing policies and terms of use. 
 
Photo Assist is one of the Galaxy AI functions and provides a link to check all Galaxy AI functions.

title: Photo Editor Settings
description: Photo Editor Settings, The Photo Editor is an app that allows you to edit photos. The Photo Editor provides settings in a menu format. In the Photo Editor settings, you can find menus related to \"Photo Assist\" and \"Drawing Assist\", as well as information about the permissions used by the app and details about the Photo Editor. You can access the Photo Editor settings as follows:\n#Accessing Photo Editor Settings\nPhoto Editor App > More Options (⁝) > Settings

title: Call setup
description: Call setup, You can use various settings of call settings. 1. Please enter the 'Call Settings' menu. 2. You can use various settings of call settings here.

title: Other call settings
description: Other call settings, You can set up various call settings, such as hiding unnumbered contacts, making international calls, and pushing to make calls or messages. 1. Please enter the 'Call Settings' menu. 2. Please enter the 'Other Call Settings' menu 3. You can set up call settings for various functions here.

title: Incoming phone screen while using app
description:
Incoming phone screen while using app, When you receive a call while using this app, you can select the incoming call screen.

1. Please enter the 'Call settings' menu in 'Phone' app through 'Settings' from Tap on more view option.
2. Please find and select the 'Call display while using apps' in the 'Call settings' menu.
3. Here, you can choose between 'Full screen', 'Small pop-up', and 'Mini pop-up'.

### 'Keep calls in pop-up' screen on even during call
1. Use 'Call settings'> 'Call display while using apps'> 'Keep calls in pop-up'.

###'Keep calls in pop-up'off during call
1. Do not use 'Call settings'> 'Call display while using apps'> 'Keep calls in pop-up'.

title: Call Rejection Message
description:
Call Rejection Message, This manages the list of call rejection messages when a call is received.
1. Please go to the 'Call Settings' menu.
2. Find and select 'Call Rejection Message' within the 'Call Settings' menu.
3. Here, you can manage the 'Call Rejection Message' list.

## How to Add to the 'Call Rejection Message' List
1. Go to 'Call Settings' > 'Call Rejection Message' > Enter message > Click '+' button to add.
(The list supports up to 6 items only.)

## How to Delete from the 'Call Rejection Message' List
1. Go to 'Call Settings' > 'Call Rejection Message', click on '-' button from an added message to delete it.

## How to Edit a 'Call Rejection Message'
1. Go to 'Call Settings'> Select an added message from the list of  > Edit content > Click save button. This allows you edit a message.

title: Answering and ending calls
description:
Answering and ending calls, You can use features such as the call answering gesture, reading out the caller's name, etc.

1. Please go to the 'Call Settings' menu.
2. Please enter 'Answering and ending calls'.
3. From here, you can use features like 'Call Answering Gesture', 'Read Caller's Name', 'Auto Answer', etc.

title: Phone Notifications and Ringtones
description:
Phone Notifications and Ringtones, You can set up phone notifications and ringtones. You can check menus such as call connection notification sound, sound during a call, ringtone setting, vibration setting, etc.

1. Please go to the 'Call Settings' menu.
2. Within the 'Call Settings' menu, please find and select 'Phone Notifications and Ringtones'.
3. Here you can set up features related to 'Phone Notifications and Ringtones'. (Options include: 'Vibration When Receiving a Call', 'Vibration at End of Call', 'Call Connection Notification Sound', 'End of Call Notification Sound', 'Allow Alarm and Notification Sound During a Call', 'Ringtone', 'Phone Vibration', 'Sound When Dialing', 'Vibration When Dialing', etc.)

title: caller ID
description:
caller ID, On the Phone Call Screen, you can set the information of the caller display. 

1. Please enter the 'Call settings' menu in 'Phone' app through 'Settings' from Tap on more view option. 
2. Please find and select 'Caller information' in the 'Call settings' menu. 
3. You can set the 'Caller information' function here. 
('Profile picture size', 'Show contacts' phone numbers',Show extra details')

title: Call background
description:
Call background, You can set up a phone call wallpaper. 

1. Please enter the 'Call settings' menu in 'Phone' app through 'Settings' from Tap on more view option.
2. Please find and select 'Call background' in the 'Call settings' menu. 
3. You can set up the 'Call background' function here. 
(Add call background in gallery, add call background in AR Emoji, delete call background, set call background, etc.)

title: Call recording
description:
Call recording, You can set up settings related to busy recording. 

1. Please enter the 'Call settings' menu in 'Phone' app through 'Settings' from Tap on more view option.
2. Please find and select 'Record calls' in the 'Call settings' menu. 
3. You can set up the 'Record calls' function here. 
('Auto record calls', 'Show notification after recording', 'Recorded calls', 'Delete old recordings')

title: Reception blocking/release
description:
Reception blocking/release, You can manage your receiving block list when you receive a call.
1. Please go to the 'Call Settings' menu.
2. Find and select 'Block numbers' in the 'Call Settings' menu.
3. You can manage your 'Receiving Block' list here.

## Turning on Call Blocking for Numbers with Caller ID Restriction
1. Go to 'Call Settings' > Select 'Block numbers' > Turn on the setting for 'Block Calls from unknown numbers'. This will block calls from numbers with caller ID restriction.

## Turning off Call Blocking for Numbers with Caller ID Restriction
1. Go to 'Call Settings' > Select 'Block numbers' > Turn off the setting for 'Block Calls from unknown numbers'. This will allow calls from numbers with caller ID restriction.

## How to Add to the Receiving Block List
1. Go to 'Call Settings' > Select 'Block numbers' > Choose from ‘Recent Records’, ‘Messages’, or ‘Contacts’. This allows you to easily add numbers to your block list through call and message history, as well as contacts.

## Deleting from the Receiving Block List
1. Go to ‘Call Settings’ > Select ‘Block numbers’ > Use the '-' button next to each number to delete it from the list.
2. Go to ‘Call Settings’ > Select ‘Block numbers’ > Use More options feature, you can delete all numbers.

title: Real-time interpretation
description:
Real-time interpretation, Real-time interpretation is available during a call. 
1. Please enter the 'Call settings' menu. 
2. Please find and select 'Live translate' in the 'Call settings' menu. 
3. You can turn on and off the 'Live translate' function here. 

## Turn on Live translate
 1. Select 'Call settings'>'Live translate'>Use real-time interpretation during a call by turning on real-time interpretation. 

## Turn off real-time interpretation 
1. Select 'Call settings'>'Live translate'>Turn off real-time interpretation and do not use real-time interpretation during a call.

title: Text call setting
description:
Text call setting, You can use text calls during a call.
You can check menus such as language, voice, greeting, editing, and quick response phrase editing for text calls.

1. Enter the 'Call settings' menu.
2. Find and select 'Text call' option.
3. You can turn the 'Text call' feature on and off here.

## Turn on Text call:
'Call settings' > Select 'Text call' > Turn it on to use it during calls.

## Turn off Text call:
'Call settings' > Select 'Text call' > Turn it off to not use it during calls.

title: Press-speech
description: Press-speech, You can choose not to turn on the microphone automatically by 'press and speak'. 1. Run the interpretation and set 'Interpretation Settings'> 'Speak by Pressing'. 2. After I finish, I can turn on the microphone myself.

title: Voice style
description: Voice style, You can choose the voice of me and the other person that will be heard during interpretation. 1. Please execute the interpretation and select the 'Interpretation Settings' menu. 2. You can find the Voice Style menu here.

title: Interpretive language pack
description: Interpretive language pack, You can download the language pack of the language you want to translate. 1. Please execute the interpretation and select the 'Interpretation Settings' menu. 2. You can find the Interpretation Language Pack menu here.

title: Interpretation setting
description: Interpretation setting, You can use various settings of interpretation that translate conversations into text or voice in real time. 1. Please execute the interpretation and select the 'Interpretation Settings' menu. 2. Here, you can check various settings for interpretation.

title: Important Day Saved in Contacts
description:
Important Day Saved in Contacts, You can set the default notification time for important day schedules stored in your contacts.

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Default alert times'>'Contacts 'important dates' menu.

Select the option you want, you can set the notification time you want or no notification.

title: A full-day schedule
description:
A full-day schedule, When creating a schedule, you can set the default notification time for the schedule you specified as all day. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Default alert times'> 'All-day events' menu.

Select the option you want. You can set the notification time you want or no notification.

title: Schedule set to time
description:
Schedule set to time, When creating a schedule, you can set the default notification time for the schedule, including the time.
 
Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Default alert times'>Events' menu 

Set to time and select the options you want. You can set the notification time you want or if you don't want a notification.

title: Calendar setting
description:
Calendar setting, Go to the 'Calendar settings' screen. 

Check the 'Calendar settings' menu for styles and various add-ons.

title: Fixed time zone
description:
Fixed time zone, Displays the date and time of all my schedules based on the selected time zone. 

Turn on the 'Calendar settings'>'Lock time zone' menu. 

You can set the desired time zone and display all schedules based on this time zone.

title: Calendar color management
description:
Calendar color management, You can specify colors by calendar. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Manage calendars'>'My calendars' menu and select the calendar you want to change the color of.

You can change it to a color that can be supported for each calendar.

title: Basic notification time
description:
Basic notification time, You can set the notification time to be applied by default when creating a schedule. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Default alert time' menu.

Select the option you want you can set the default input notification time you want for each type in advance.

title: Constant color
description:
Constant color, You can set a certain color tone to display in the calendar view. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Change calendar style'>'Event color' menu and select the option you want. 

You can choose the color of your calendar step by step from very light to very dark.

title: Turn off notifications on all devices
description:
Turn off notifications on all devices, When you turn off a notification on one device, all notifications on other devices with this setting on are also turned off.

Turn on the 'Calendar settings'>'Dismiss alerts from all devices menu.
Global Settings>'Connected devices>'Continue apps on other devices menu is turned on, and if a notification for the same schedule occurs on a connected phone through this, the notification is turned off on other devices if the notification is turned off only on one device.

For those who use multiple devices at the same time, it is convenient to turn off the notification on one device with the same schedule notification.

title: Auxiliary calendar
description:
Auxiliary calendar, You can display secondary calendars such as lunar calendars. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Alternate calendar' menu. Select the options you want you can choose from a variety of lunar calendars and regional calendars. 

It can be useful when saving birthdays by the lunar calendar.

title: Delete time from title
description:
Delete time from title, When you enter a simple schedule, it automatically deletes the date and time in the schedule title and reminder title. 

Turn on the 'Calendar settings'>'Remove time from title' menu. 

When time information is recognized in the schedule title creation window and stored as a certain time, the recognized time information can be deleted from the title.

title: Show completed reminders
description:
Show completed reminders, You can also choose to display completed reminders on your calendar. 

Turn on the 'Calendar settings'>'Show completed reminders' menu. 

The completed reminder is also displayed on the calendar, so you can check the entire reminder.

title: Schedule title character size
description:
Schedule title character size, You can set the title letter size to display in the calendar. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'Change calendar style'>'Event title font size' menu . 

To select the options you want, you can set it step by step from small size to large size. So, choose your preferred size.

title: Notification system
description:
Notification system, You can select how to display when a schedule notification occurs. 

Select the 'Calendar Settings'>'Alert type' menu and 
Select the option you want you can choose the 'Light', 'Medium', and 'Strong' options.
 
If it's an important schedule, set it to 'strong'.

title: Weather information display
description:
Weather information display, Displays a week's weather information on your calendar. 

Turn on the 'Calendar Settings'>'Show weatherforecast' menu. 

You can display the weather in the calendar at the top of the area set in the weather widget.

title: Indicate how many times you own it.
description:
Indicate how many times you own it., You can display the number of weeks in the calendar view. 

Turn on the 'Calendar Settings'>'Show how many times you own' menu. 


You can check the calendar right away how many times this week is.

title: View schedule titles in two lines
description:
View schedule titles in two lines, In the calendar view, you can choose whether to display the schedule in two lines.
 
Turn on the 'Calendar settings'>'Change calendar style'>View Schedule Titles in 2 Lines menu. 
Depending on your preference, you can display a schedule title in your calendar in two or one line.

title: Hide rejected schedule
description:
Hide rejected schedule, In the Calendar view, choose to hide the declined schedule. 

'Calendar settings'>'Hide declined events' menu. 

You can turn on and off  'Hide declined events' in your calendar.

title: The first day of the week
description:
The first day of the week, You can set the start day of the week to display in the calendar view. 

Select the 'Calendar settings'>'First day of the Week' menu and select the options you want.

You can choose 'Saturday','Sunday','Monday',or 'Local default'.

title: Explain Palm Show in camera
description:
Explain Palm Show in camera, You can take a selfie or start recording a selfie video by showing your palm towards the camera.

The 'Palm Show' option is enabled by default. You can check it at the following path.
- Camera settings > Shooting method > Palm Show

title: Floating photographing button
description:
Floating photographing button, You can set the 'Shooting methods' in camera settings. 

'Camera settings'>'Shooting methods' >'Floating Shutter button'

Add a freely movable shooting button on the floating shooting screen, and press this button to take a picture.

title: Voice command
description:
Voice command, You can set the shooting method in camera settings. 

'Camera setting'>'Shooting methods'>'voice commands'

If you say "Smile", "Cheese", "Shoot", and "Capture", a picture is taken, and if you say "Record Video", a video is taken.

title: Press the volume button
description:
Press the volume button, You can set the shooting method in the camera settings. 

'Camera settings'>'Shooting methods'>'Press Volume buttons to'

If you press the Volume button, you can take a 'Take picture or record video' or 'Zoom in or out' or set it to 'Control sound volume'.

title: Scene optimizer
description:
Scene optimizer, The Scene Optimizer feature helps in automatically adjusting colors and contrast to make dark scenes brighter. Now you can have your food look more delicious, and landscapes more vivid.

Camera app > Settings > 'Intelligent optimization' > 'Scene optimizer'

title: Alignment
description:
Alignment, You can sort the display locations of watermarks. 

'Camera settings'>'Watermark'>'Alignment'

You can set Align Left Fit, Center Fit, Right Fit, Top, Bottom.

title: Font
description:
Font, You can set the font for the watermark. 

 'Camera settings'>'Watermark'>'Font'

 We provide three fonts:'Roboto','Samsung Sharp Sans' and 'Noto Serif'.

title: date
description:
date, You can set a date on the watermark. 

'Camera settings'>'Watermark'>'Date'

It can be change to different formats, example, “January 1, 2024” or “2024.05.31” .

title: Model name
description:
Model name, You can set the model name in the watermark.
 
'Camera settings'>'Watermark'>'Model name'

The model name you are using is automatically set, and if you want to modify it, you can enter up to 28 characters with the edit button.

title: Portrait mode lens
description:
Portrait mode lens, You can maintain portrait mode lenses in camera settings. 

In 'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'Portrait zoom' 

Portrait Mode does not change the rear camera lens to default, but keeps it as the last lens used.

title: Supersteady
description:
Supersteady, You can maintain a supersteady mode in camera settings, to avoid unsteady movement.

If Super Steady is turned on in 'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'Super steady'

Super Steady in Video Mode will be maintained even if the camera app is shut down and restarted.

title: Filter
description:
Filter, You can maintain a filter in camera settings. 

'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'Filters' 

Exit and restart the Filter Menu Camera app to maintain the filters used in each mode.

title: High resolution photograph
description:
High resolution photograph, You can maintain high-resolution photos in camera settings. 

'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'High picture resolutions' 

Shut down the high-resolution photo camera app and restart it to keep the resolution at 50MP.

title: Selfie angle of view
description:
Selfie angle of view, You can maintain a selfie angle of view in the camera settings. 

'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'Selfie angle'.

Maintain the previously used angle of view in the selfie angle of view front camera. When this feature is turned on, the angle of view is maintained even if the number of people taking selfies changes.

title: Camera mode
description:
Camera mode, In Camera Settings, you can select the settings you want to keep. 

'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep'>'Camera mode'
Shut down and restart the camera mode camera to maintain the mode you used at the end.
  
For example, if you have filmed a video before, run the camera app again and it will start in video mode.

title: Automatic correction of scan result
description:
Automatic correction of scan result, When scanning a document, this setting can  automatically detect and erase fingers or other objects that are also part of the document.

'Camera settings'>'Scan documents and text'>'Remove unwanted objects'

title: Auto scan
description:
Auto scan, Documents and text are automatically captured without pressing the photographing button. 

'Camera settings'>'Scan documents and text'>'Auto scan'

title: Pro mode photo format
description:
Pro mode photo format, Select the format in which you want to save photos taken in Pro Mode. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced picture options'>'Pro mode picture format'

title: High-efficiency photography
description:
High-efficiency photography, Saving photos taken in photo mode in high-efficiency image format (HEIF) saves storage space. For reference, HEIF format is not supported in some apps or websites.

'Camera settings'>'Advanced picture options'>'High efficiency pictures'

title: 360 Audio Recording
description:
360 Audio Recording, Bluetooth headphones that provide 360 audio recordings can capture realistic 3D sound. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'>'360 audio recording'

title: Mike Zoom
description:
Mike Zoom, When shooting in video mode, the microphone can be tuned to the camera zoom. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'>'Zoom-in mic'

title: HDR10+ Video
description:
HDR10+ Video, Optimize the color and contrast of videos taken with the rear camera in video or professional video mode. The video is saved in HEVC format. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'>'HDR10+ videos'

title: High bitrate video
description:
High bitrate video, This setting saves videos taken in video or professional video mode at a high bit rate. Videos with high bit rates have a larger capacity than regular videos. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'>'High bitrate videos'

title: H.264 (High Compatibility)
description:
H.264 (High Compatibility), High Compatibility Video Recording format

Camera app > Settings > 'Advanced video options' > 'H.264 (most compatible)'

title: HEVC (High Efficiency)
description:
HEVC (High Efficiency), We can save storage space by storing it with equal or better image quality than before. 
In addition, image quality may deteriorate somewhat depending on the image characteristics, but we still support the 'Prioritize space saving' mode for users who want to save more storage space.

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'>'HEVC (high efficiency)'

title: Camera information
description:
Camera information, You can check the software version and legal information of the camera app here:

'Camera settings'>'About Camera'

title: Setting initialization
description:
Setting initialization, In the Camera app, you can reset user-set shooting environments and options. 

'Camera settings'>'Reset settings'

title: Keep Settings
description:
Keep Settings, When you run the camera again, you can maintain previously used settings such as camera mode. 

'Camera settings'>'Settings to keep' 

 It provides options for 'Camera mode', 'Selfie angle', 'High picture resolutions', 'Filters', 'Super steady', 'Portrait zoom'.

title: Photographing method
description:
Photographing method, To select additional ways to take pictures and videos: 

'Camera settings'>'Shooting methods'.

It provides options for 'Pressing Volume buttons to', 'Voice commands', 'Floating Shutter button 'and 'Show palm'.

title: Position tag
description:
Position tag, If you add tags, you can find out where you took pictures or videos.

'Camera settings'>'Location tags'.

You can check the location in the details of the photo/video you took with the location tag.

title: A vertical/horizontal guide
description:
A vertical/horizontal guide, This feature can set the camera shot to display a gridline to help set the composition.

'Camera settings'>'Grid lines'.

title: Target tracking AF
description:
Target tracking AF, You can set the camera to automatically focus on the subject even if the subject moves or changes the shooting composition. 

'Camera settings'>'Tracking auto-focus'.

title: Advanced video option
description:
Advanced video option, Enable advanced options for video shooting. 

'Camera settings'>'Advanced video options'.

 It provides options for 'Video format' and 'Audio'.

title: Video stabilization
description:
Video stabilization, Run the hand tremor correction function to reduce or prevent the screen from shaking when shooting a video. 

'Camera settings'>'Video stabilization'.

title: Automatic FPS
description:
Automatic FPS, Optimize the frame speed where there is a lack of light, to set the video to shoot with brighter settings.

'Camera settings'>'Auto FPS'

title: Push up/down to switch cameras
description:
Push up/down to switch cameras, Slide the shot screen up or down to switch the camera screen. 

'Camera settings'>'Swipe up/down to switch cameras'.

title: Camera Settings - Advanced Photo Options
description:
Camera Settings - Advanced Photo Options, You can set how to save the photos you take.
You can select High Efficiency Photos and Options and RAW File Options from this menu.

## High Efficiency Photos
Saving photos taken in Photo Mode in High-Efficiency Image Format (HEIF) to save storage space.
Please not that HEIF format is not supported in some apps or websites.
- Camera Settings> Advanced Photo Options> High Efficiency Photos

## Pro Mode Photo Format
You can select a format to save photos taken in Pro Mode. (JPEG, RAW)
For RAW files, adjusted color tones are not applied.
- Camera Settings> Advanced Photo Options> Pro Mode Photo Format

title: Camera - Watermark
description:
Camera - Watermark, Set to display a watermark on photos.
You can display model name, date, and time information in the camera settings. It provides font and alignment options.

## How to set
- Run camera app> Settings> Watermark

title: Push the photographing button
description:
Push the photographing button, When you long press the "Shoot" button while it is pushed to the edge, you can select an action to execute.
Go to Camera Settings > Swipe Shutter button to
You can choose actions such as Burst Shot and Create GIF.

title: Intelligent optimization
description:
Intelligent optimization, Quality optimization options for intelligence options are available at maximum/medium/minimum. You can automatically adjust colors and apply optimized effects depending on the image quality option selection or subject and scene. 

'Camera' app>'Camera settings'>'Intelligent optimization'.

The optimal shooting option for each scene optimizes color and contrast so that dark scenes look brighter, food tastes better, and scenery looks more vivid.

title: Recommend the shooting composition.
description:
Recommend the shooting composition., The function of Shot Suggestions helps users conveniently take photos by providing guidance on the optimal shooting composition based on the recommended guide. When the best position is found, the 'best shot' location is displayed through a circle in the center of the camera app screen. To set it up, please follow the steps below:

Camera app > Settings > 'Shot suggestions'.

title: QR code scan
description:
QR code scan, Scan QR codes is available in the Camera app. 

1. Run the 'Camera' app.
2. Press the setting icon in the upper left corner to enter the 'Camera settings' menu.
3. Select 'Scan QR codes' option.

Scan QR codes recognition is only supported in rear photo mode. 
By running 'Scan QR codes' on the quick panel, QR code recognition is possible quickly through scan-only mode, and QR code in the captured image or screenshot is also possible. 
If there is no 'Scan QR code' icon, you can add it by pressing the + button on the quick panel.

title: Scan documents and text
description:
Scan documents and text, Scan documents and text' are available in the Camera app. 
Position the document or text you want to scan 'Camera Settings' >'Scan documents and text'.
Press the 'T button' in the preview and click the icon marked below the arrow in the document area on the screen where the text is extracted together to save the document image. 

If you do not like the specified document area on the screen where the text is extracted together, you can create a document image by manually specifying the document area by pressing the 'Scan' icon.

title: Camera Settings
description:
Camera Settings, I will guide you on how to set up your camera.

1. Go to Camera > Settings icon.

Here, you will find all the necessary settings items. For example, you can change the optimal shooting settings for each scene, the shutter button, etc.
After setting to the desired values, press the confirm button to save.

title: Samsung Stops Using Internet
description:
Samsung Stops Using Internet, It is a menu to delete all data on the Samsung Internet and withdraw the terms and conditions of use and personal information collection. If you execute this, the Internet will return to the same state as when you first used it. All settings and bookmarks, usage history, quick run items, etc., all items added/changed by the user are deleted and restored to their initial state.

##You can find it in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Discontinue use of Samsung Internet' menu.

title: Laboratory
description:
Laboratory, You can set up laboratory features related to fonts and dark themes. It has the ability to set whether to use fonts downloaded and applied from global settings on web pages, and includes the ability to determine whether to use dark themes on web pages that can support it.

##You can check in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Labs' menu.

title: Useful function
description:
Useful function, You can set up useful features related to videos and address bars. You can enter through Internet Settings -> Useful Features. It includes activating video assistance, allowing automatic playback, allowing background playback, using read mode, and using the ability to open apps through links, and can be activated/deactivated through switching it on/off.

##You can find it in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Useful features' menu.

title: Site and Download
description:
Site and Download, You can change the settings associated with the website and the settings required for downloading. It includes the ability to view or delete notifications from websites, view/delete data from each website, view/modify allowed/prohibited permissions for each site, and check before downloading.

##You can find it in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Sites and downloads' menu.

title: Internet usage history
description:
Internet usage history, Through the 'Internet Browsing History' menu, you can set options related to browsing history and website form inputs.

-Deleting browsing data: You can delete information used on the internet such as cookies and cache.
-Autofill forms: You can easily input previously saved information such as passwords, names, addresses, credit cards, etc.
-Secret mode settings: Provides settings for Private Mode which offers enhanced privacy protection.

Related settings can be found under 'Internet Menu' > 'Settings' > 'Personal browsing data'.

title: Status of personal information protection;
description:
Status of personal information protection;, In the 'Personal Information Protection Status', you can check features related to security and personal information protection. You can understand the status of personal information protection associated with browsing, such as tracker blocking information.

-Smart Tracking Prevention: It blocks websites from obtaining and using your internet usage history.
-Block backward redirections: It prevents you from being directed to advertisements or malicious sites that you have not visited when going back.
-Block pop-ups: It prevents separate pop-up pages from appearing. Some features may be blocked. Site-specific management is also possible.
-Block apps from opening internet: It prevents certain apps from launching Samsung Internet. You can prevent the internet from being launched by accidentally clicking on unwanted links.
-Warn about malicious sites: You will receive a warning from Samsung Internet before opening a suspicious website.

Related settings can be found in 'Internet Menu' > 'Settings' > 'Privacy dashboard'.

title: High contrast mode
description:
High contrast mode, This feature is for people who have difficulty distinguishing colors, and you can adjust the font color, background, and other components to have high contrast values so that you can see the letters well in the background. As a kind of accessibility feature, some components may be restarted.

##You can check in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Turn on/off 'High contrast mode' menu.

title: Internet Settings - How to view and scroll web pages
description:
Internet Settings - How to view and scroll web pages, In the 'Webpage View and Scrolling Method' menu, you can change the items to set the usage method suitable for each user when browsing webpages.

## How to set
1. Run the 'Internet' app.
2. Select the menu (☰) at the bottom right.
3. Select 'Settings'.
4. Find and select the 'Webpage View and Scrolling Method' menu.

## Submenu
- Show top button - Shows the button to move to the top of the web page when selected.
- Show bottom button - Shows the button to move to the bottom of the web page when selected.
- Scroll down to refresh web pages: When at the top of the web page, drag down to turn on/off the refresh function.
- Dark mode: Apart from the device settings, the Internet alone can turn on/off dark mode. The default setting is to follow the device's settings.
- Web page font size: You can determine the size of the text within a web page.
- Display as PC version: If you want to view the contents of the web page as desktop version or mobile version, you can change the settings and apply it.

title: Layout and Menu
description:
Layout and Menu, You can change the layout of your browser and set the menu location. You can change the location of the address bar or toolbar up or down, and you can change the bookmark bar and tab bar to be visible at all times. Depending on the frequency of use in the toolbar, you can move to a more comfortable location.

##You can find it in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Layout and menus'.

title: Address bar search
description:
Address bar search, You can set up the search engine that is set when you search through the address bar. You can choose between language-based and highly-enabled search engines, and you can also add other less-enabled search engines. If you select a search engine that you usually use, you can get the same results as you searched on the search engine page just by putting a search word in the address bar and running it.

##You can find it in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Address bar search'.

title: Homepage
description:
Homepage, You can set web links or content to be displayed on the homepage. You can open a new tab or select the page to go to when you select the homepage button, and you can also adjust various options on the 'Quick Launch' page, which is Samsung Internet's own content. (Frequently visited pages options, etc.)

##You can check in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Click 'Homepage' menu.

title: Internet Settings
description:
Internet Settings, You can set the functions and options supported by Samsung Internet. It contains many items that can provide high convenience in using the Internet, such as selecting a homepage or search engine, useful security functions, or adjusting the menu location. You can also find information about various Internet versions and experimental features.

##You can check in:
1. Run the 'Samsung Internet' app > Tap on the More view button in the bottom right corner.
2. Select the 'Settings' menu.

title: Use Bluetooth mic when available
description:
Use Bluetooth mic when available, When available, the Bluetooth microphone setting allows recording through the Bluetooth microphone.

##Try setting it up as follows:
1. Open the Voice Recorder app
2. Run the voice recording 'Settings'
3. Turn on 'Use Bluetooth mic when available'

title: Auto play next recording
description:
Auto play next recording, The 'Auto play next recording' is a feature that automatically plays the next recording file when the current one ends. Enabling this feature allows you to listen to the recordings sequentially without having to press the play button each time, making it convenient. 
For instance, if you need to listen to multiple recordings containing meeting or lecture content in a row, using this feature can save you time and make your work more efficient. 

##Steps:
1. Open the Voice Recorder App.
2. Tap on the menu option(≡) > Select the settings icon.
3. Turn the 'Auto play next recording' option On/Off.

This feature works best when the recording files are sorted in sequence, so it is advisable to check the order of the files in advance.

title: Block calls while recording
description:
Block calls while recording, By utilizing this feature, you can set it to block incoming calls while recording, ensuring that your concentration is not disturbed. This reduces the noise caused by calls during recording, allowing you to continue recording without missing any necessary content. 

##Steps:
1. Open the Voice Recorder App.
2. Tap on the menu option(≡) > Select the settings icon.
3. Turn On/Off the 'Block calls while recording' option.

This feature can be especially useful when recording important meetings or interviews. However, use caution in situations where you need to receive urgent calls.

title: Record in Stereo
description:
Record in Stereo, The stereo recording function uses the top and bottom microphones of your device to capture sound. By using this method, you can capture a broader range of ambient sounds even in normal mode. Therefore, this feature can be very useful in situations where sound quality is important, such as lectures, meetings, and interviews. 

##Steps:
1. Open the Voice Recorder App.
2. Tap on the menu option(≡) > Select the settings icon.
3. Select 'Record in stereo'.

It is important to properly adjust the microphone input level during recording, otherwise, the sound may be excessively amplified or noise may occur, so caution is required.

title: Voice Recording Quality
description:
Voice Recording Quality, Recording quality can be set to low, medium, or high depending on the user's preference. 

##Steps:
1. Open the Voice Recorder App.
2. Tap on the menu option(≡) > Select the settings icon.
3. Select 'Recording quality' section and select high/medium/low quality.

- Low: Useful for saving multiple files as it reduces file size. 
- Medium: Suitable for recording regular conversations or lectures. 
- High: Ideal for recording music or complex sounds, or capturing very fine details, although it results in larger file sizes. 
Therefore, choose the appropriate quality based on your situation and needs.

title: Voice Recording Mode
description:
Voice Recording Mode, This setting includes two main recording modes: 'Standard' mode and 'Interview' mode.  
Each mode can be appropriately selected and used depending on the situation.

##Steps:
1. Open the Voice Recorder App.
2. Tap on the menu option(≡) > Select the settings icon.
3. Enter the 'Recording mode' and select either 'Standard' or 'Interview'.

- 'Standard mode': suitable for recording general conversations or environments.
- 'Interview mode': primarily designed for recording interviews with one or two people, focusing on minimizing background noise and emphasizing the speaker's voice.

title: Text Conversion Assistant
description:
Text Conversion Assistant, The text conversion assistant can provide a function to convert voice recordings and call contents into text with enhanced intelligence features, summarize this text, or translate it into the language the user wants. This can be of great help in quickly grasping and understanding the recorded content in conferences, lectures, and other settings.

To check the text conversion assistant, follow these steps:

1. Open the voice recording app
2. Run the voice recording settings
3. Run the text conversion assistant

In the text conversion assistant, you can set the following:

1. Summarize the recorded content converted to text: On/Off
2. Automatically convert voice recordings to text: On/Off
3. Automatically detect the language for text conversion of voice recordings: On/Off
4. Download language packs for text conversion and translation

title: Voice recording setting
description:
Voice recording setting, A settings menu is provided where you can select and adjust functions that are commonly applied to voice recording apps. Through this, users can make detailed adjustments such as controlling the recording quality according to their needs. 

Additionally, once these settings are saved, they are consistently applied across all voice recording apps, greatly enhancing user convenience.

title: Trash can for contacts
description:
Trash can for contacts, Deleted contacts are kept for 30 days. You can restore deleted contacts within 30 days.

To check your contacts trash, follow these steps:

1. Open the Contacts app
2. Select ‘More’
3. Select ‘Trash’

1. Open the Phone app
2. Select the Contacts tab
3. Select ‘More’
4. Select ‘Trash’

This will allow you to check your contacts trash.

##Using the Contact Recycle Bin
Turn on the Contacts app > 'More' > 'Settings' > 'Trash' to use the contact trash can.

title: Contact Settings
description:
Contact Settings, Contacts settings are settings for the Contacts app.
You can set various options for the Contacts app or view app information through these settings.

To check your contact settings, follow the steps below:

1. Open Contacts App
2. Select the menu icon in the upper left corner
3. Select the 'Settings' icon

1. Open Phone App
2. Select the Contacts tab
3. Select 'More'
4. Select 'Contact Settings'

This allows you to check your contact settings.

title: vibration
description:
vibration, Vibration' is a function that vibrates your phone when the timer of the clock app ends and rings.

##If you want the timer to vibrate when it ends, set it as follows:
1. Run the 'Clock' app > Tap on the More view button in the upper right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. In the 'Timer' item, turn on 'Vibration'.

If you want to turn off the vibration when the timer rings, press 'Vibration' to turn it off.

title: Weather-mark
description:
Weather-mark, The 'Weather Display' is a feature of the "Clock" app that allows you to check not only the time information of the city added to "World Time", but also the weather conditions and temperature. If you want to know the weather conditions of the added city, please set it as follows:

1. Run the "Clock" app, press the more button in the upper right corner, and select 'Settings' menu.
2. In 'World Time', press 'Show weather' to turn on this option.

title: Turn off alarm sound when in silent or vibration mode
description:
Turn off alarm sound when in silent or vibration mode, Silence alarms when system sound is off' is a useful feature if you want to stop alarms or timers from not ringing in quiet places.
When 'Silence alarms when system sound is off' is enabled, alarms and timers will only vibrate without sound when the device is in silent or vibrate mode.
If 'Silence alarms when system sound is off' is disabled, alarms will ring according to the set sound and vibration, as usual.

##To use and change this feature, follow these steps:
1. Open the Clock app and tap the More button at the top right to select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Turn 'Silence alarms when system sound is off' on or off.

title: Clock setting
description:
Clock setting, Clock settings provide a variety of settings that are commonly applied to the 'Watch' app.
To use the clock setting, you can enter by running the clock app and pressing the More View button in the upper right corner to select the 'Settings' menu, and check and change various settings related to the 'Watch' app.

When the 'alarm' rings, you can set and change the 'alarm background' or set when to display the 'alarm pre-notification to ring soon'.
In addition, with the 'volume' function, you can choose whether to adjust the sound frequency of the alarm at once or individually.
You can choose whether to display the weather information of the city on 'World Time', and if you select 'Weather Display', you can change the temperature unit of the city to Celsius or Fahrenheit.
You can also change various information such as whether the timer provides 'sound' and 'vibration' and whether the 'mini timer is displayed'.
The clock setting also provides permissions and information used in the app.

title: Show me the key you pressed.
description:
Show me the key you pressed., You can select Touch Feedback to specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard. Select Show pressed key to display a small pop-up window corresponding to the pressed key separately. 

##Here's how you can specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard:

1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Touch feedback' > Character preview'.

title: vibration
description:
vibration, You can select Touch Feedback to specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard. You can select 'Vibration' to determine whether to vibrate in keyboard touch gesture. 

##Here's how you can specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard:

1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Touch feedback' > Enable 'Vibration'.

title: sound
description:
sound, You can select Touch Feedback to specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard. You can choose a sound to make a sound effect in the keyboard touch gesture. 

##Here's how you can specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Touch feedback' > Enable 'Sound'.

title: Leave Symbol Selection Window Open
description:
Leave Symbol Selection Window Open, You can specify whether to keep the pop-up that appears when you press and hold the key to the right of the Samsung keyboard space key by selecting Keep the symbol selection window open.

##Here's how you can enable Keep symbol panel open:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Enable 'Keep symbol panel open'.

title: Press and hold the space key
description: Press and hold the space key, You can specify the behavior of long-pressing space by selecting long-pressing space. ## If you select Disable, do not use the long press action. If you select ## Cursor move, you can move the cursor with a long press. If you select ## Voice input, you can use the voice input function by pressing long.

title: Backspace speed
description:
Backspace speed, You can select the backspace speed to adjust how fast the text is deleted when you press the backspace. 

##Here's how you can set Backspace speed:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Backspace speed'.

Here you can set the speed for deleting characters when you touch and hold the backspace key.

title: Keyboard long press response time
description:
Keyboard long press response time, Select the keyboard long press response time to specify the time that is classified as long press. 

##Here's how you can specify the time separated by long press:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Keyboard touch and hold delay'.

Here you can set the time that should be taken for a continuous touch to be recognized as a touch and hold on the keyboard.

title: Use gestures on keyboard screen
description:
Use gestures on keyboard screen, You can specify the gesture behavior of the Samsung keyboard to suit your convenience. 
 - If you select Disable, gesture behavior is not used. 
 - If you select Text input, you can put your finger on the keyboard and slide to enter letters. 
 - If you select Move Cursor, you can move the cursor by placing your finger on the keyboard and moving it up, down, left and right. 

##Here's how you can set Keyboard swipe controls:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Keyboard swipe controls'.

Here you can choose between Swipe to type, Cursor control and No swipe gestures.

title: App management
description:
App management, Samsung Keyboard has a feature that recommends stickers suitable for the input sentence, and you can specify the programs where this feature works. 

1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the gear icon from the toolbar.
2. Select 'Suggest stickers while typing' > Select 'Manage apps'.

title: Basic installed stickers and downloaded stickers
description:
Basic installed stickers and downloaded stickers, The Samsung keyboard has a function that recommends stickers that match the input sentence, and you can specify whether or not to recommend sticker content types. 

##Here's how you can enable Recommend sticker suitable for input phrase:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Suggest stickers while typing' > Enable 'Preloaded and downloaded stickers'

title: Hide Unpleasant Words
description:
Hide Unpleasant Words, If you choose to hide offensive words, some unpleasant words will be recognized as * asterisks when using the voice input function. To do that, follow the steps below:

Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the gear icon in the toolbar > 'Voice input' > 'Hide offensive words'
You can turn the feature on or off by pressing the switch.

title: Offline language pack installation
description:
Offline language pack installation, If you select to Install an offline language pack, you can pre-download the language you want to use for voice input even when you are offline. 

##Here's how you can Install offline language pack:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Voice input' > Select 'Install offline language pack'.

title: Changing Input Language Sequence
description:
Changing Input Language Sequence, This is a way to determine the order in which you change and use multiple Samsung keyboard languages. 

##Here's how you can enable multiple Samsung keyboard languages:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Languages and types' menu > Tap on More icon > Select 'Reorder'.

Here you can choose the order in which you wish to use multiple languages. When you push/swipe the left and right sides of the space bar or press the language button, the language changes in the order above.

title: Language change method
description: Language change method, You can choose how to change the language to change multiple language keyboards. ## There is a way to change the input language by pressing the language button. There is a way to change the input language by pushing the ## space bar from side to side. ## There is a way to use both language button and space bar push.

title: Input language management
description:
Input language management, Here is how to add the Samsung keyboard input language. 

##Here's how you can set Samsung Keyboard Input Language:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon on toolbar > Select 'Languages and types' > Select 'Manage input languages'. 

You can add or remove keyboard input language here. Up to four input languages can be selected.

title: Recognition time
description:
Recognition time, This is a way to adjust the handwriting recognition time of Samsung keyboard. 

##Here's how you can adjust the handwriting recognition time :
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Handwriting' > Select 'Recognition time' 

Here you can reduce or increase handwriting recognition time. You can only set it when a language that supports handwriting is selected.

title: Recommended word type
description:
Recommended word type, If you select the recommended word type, you can specify whether to enter the handwriting recognition character as it is or change it with the expected recommended word.

##Here's how you can select the recommended word type:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Handwriting'  > Select 'Candidate type'.

title: Pen recognition
description:
Pen recognition, If you select Pen Recognition, you can automatically turn on or off the function of the Samsung keyboard by handwriting input when you pull out the pen. 

##Here's how you can enable Pen recognition:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Handwriting' > Enable 'Pen detection'.

title: Delete cache
description:
Delete cache, This is the way to clean up the Samsung keyboard storage space. 

##Here's how you can clean up Keyboard Storage space:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the 'Settings' icon on the toolbar > Select 'Reset to default settings' > Select 'Clear cache'. 

This will clean up cache memory to reduce the storage space occupied by the Samsung Keyboard app.

title: Delete personal touch input data
description:
Delete personal touch input data, This is the way to initialize custom typing in hand. 

##Here's how you can remove personalized touch recognition data:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the 'Settings' icon on the toolbar > Select 'Reset to default settings' here > Click on 'Erase personalized touch recognition data' item.  

If you delete the frequently touched coordinate information here, you will return to your initial state and start custom typing on your hand again. Delete only touch coordinate information and keep frequently used words.

title: Delete personal input data
description:
Delete personal input data, This is the way to delete all the frequently used words. 

##Here's how you can delete all the frequently used words:
1. Go to 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the 'Settings' icon on the toolbar > Select 'Reset to default settings' menu here > Select 'Erase personalized predictions'.

You can delete the entire list of frequently used words here. If you want to delete only one word, you can delete it by long pressing the word in the word recommendation window.

title: Translation language pack
description:
Translation language pack, This is the way to download the language pack you need to use for the keyboard translation function on-device.

##Here's how you can download Language pack for Keyboard Translation:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Translation' > Select 'Language packs for translation'.

Here you can select and download the language pack you need to use for on-device method. You can also update the language packs you have already received in this item to a new version.

title: Google
description:
Google, This is one way to connect the keyboard translation function to Google translation. 

##Here's how you can enable Google Keyboard translation:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Translation' > Select 'Google' item here.

You can choose to run keyboard translation on Google server here. Network connection is required during operation.

title: Samsung
description:
Samsung, This is how you use keyboard translation function in Samsung on-device method.

##Here's how you can enable Samsung Keyboard translation:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Translation' > Select 'Samsung' Item. 

You can choose to run keyboard translation on-device here. It is on-device and can be used offline without the need for a network connection.

title: Auxiliary character
description:
Auxiliary character, You can select an auxiliary character item to turn on or off the auxiliary character display. It is a way to display symbolic aids on each keyboard. 

##Here's how you can set Secondary character:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon on toolbar > Select 'Layout' option > Enable 'Alternative characters' item. 

You can turn the secondary character display on or off here. Press and hold the key to enter a secondary character. This does not apply to keyboards that cannot display auxiliary characters separately.

title: Numeric key
description:
Numeric key, You can select a numeric key item to turn the display of separate numeric key on or off. It's a method of displaying a separate numeric key at the top of the keyboard. 

##Here's how you can display a separate numeric key at the top of the keyboard
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Layout' option > Select 'Number keys' item. 

Here, you can select a numeric key item to turn on or off a separate numeric key display. This does not apply to keyboards where numeric keys cannot be displayed separately.

title: Key and Special Character Layout
description:
Key and Special Character Layout, Selecting a key and special character layout allows you to change the special character array to an old version array, in addition to the default keyboard array. 

##Here's how you can set key and special character layout. 
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > 'Layout' > Enable 'Alternative characters'

title: Multilingual text recommendation
description:
Multilingual text recommendation, Recommendations in all supported input languages. It is a way to get recommendations by mixing words from various languages.

##Here's how to enable Multilanguage text prediction:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select Settings icon from toolbar > Select 'More typing options' > You can enable 'Multilanguage text prediction'. 

Words from all keyboard input languages can be recommended here. If this setting is turned off, word recommendations are made only for the language / keyboard you use.

title: Double-click the space key to enter a period.
description:
Double-click the space key to enter a period., If you select Enter Period by pressing the Space key twice quickly, the period is entered instead. 

##Here's how to enter period by double tapping space bar:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Open 'More typing options' > Enable 'Double tap space bar to add period'.

title: Automatic spacing
description:
Automatic spacing, When you select Automatic Spacing, it automatically puts spaces after words. It is a way to automatically enter space characters when words are entered.

##Here's how you can set Automatic spacing:
1. Open 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select Settings icon from toolbar > Select 'More typing options' > Select 'Auto spacing' here.

Selecting auto spacing by language will automatically add spaces after words. Languages that do not originally have spacing are displayed as unsupported languages and this feature cannot be used.

title: Automatic capitalization switching
description:
Automatic capitalization switching, When you select automatic capital transition, it automatically capitalizes the first letter of a sentence. 

##Here's how to automatically capitalize a sentence entry:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'More typing options' > You can enable 'Auto capitalize'.

Here, you can automatically capitalize the first letter of a sentence. But even if you turn on this setting, it may not work if it is blocked by the app.

title: Conversational translation
description:
Conversational translation, You can turn on or off the conversation translation which is the artificial intelligence feature of the Samsung keyboard. 
 -You can select the language to display the original text and translation together or only the translation. 
- Select App Management to specify the app for which conversation translation will work. 
- You can select a language pack for translation and download the language you want to use for translation in advance. 

##Here's how you can set conversational translation:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > 'Chat assist' > 'Chat translation'.

title: Handwriting toolbar display
description:
Handwriting toolbar display, You can specify whether to display the toolbar when using the pen to write directly on the screen without displaying the Samsung keyboard.
##Here's how you can set it in handwriting toolbar display:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' -> Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Enter into 'S Pen to text' > Enable 'Show writing toolbar'.

title: Setting initialization
description:
Setting initialization, You can return the Samsung keyboard to the state you used for the first time. 
-When you select Initialize Keyboard Settings, all Samsung keyboard settings items will return to their original purchase status. 
-If you select Delete Personal Input Data, only frequently used word lists are deleted. 
-If you select Delete Personal Touch Input Data, it will delete frequently touched coordinate information. 

##Here's how you can Reset keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Here you can find 'Reset to default settings'.

title: Select third-party content to use
description:
Select third-party content to use, Samsung Keyboard also provides content from partner companies, and each partner company can specify whether or not to provide it.

##Here are the steps to select third-party content to use:
1. Open 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Here you can find 'Select third-party content to use'.

title: Save screenshots to clipboard
description:
Save screenshots to clipboard, You can automatically save screenshots to the clipboard by turning on the screenshot save option on clipboard. 

##Here's how to turn on screenshot save option on clipboard:
1. Open 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon on toolbar > Enable 'Save screenshots to clipboard'.

title: Enter text with S Pen
description:
Enter text with S Pen, You can turn on or off the ability to write directly on the screen without displaying the Samsung keyboard with a pen. 

##Here's how to write directly on the screen without displaying the Samsung keyboard with a pen:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select the Settings icon on the toolbar > Enable 'S Pen to text'.

title: Translation
description:
Translation, You can choose how the Translation function of the Samsung Keyboard works. You can select Samsung and use the pre-downloaded language pack to translate offline and Google to do the translation online.

##Here's how you can enable the translation function:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Translation' here.

title: Handwriting
description:
Handwriting, You can set the way the Handwriting input function of the Samsung Keyboard works.
 -If you select Pen Recognition, you can automatically turn on or off the function of the Samsung Keyboard by handwriting input when you pull out the pen.
