- If you select the recommended word type, you can specify whether to enter the handwriting recognition character as it is or replace it with the recommended word. 
- You can adjust the handwriting recognition time by selecting the recognition time. 

##Here's how you can set Handwriting:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Handwriting' here.

title: Gestures and Feedback
description:
Gestures and Feedback, This is a setting item that can specify the gesture behavior and feedback type of the Samsung Keyboard.  
 -On the keyboard screen, you can select 'Use gestures' to specify the gesture to use.
  -You can select the keyboard long press response time to specify the time separated by long press. 
 -You can select the backspace speed to adjust how fast the text is deleted when you press the backspace. 
 -You can specify the action of long-pressing space by selecting long-pressing space . 
-You can select Touch Feedback to specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when pressing the keyboard. 
 -You can turn on or off the ability to read keyboard letters aloud by selecting Keyboard Input Reading. 
-You can select Leave the symbol selection window open to specify whether to continue the pop-up that occurs when you press and hold the key to the right of the Samsung Keyboard Space key. 
 
##Here's how you can access Gestures and Feedback:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select Settings icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback'.

title: Symbol direct setting
description:
Symbol direct setting, If you press and hold the key on the right side of the Samsung Keyboard Space key, you will see a pop-up that allows you to select various symbols, and you can specify the contents of this pop-up.

1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Set 'Custom symbols'

title: Layout
description:
Layout, You can adjust the details of the Samsung Keyboard arrangement.  If you select the Key and special character layout, in addition to the default keyboard arrangement you can change the special character arrangement to the old version of arrangement. 
 -You can select the numeric key item to turn the display of separate numeric keys on/off. 
 -You can turn on or off the secondary character display by selecting the secondary character item. 
 -You may or may not display keys on the left and right sides of the space by adjusting normal items. 
 -You can adjust the keyboard layout when you enter an email address by adjusting the address input field. 
 -You can adjust the keyboard arrangement as you enter the web address by adjusting the web address input item.
 
##Here's how you can set the layout of the keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > You can find 'Layout' menu here.

title: Size and transparency
description:
Size and transparency, You can resize or reposition your Samsung Keyboard. For floating keyboards, you can also adjust transparency. 

##Here's how you can resize or reposition your Samsung Keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Here select 'Size and transparency'.

title: Theme
description:
Theme, You can choose one of the four basic themes of Samsung Keyboard. This is how to specify the theme of Samsung Keyboard. 

##Here's how you can set theme of Samsung Keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Theme' > Select one of the four basic themes 

Here you can choose the basic theme for Samsung Keyboard. You can specify while checking examples that reflect the theme.

title: Other Input Options
description:
Other Input Options, In the "Other input options" section, you can configure the following items for the Samsung keyboard.
## If you select "Auto capitalization," the first letter of a sentence will automatically be capitalized.
## If you select "Auto spacing," a space character will automatically be added after a word.
## If you select "Double-tap space to insert period," a period will be entered when the space key is quickly pressed twice.
## If you select "Multilingual text suggestions," word suggestions will include words from multiple languages.

Run Samsung keyboard > Select the gear icon in the toolbar > "Other input options"

title: Phrase modification proposal
description:
Phrase modification proposal, You can turn on or off the Phrase modification proposal on the Samsung Keyboard. It is a function that underlines and displays typos or grammar errors when they are found. You can enable or disable it. 

##Here's how you can get phrase correction:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select Settings icon from toolbar > Select 'Suggest text corrections' here.

title: Recommend stickers suitable for input phrases
description:
Recommend stickers suitable for input phrases, The Samsung Keyboard has a function to recommend stickers that match the input sentence, which can be turned on or off. 

##Here's how you can get sticker recommendation while typing:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Tap on 'Suggest stickers while typing' > Select 'Sticker suggestion method' > Select 'Show in predictive text area'.

title: Emoji recommendation
description:
Emoji recommendation, The Samsung Keyboard has a function to recommend emoji's that match input sentences, which can be turned on or off. 

##Here's how you can get recommended emoji's: 
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > 'Select Settings' icon from toolbar > Enable 'Emoji recommendation' option here.

title: Phrase recommendation
description:
Phrase recommendation, You can turn on or off the Phrase recommendation action on the Samsung Keyboard. Recommendation of phrases is the action of recommending words at the top of the keyboard while typing. 

##Here's how you can turn on/off Phrase recommendation:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings icon from toolbar > Here you can enable/disable 'Phrase recommendation'.

title: Writing Assistant
description:
Writing Assistant, The writing assist feature helps improve text by suggesting alternative sentences or phrases, and correcting grammar and spelling errors.

It can also summarize long pieces of text and organize them in a easy-to-read format using headings, bullet points, or tables.

Additionally, it can translate conversations in messaging apps or suggest responses to text messages.

To use the writing assist feature, long press on the text and select the Galaxy AI icon from the popup menu.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Galaxy AI' menu.
3. You can find the 'Writing Assist' menu here.

title: Samsung voice input
description:
Samsung voice input, You can set the Samsung Voice Input to operate when you press the voice input icon. 
Here is how to specify the type of voice input. 

1. Launch Samsung Keyboard > Select the gear icon from the toolbar.
2. Select 'Voice input' > Select 'Samsung voice Input'.

By selecting Samsung Voice Input, you can use voice input while typing without switching input methods.

title: Enter Google voice
description:
Enter Google voice, If you select Google Voice Typing, Google voice input will work when you press the voice input icon. 

##Here's how you can enable Google voice input:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Open 'Voice input' menu > Select 'Google Voice Typing' here.

The Google voice input device works when you press the voice input icon here.

title: Sticker recommendation method
description:
Sticker recommendation method, The Samsung Keyboard has a function to recommend stickers that match the input sentence and determines where to place them. 
 -If you opt to have it displayed in the phrase recommendation area, the recommended sticker is displayed side by side with the word recommendation.
 -If you select to have it displayed on the keyboard, it will be shown on a separate area at the top of the keyboard.

##To get sticker recommendation on the Samsung Keyboard follow:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > You'll find 'Suggest stickers while typing' here, enable it.

title: Initialize keyboard settings
description:
Initialize keyboard settings, When you select initialize the settings of the Samsung Keyboard, all the keyboard setting items return to their original status. 

##Here's how you can initialize keyboard settings:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Reset to default settings' > Click on 'Reset keyboard settings'.

title: Font size
description:
Font size, You can adjust the display size of the letters on the Samsung Keyboard. This is how to resize the keyboard letters on the Samsung keyboard. 

##You can change size of keyboard display letters here:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon on the toolbar > Select 'Font size' item where you can adjust the font size.

title: Keyboard toolbar
description:
Keyboard toolbar, If you activate 'Keyboard Toolbar', a toolbar will appear on the top row of the keyboard.
The keyboard toolbar displays a set of icons at the top of the keyboard so that you can use various functions such as emojis, keyboard settings, and translation.

Here's how to enable 'Keyboard Toolbar':

1. Run the ‘Settings’ app.
2. Select the ‘General’ > ‘Samsung Keyboard Settings’ menu.
3. Activate the ‘Keyboard Toolbar’ menu here.

title: Phrase replacement
description:
Phrase replacement, You can turn on or off the phrase replacement action on the Samsung Keyboard. Phrase replacement is a function that automatically corrects typos while you typing. You can turn the phrase replacement on or off by language. 

##Steps to access phrase replacement action on Samsung keyboard:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > 'Auto replace'.

title: Language and Keyboard Format
description:
Language and Keyboard Format, You can add the language to the Samsung Keyboard or change the keyboard. You can change the type of keyboard in that language by selecting the desired language. For example, Korean -> Cheonjiin

You can add or remove a language by selecting Input Language Management. Also, you can choose how to display the symbol input keyboard by selecting numbers and symbols. 

##To change language: 
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Click on 'Languages and types'.

title: Mode
description:
Mode, You can choose the keyboard layout mode for the Samsung Keyboard.

1. Launch Samsung Keyboard > Select the gear icon from the toolbar.
2. Select 'Mode'.

## The 'Standard keyboard':
It is the standard mode typically used.

## The 'One-handed keyboard':
It shifts the layout to one side, making it easier to type with one hand.

## The 'Floating keyboard':
It is a small keyboard that can be placed anywhere on the screen, allowing more comfortable typing while playing games and other activities.

## The 'Split keyboard':
It divides the layout to the left and right sides, enabling more comfortable typing with both hands on larger screens.

title: Samsung Keyboard Information
description:
Samsung Keyboard Information, You can check the information regarding the version of your of Samsung Keyboard. You can check information such as application installation, intellectual property and open source license details of the Samsung Keyboard. 

##Follow the steps to view the Samsung Keyboard information: 
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select Settings icon from toolbar > Select 'About Samsung Keyboard' menu.

title: Inquire
description:
Inquire, If you have any questions while using Bixby, you can select 'Contact us' to leave a question on Samsung Members.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Contact us'.

title: Bixby app information
description:
Bixby app information, You can check Bixby's version, terms of use, and open source information here:

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. In the menu, find and select 'Advanced features'.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'About Bixby'.

title: Withdrawal from Bixby
description:
Withdrawal from Bixby, You can request to unsubscribe from Bixby. When you do that, all collected personal data will be deleted and cannot be restored thereafter.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Leave Bixby'.

title: Personal information setting
description:
Personal information setting, You can manage and set permissions for accessing personal information necessary for Bixby to provide localized information or convenient features.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. In the menu, find and select 'Advanced features'.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Within 'Bixby', select 'Privacy settings'.

title: Device disconnection
description:
Device disconnection, This setting can disable Bixby on your device. Once disabled, the device will be removed from your account, and you will need to log in again to use Bixby.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. In the menu, find and select 'Advanced features'.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Unlink device'.

title: Notification
description:
Notification, You can manage notifications provided by Bixby, such as parking location alerts. You can set them to sound, vibrate, or silent, and change the notification method.
1. Go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Useful Features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby' within 'Useful Features.'
4. Select 'Notifications' within 'Bixby.'

title: Use in locked state
description:
Use in locked state, You can set Bixby to perform functions such as sending messages, making calls, and checking the weather even when the device is locked.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Look for 'Use while locked'.

title: Data processing on the device
description: Data processing on the device, Download the package to execute key commands offline, such as setting timers, capturing screens, and turning on flashlights. 1. Please enter the 'Settings' menu on your phone. 2. Please find and select 'Advanced features' in the 'Settings' menu. 3. Please select 'Bixby' within 'Advanced features'. 4. Please select 'Offline processing' within 'Bixby'.

title: Uncalling
description:
Uncalling, You can give commands directly when the phone, alarm, or timer goes off without voice activation. Please note, Bixby does not work when a Bluetooth device is connected.

1. Please enter the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Talk to Bixby without without wake-up'.

title: Sound feedback
description:
Sound feedback, You can set whether to be notified by sound when Bixby starts or stops listening.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Sound feedback'.

title: Voice Registration
description:
Voice Registration, The voice registration feature is used to recognize the user's voice to talk to Bixby. After registering your voice, you can set the wake word to use when calling Bixby.

1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' within the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. Select 'Voice registration'.

##Calling During Media Playback
You can call Bixby even while playing videos or audio.

##Improving Voice Recognition Accuracy
The more you record your voice, the better Bixby can recognize it. Re-record your voice in places where you frequently use Bixby.
'Settings' > 'Advanced features' > 'Bixby' > 'Voice registration' > 'Improve voice recognition accuracy'.

title: Language and speech style
description:
Language and speech style, You can speak to Bixby in various languages and use more voice styles. You can check out the different voice styles supported for each language and choose the one you like.

1. Go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.
4. In 'Bixby', select 'Language and voice style'.

title: Bixby Settings
description:
Bixby Settings, Bixby helps you easily use a variety of features and services on your Galaxy through voice commands. You can call Bixby by saying 'Hi Bixby' or by pressing and holding the side button on your Galaxy. Once Bixby starts listening, you can give your desired commands. For example, you can say 'Tell me today's weather' or 'Set an alarm for 7 AM tomorrow'. Bixby understands your requests and performs the appropriate actions accordingly.

##Bixby Setup
1. Please go to the 'Settings' app.
2. Find and select 'Advanced features' in the menu.
3. Select 'Bixby'.

title: About Bixby Vision
description:
About Bixby Vision, In the Bixby Vision app, you can find link icons that allow you to search for the version name of the Bixby Vision app, the version name of the BV Framework, service announcements, open source, and system information of the app.

The version information includes the version name of the Bixby Vision app itself and the version name of the BV Framework.
In addition, there are announcements regarding important notices or changes to be aware of when using the service, so it is good to refer to them.
Lastly, we provide an icon that allows you to check the system information of the Bixby Vision app, for those who want more detailed information.

'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision' >  'About Bixby Vision'.

title: Partner Privacy Policy for Bixby Vision
description:
Partner Privacy Policy for Bixby Vision, By using the Bixby Vision app, you can check detailed information about the partner's privacy policy.
The partner's privacy policy explains how the partners associated with the Bixby Vision app collect and use users' personal information.
Through this, users can understand how their personal information is managed and make decisions accordingly.

Therefore, it is important to thoroughly check the partner's privacy policies before using the Bixby Vision app.

'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision' >  'Partner privacy policies'.

title: Add entry path
description:
Add entry path, The explanation of the capture button and auto-recognition button functions in Bixby Vision is as follows.

This content describes the behavior of the capture button settings in the settings menu of the Bixby Vision app. 
By default, the auto-recognition function is turned off, which means that when the app is launched, the screen is automatically captured after a certain period, and object recognition proceeds. 
On the other hand, when the capture button is turned on, object recognition starts only when the user manually presses the capture button on the screen. 
These settings can be changed according to the user's convenience.

Settings > Applications > Samsung App Settings > Show Capture Button

title: Wine
description:
Wine, The Wine search function identifies the wine included in the image displayed on the screen.
This function works using the Vivino search engine, finding and providing information about the wine in the image the user is viewing.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Wine'.

Through this, users can easily find out what the wine in the image is and what characteristics it has.
Additionally, the user can directly set whether to use this function, so it can be turned on and off as needed.

title: Bixby Vision Settings - Add Bing Search
description:
Bixby Vision Settings - Add Bing Search, The MS Bing search is a function that finds information related to the images displayed on the screen.
With this feature, similar images can be found through the MS Bing search engine.
It also shows various search results such as Wiki pages and similar videos, making it easier and faster for users to get the information they want.
In addition, users can set whether to use this function, so they can turn it on and off as needed.

## How to set
- Run Bixby Vision> Enter 'Settings' by clicking the menu in the upper right corner> Select 'Search' and activate> 'Add Bing Search'

title: Bixby Vision's image search
description:
Bixby Vision's image search, Bixby Vision's image search feature allows you to find similar images in Pinterest based on images on the camera or photos on the device. This allows you to find more interesting images, or get new ideas and necessary information.

# How to use
1. Launch 'Bixby Vision' app
2. Select the 'Search' menu at the bottom
3. Image search is conducted based on objects that the camera illuminates.
4. If you want to find a picture that has already been saved, select the gallery icon.

# Setting method
You can turn this feature on or off as needed.

1. Run 'Settings' app
2. Choose 'Application'
3. Select 'Samsung App Settings'
4. Bixby Vision Enters
5. Set 'Search' option

title: Text
description:
Text, The text extraction feature recognizes characters in images displayed on the screen and converts them into text.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Text'.

By using this feature, you can easily copy or translate text within images.

title: Translation
description:
Translation, The real-time translation feature analyzes the text in the image displayed on the screen and translates it into the desired language. If you use this feature, it translates the source language of the image into the destination language specified by the user and displays it on the screen. 

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Translate'.

Users can set whether to use this feature, so it can be freely utilized as needed.
This allows users to instantly see the translated content in the language they want.

title: Character read setting
description: Character read setting, This feature specifies the set value of TTS (or Text to speech). (Set “Samsung TTS, Google TTS, Speech rate, Pitch” in the Samsung Settings menu.) You can choose whether to use Samsung TTS or Google TTS. TTS settings help users receive voice guidance in their preferred way. You can choose between Samsung TTS and Google TTS, and you can also adjust the speed and height of voice guidance by adjusting the Speech rate and Pitch. These settings can be changed in the Samsung Settings menu. Thus, the user can specify the setting value of the TTS for their own convenience.

title: Voice Feedback for Accessibility Modes
description:
Voice Feedback for Accessibility Modes, This feature either reads out or does not read out the results of accessibility modes via voice. (By default, it reads out via voice).
If this description is enabled, it will vocally read out the analyzed content of accessibility modes.

The voice guidance feature for the results of accessibility modes provides convenience to users.
This feature is enabled by default, so it vocally guides the images analyzed by accessibility modes.
If this feature is inconvenient, users can manually disable it.
If disabled, the results of accessibility modes will no longer be vocally guided.

'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision' > 'Accessibility modes' > 'Voice feedback'

title: Color recognition
description:
Color recognition, There is a function that analyzes and reads the colors of the area shown by the Bixby Vision camera.
This function analyzes the color values of the image on the screen and determines what color it is.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Accessibility modes' > 'Color detector'.

Here, users can directly set whether to use this function, it can be turned on and off as needed.
Through this, users can accurately know the color information of the area shown by the Bixby Vision camera.

title: Letter-reading
description:
Letter-reading, There is a feature that reads out what the text shown by Bixby Vision's camera is.
This feature recognizes the text within the image captured by Bixby Vision's camera and converts it into speech to read it out.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Accessibility modes' > 'Text reader'.

By utilizing this feature, even users with visual impairments can easily obtain text information.

title: Object recognizer
description:
Object recognizer, There is a feature that determines what objects are seen through the Bixby Vision camera.
This feature is used to recognize and classify objects and subjects within images captured by the Bixby Vision camera.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Accessibility modes' > 'Object identifier'.

Through this, users can obtain accurate information about the subjects shown by the Bixby Vision camera.
Moreover, the use of this feature can be set by the user, allowing it to be turned on or off as needed.

title: Scene-commentary
description:
Scene-commentary, This feature analyzes and describes the content of the image displayed on the screen, allowing the user to understand the content of the image more clearly.

##Steps:
1. Run 'Settings' > Select 'Apps'.
2. Select 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.
3. Select 'Accessibility modes' > 'Scene describer'.

In other words, by setting whether to use the feature that describes the scene of the image displayed on the screen, you can more easily grasp the content of the image.

title: Bixby Vision Settings
description:
Bixby Vision Settings, Navigate to the settings screen provided by BixbyVision. 
Go to the settings screen of the BixbyVision app to show the settings menu of the BixbyVision app. 
 
Do you want to know what Bixby Vision does? 
Launch the BixbyVision app. 
Then click the settings icon at the top right corner of the screen to go to the 'Settings' screen of BixbyVision. 
When you access the settings screen, you will see various settings menus of the BixbyVision app. 
This way, you can check and adjust various settings provided by the BixbyVision app. 
 
'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Samsung app settings' > 'Bixby Vision'.

title: Playback speed
description:
Playback speed, You can display and adjust the playback speed on the Samsung video player.

The playback speed is displayed as an icon on the playback screen. 
You can change the playback speed by touching the icon and selecting the desired speed within the range of 0.25 to 2.0.

title: Background playback
description:
Background playback, You can play videos in the background.  To enable this setting, follow the steps below:
 
Go to the Video Player app > 'More' > 'Settings' > Enable the 'Background play' option. 
While playing, press the 'Recent apps' button or the 'Power' button to play only the audio in the background.

title: Automatic video repetition
description:
Automatic video repetition, There will be times when the video playback is complete. In those cases, it can automatically start again from the beginning. To enable this setting:

Open the Video Player app > 'More' > 'Settings' > Activate the 'Auto repeat videos' option.

However, the 'Video Auto Repeat' option cannot be used together with the 'Auto play next video' option.

title: Automatically play the next video
description:
Automatically play the next video, When a video finishes playing, the next video can automatically start playing without you having to press play.
If there is no next video, the video player will close. To enable this setting, please follow the steps below:

Video Player app > 'More' > 'Settings' > Enable 'Auto play next video' option.

However, please note that it cannot be used together with the 'Auto repeat videos' option.

title: Video player setting
description:
Video player setting, After launching the video player from Gallery or My Files, access it through 'More options' > Settings.
In Gallery, you can run the video player by selecting 'More' > 'Open in Video player'.

title: Allow Opening Links
description:
Allow Opening Links, You can turn on/off the permission to open all links shared in the chat room. If you turn on this setting, you will be directed to the link immediately without any additional prompt.

##How to Allow Opening Links
Message App > More > Settings > Additional Settings > Allow Opening Links

title: Voice Message to Text Conversion
description:
Voice Message to Text Conversion, This feature allows you to convert voice messages received into text, with an option to turn it on or off. 
*Please note that this function may not be supported on some devices, and there can be some errors in the text converted from voice.

##How to Convert Voice Messages into Text
Go to Message App > More > Settings > Additional Settings > Turn on Display Voice Messages as Text.

title: Quick response
description:
Quick response, You can display quick response phrases above the text input box on the conversation screen. It is possible to add, reorder, and delete quick responses.

## Setting up quick responses
Messages app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Quick responses

title: Delete old messages
description:
Delete old messages, When your inbox is full of messages, you can automatically delete old messages. If you turn on this setting, old messages will be automatically deleted when the number of messages exceeds 500 text messages, 200 multimedia messages, or 5,000+ chat messages.

##Delete old messages
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Delete old messages on

title: Preview web links sent from your contacts
description:
Preview web links sent from your contacts, When you receive a web link message from a saved contact, you can set whether to preview the link (on/off).

##Preview web links sent from contacts
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Preview web links sent from contacts on

title: Spam Report Guide
description:
Spam Report Guide, You can find explanations and instructions for the Easy Spam Reporting service. 

##How to check the Spam Report Guide
Go to Message App > More > Settings > Spam and Blocked Numbers Management > Spam Report Guide.

title: Block messages without sender's number
description:
Block messages without sender's number, You can block messages without a sender number through settings.

## Blocking messages without a sender number
Message app > More > Settings > Spam and blocked number management > Block messages without sender number on

title: Blocking Phrase Management
description:
Blocking Phrase Management, You can block messages containing certain phrases by setting those phrases. If a blocking phrase is registered, any message containing that phrase will be blocked.

##How to Access Blocking Phrase Management Setting Menu
1. Select 'More' at the top right of the Messages app
2. Select the 'Settings' menu
3. Choose 'Spam and Blocked Numbers Management'
4. Select 'Blocking Phrase Management'

##How to Add a Blocking Phrase
1. Go to Messages app > More > Settings > Spam and Blocked Numbers Management > Blocking Phrase Management
2. Select '+' at the top right 
3. Enter the phrase you want to block and save

##How to Delete a Blocking Phrase
1. Go to Messages app > More > Settings > Spam and Blocked Numbers Management > Blocking Phrase Management
2. Select 'Edit' at the top right 
3. Choose the phrase you want to delete and select 'Delete'
* If you select all registered blocking phrases, it will be displayed as 'Delete All'.

title: Blocked message
description:
Blocked message, You can check, restore, and delete blocked messages.

## Check blocked message
Message app> More view> Settings> Spam and Block number management> Blocked message

## Restore or delete blocked messages
Message app> More view> Settings> Spam and blocking number management> Blocked message> Enter individual blocking box> Select> Select message to restore or delete> Restore or delete (all)

title: Block/Unblock
description:
Block/Unblock, Enter a number to block or unblock a specific number. 

## Blocking/Unblocking
Messages app > More > Settings > Spam and blocked numbers management > Block/Unblock

title: Chat+ Usage Tips
description:
Chat+ Usage Tips, You can find various information and usage tips that can be helpful when using the Chat+ service on your mobile phone.

##How to Access Chat+ Usage Tips
Go to the Message app on your mobile phone > More > Settings > Chat+ Usage Tips.

title: Additional settings
description:
Additional settings, You can manage detailed settings related to messages.
You can check multimedia messages (MMS), quick response, voice messages converted to text, web link previews sent from contacts, location deletion when sharing images, allowing links to open, deleting old messages, and sticker and emoji menus.

## Entering Additional Settings
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings

## Multimedia Messages (MMS)
When receiving MMS, you can turn on/off automatic download and automatic download during roaming.
You can manage MMS-related settings in the following path.
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Multimedia messages (MMS)

## Deleting Location when Sharing Images
When sharing images via message, you can set whether to delete location information.
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Delete location when sharing images on

## Stickers and Emojis
You can select the types of stickers and emojis to use in the message app.
Message app > More > Settings > Additional settings > Stickers and Emojis

title: Spam and blocked number management
description:
Spam and blocked number management, You can manage settings related to spam and message blocking.
You can set menus such as managing blocked phrases, blocking/unblocking reception, and checking blocked messages.

##Enter the spam and blocked number management menu
Messages app > More > Settings > Manage spam and blocked numbers

title: Trash can
description:
Trash can, You can set whether to use the trash can function (on/off). Messages in the trash can are stored for 30 days, and if the trash can function is turned off, all messages in the trash can are deleted.

## Using the Trash Can
To use the trash can, go to the Messages app > More > 'Settings' > 'Trash' and turn it on.

## Entering the Trash Can
You can check the trash can by going to the Messages app > More > 'Trash'.

## Emptying the Trash Can
To empty the trash can, go to the Messages app > More > 'Trash' > More > 'Empty', and select it to empty the trash can.

## Restoring Trash Can Messages
To restore messages, go to the Messages app > More > 'Trash' > 'Edit' > select the message you want to restore > press 'Restore', and the message will be restored.

title: Conversation category
description:
Conversation category, You can set the message category feature to on or off.
If you use categories, messages in the message box are classified and displayed by category.
If you don't use categories, no categories are displayed and it appears as a single message box.

## Using conversation categories
Message app > More > Settings > Conversation category on

## Adding conversations to categories
Message app > More > Settings > Conversation category on > Add category

## Editing conversation categories
Message app > More > Settings > Conversation category on > Edit

title: Message Settings
description: Message Settings, You can manage basic settings related to the Message app. You can check the menus such as conversation categories, trash, notifications, spam and blocking number management, additional settings, and disaster text messages.

title: Settings - Customized Services
description:
Settings - Customized Services, The behavior of a particular app provides customized services and behaviors based on the user's activities and interests.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Samsung Account'> 'Security and privacy' menu.
3. Select 'Customization Service'. Customized service settings are available here.

## Activities and interests
You can check my activity and interest information. It utilizes information such as website information visited by Samsung Internet, place visited, and sleep pattern, and all information remains completely anonymous.

## Customized service information
You can check the app version information and open source license by clicking 'Customization Service' menu> 'Settings'> 'About Customization Service' in the upper right corner of 'Customization Service'.

## Setting data upload method
Data to be used for customized services can only be set to be uploaded upon Wi-Fi connection.
You can set 'Customization Service' menu> 'Settings'> 'Upload data using' by selecting 'Wi-Fi or mobile data' or 'Wi-Fi only'.

title: Data upload method
description:
Data upload method, You can choose how to upload the data to the device you need, by providing customized services. 

## You can set the data upload method 
Settings app > 'Samsung Account'> 'Security and privacy'> 'Customization Service'> upper right menu> 'Settings'> 'Upload data using' by selecting 'Wi-Fi only' or 'When Wi-Fi or mobile data'.

title: Notification
description:
Notification, Shared reminder notification settings. You can receive notifications when another person who uses the shared reminder together adds or completes the reminder. 

## Enter Shared Reminder Notification Settings Menu 
'Reminder' app> Top left menu> 'Reminder Settings'> 'Notifications'.

title: Delete time from title
description:
Delete time from title, This feature has the ability to automatically delete recognized dates and times from reminder titles. It can be done by turning the setting on/off. 

## Delete time from title 
'Reminder' app> Top left menu> 'Reminder settings'> 'Remove times from titles'.

title: Basic category
description:
Basic category, You can set default categories to be specified when creating reminders. Reminders stored in the Quick Input window are stored in the default category. 

## Enter default category setting menu 
'Reminder' app> upper left menu> 'Reminder settings'> 'Default category'.

title: Wastebasket
description:
Wastebasket, The trash can function can be turned on/off. Reminders in the trash can are stored for 30 days, and when you turn off the trash function, all reminders in the trash can are deleted. 

## Reminder app to enter trash can setting menu 
'Reminder' app> upper left menu> 'Reminder settings'> 'Trash'.

title: Display reminders on the Apps screen
description:
Display reminders on the Apps screen, You can set whether to display reminder icons on the Apps screen. If it is turned off, the reminder icon added to the home screen also disappears. 

## Enter reminder display setting menu on Apps screen 
'Reminder' app> Top left menu> 'Reminder settings'> 'Show Reminder on Apps screen'.

title: Reminder notification time all day
description:
Reminder notification time all day, You can set when to receive notifications from reminders set to All Day. 
You can choose between 7 a.m. on the same day or 9 a.m. on the same day, or set your own time to receive notifications.

## Enter reminder notification time setting menu all day 
'Reminder' app> upper left menu> 'Reminder settings'> 'Alert time for all-day reminders'

title: Notification system
description:
Notification system, You can set the default notification method of the Reminder to one of the options - Light/Medium/Strong, and you can also set the notification sound.

##How to Access Notification Method Setting Menu
Reminder app > Menu in top left corner > "Reminder Settings" > "Notification Method"

- Light: Notifies with a short sound.
- Medium: The notification is displayed on the full screen and a short alert sound rings.
- Strong: The notification is displayed on the full screen and a long alert sound rings.

title: Place Default Options Display
description:
Place Default Options Display, You can register a place to display as a default option on the reminder creation screen. Place basic options can be added up to 6. 

## Place default option display setting menu 
Enter 'Reminder app'> upper left menu> 'Reminder setting'> 'place default option display'.

title: Time default option display
description:
Time default option display, You can register the time to display as a default option on the reminder creation screen. You can add up to 6 time-based options. 

## Time Default Option Display Settings Menu 
Enter 'Reminder' app> Top left menu> 'Reminder Settings'> 'Default category'.

title: Synchronize to Microsoft To Do
description:
Synchronize to Microsoft To Do, After logging in and synchronizing your Microsoft account, the Microsoft To Do list can be synchronized and used.

##You can synchronize Microsoft To Do by following the steps given below:
1. Open 'Reminder' app > Click on Top left menu.
2. Then select the setting icon > Here you shall find 'Sync with Microsoft To Do' menu.

title: Synchronize with Samsung Cloud
description:
Synchronize with Samsung Cloud, Samsung Cloud Synchronization Settings.
Synchronization allows you to link with other devices that use the same Samsung account. 

Reminder App> Top left menu> 'Reminder Settings' > 'Sync with Samsung Cloud'.

title: Reminder setting
description:
Reminder setting, To set up various functions of the reminder. 

1. You can set up Microsoft to execute synchronization with Samsung Cloud. 
2. You can register the time and place to display as a default option. 
3. You can add settings for reminder notifications. 
4. In addition, various settings are provided under reminder settings. 

##Reminder Settings
Reminder App> Top left menu> 'Reminder Settings'.

title: My File Settings - Edit Menu Configuration
description:
My File Settings - Edit Menu Configuration, You can edit whether to display the menu to be displayed on the My Files home screen and edit the order of the menu.

## How to set up
1. Run the My Files app.
2. Select the More menu (⋮).
3. Select ‘Settings’.
4. Select the ‘Edit Menu Configuration’ menu.

In this menu, you can set whether to display recent files, categories, storage space, and favorites, and place items in the desired location.

title: My File Settings - Show hidden system files
description:
My File Settings - Show hidden system files, When browsing storage space in My Files, you can view hidden files that start with a comma (,) or dot (.).

## How to set up
1. Run the My Files app
2. Select the menu (⋮) at the top right
3. Select ‘Settings’
4. ‘Show hidden system files’

You can set whether to display hidden files in that menu.

title: My File Settings - Allow Mobile Data Usage
description:
My File Settings - Allow Mobile Data Usage, You can allow access to cloud and network storage using mobile data.

## How to set
1. Run My Files app
2. Select the menu (⋮) in the upper right corner
3. Select 'Settings'
2. Select 'Allow mobile data usage'

Here, you can set whether to use mobile data when accessing storage space.

- On: Use mobile data when accessing cloud and network storage space.
- Off: Limits data usage when accessing cloud and network storage space.

title: My File Settings
description:
My File Settings, You can check your Cloud Account, File Management, Edit Menu Configuration, Personal Information, My File Information, and Contact Us menus.

## Enter my file settings

1. Run My File app.
2. Select the More menu (⋮)
3. Select 'Settings'.

title: Screenshot format
description:
Screenshot format, Determines the format of the Game Booster screenshots. (JPEG/HEIF) 

##How to set: 
1. Run the game > Run the Game Booster icon.
2. Select the Menu option (3 dots).
3. Click on the Settings icon.
4. Select 'Screenshot format'.

You can choose between JPEG/HEIF.

title: Game booster information
description:
Game booster information, Displays the version information of the Game Booster. 

##How to Check:
1. Run the game > Run the Game Booster icon.
2. Select the Menu option (3 dots).
3. Click on the Settings icon.
4. Select 'About Game Booster'.

You can find out the version of the Game Booster app and whether it is the latest version. Additionally, you can also find information about 'Open source licenses'.

title: Screenshot resolution
description:
Screenshot resolution, Set the resolution of the Game Booster's screenshots. 

##How to set:
1. Run the game > Run the Game Booster icon.
2. Select the Menu option (3 dots).
3. Click on the Settings icon.
4. Select 'Screenshot resolution'.

You can choose the resolution ratio (100%, 50%, 25%) for the screenshot screen.

title: Power saving while using touch protection
description:
Power saving while using touch protection, While the Touch Protection is active, the frame rate for games is reduced to save power.

##How to set:
1. Run the game > Run the Game Booster icon.
2. Select the Menu option (3 dots).
3. Click on the Settings icon.
4. You can enable the 'Save power during touch protection' option here.

title: Preventing Automatic Touch During Game
description:
Preventing Automatic Touch During Game, Set the operating time for 'Automatic Touch Prevention' of Game Booster.

How to set it up
1. Run game -> Start Game Booster -> Click on settings app icon -> Select 'Automatic Touch Prevention'
You can select the desired time value, and you also have the option not to use it.

title: Game Booster Settings
description:
Game Booster Settings, Navigate to the settings screen of the Game Booster app. 

##How to navigate(if 'Shortcut bar' is not enabled):
1. Launch 'Gaming Hub' application.
2. Select Menu option (top right 3 dots).
3. Select 'Game Booster' option.

##How to navigate(if 'Shortcut bar' is enabled):
1. After starting the game > Run the Game Booster icon.
2. Select the Menu option (3 dots).
3. Select the Settings icon.

title: Place name display
description: Place name display, Use the location information (GPS) recorded in photos/videos to display landmarks, businesses, and place names in the gallery. Turn on Place Name Display 1. Turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Show Place Name' to display landmarks, businesses, and place names in the gallery. Turn off place name display 1. Turn off 'Gallery Settings' > 'Show Place Name' to prevent landmarks, businesses, and place names from being displayed in the gallery.

title: Shared album notification
description:
Shared album notification, We receive notifications about changes related to shared albums.  

##Turn on shared album notification
'Gallery Settings'> 'Shared album notification' Turn on to receive notifications when changes to shared albums occur.

##Turn off shared album notification 
In order to not receive shared album notifications, Turn off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Shared album notification'.

title: Album integration
description: Album integration, Shows an album of the same name combined into one album on the album tab. Turn on album integration function 1. If you turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Album Integration', you can see albums of the same name combined into one album. Turn off album integration function 1. If you turn off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Album Integration', you can see all albums.

title: Major album selection
description: Major album selection, All albums are not displayed in the album tam, only the selected album is displayed. Turn on the main album selection function 1. Turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Select Major Albums' so that only the selected major albums are displayed by default. Turn off the main album selection function 1. All albums are shown by turning off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Select Major Albums'.

title: Notification
description: Notification, Send a notification to the user when creating a story. Turn on story notification 1. Turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Notification' to receive notifications when creating stories. Turn on story notification 1. Turn off the story creation notification by turning off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Notification'.

title: Automatic playback of motion photo
description: Automatic playback of motion photo, Motion photos can be automatically played on the Detail View screen. Turn on motion photo auto-play 1. Turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Automatically Play Motion Photos' to automatically play Motion Photos. Turn off automatic playback of motion photos 1. If you turn off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Automatic Motion Photo Play', you can enjoy motion photos as regular photos * When setting off, you can select Motion Photo View in Detail View or tap the photo in Filmstrip at the bottom to enjoy video clips of Motion Photo.

title: Full screen scroll
description: Full screen scroll, On the list screen, you can hide the top app bar and the bottom tab area to display the list screen in full screen. Full screen scroll on 1. Turn on 'Gallery Settings'> 'Full Screen Scroll' to display the list screen on the full screen. Full screen scroll off 1. Turn off 'Gallery Settings'> 'Full Screen Scroll' to always display the top app bar and bottom tab area.

title: Super HDR
description:
Super HDR, Automatically adjusts the display so you can see all the colors and contrast in the photos you take with your Galaxy device.

Turn on Super HDR
1. Turn on ‘Settings’ > ‘Useful features’ > ‘Super HDR’ to view photos in Super HDR.

Turn off Super HDR
1. Turn off ‘Settings’ > ‘Useful features’ > ‘Super HDR’ to view photos in SDR.

title: Gallery Settings
description: Gallery Settings, Enter gallery settings 1. Enter 'Settings' through 'Gallery' -> 'Menu' (≡) -> 'Settings'.

title: SmartThings Settings
description: SmartThings Settings, This setting is provided by SmartThings. You can set up multiple options for the SmartThings app or check the app information. 1. Select 'SmartThings'> 'Menu'> 'Settings Icon'.

title: SmartThings information
description: SmartThings information, Check SmartThings information. You can check the version, location information terms and conditions, and open source license. 1. Select 'SmartThings Information' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Automatic update of devices and services
description: Automatic update of devices and services, Download and install device and service updates automatically. # Turn on automatic update of device and service 1. Select 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Automatic Update of Devices and Services'. 2. Here, set 'automatic update' to 'only when connecting Wi-Fi' or 'when connecting Wi-Fi or mobile data'. # Turn off automatic update of device and service 1. Select 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Automatic Update of Devices and Services'. 2. Set 'Auto Update' to 'Disable'.

title: SmartThings withdrawal
description: SmartThings withdrawal, You can delete all SmartThings data and SmartThings services from my Samsung account. 1. In 'SmartThings Settings', select 'SmartThings Exit'. 2. After checking the contents here, press the 'SmartThings Exit' button.

title: Get a notification when a new device is detected
description: Get a notification when a new device is detected, When a device that can be added to SmartThings is detected, a pop-up appears so that you can register immediately without opening SmartThings. ## When a new device is detected, turn on notification 1. Turn on 'Receive notification when new device is detected' in 'SmartThings Settings'. ## When a new device is detected, turn off notification 1. Turn off 'Receive notification when new device is detected' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Automatically turn on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth
description: Automatically turn on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, When you run the SmartThings app, you turn on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth automatically. Wi-Fi and Bluetooth must be turned on to detect new devices that can be added to SmartThings. 1. Turn on 'Wi-Fi and Bluetooth automatically' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Useful function
description:
Useful function, ##You can use your mobile phone as a fast remote control. When you are near the device, you can easily control the device through the notification window of your mobile phone. Supported devices: TV, robot vacuum cleaner, air conditioner, air purifier. You can enable the feature by following the below steps:
1. Select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'. 
2. Turn on the Quick Remote Control here.  
 
## Use mobile phone as TV keyboard  when entering letters on a TV. You will be notified as you enter letters on the keypad of your mobile phone. It may not be supported on some TVs.  
1. Select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'.
2. Turn on 'Use your mobile phone as a TV keyboard' here. 
 
## Use your phone's camera as a TV camera. When you have to use the camera on your TV you will be notified on your phone. It may not be supported on some TVs. 
1. Select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'.
2. Turn on 'Use your cell phone as a TV camera' here. 
 
## Automatic switching of Magic Screen  allows the Magic Screen to turn on automatically when you are close to the TV, and turns off to save energy when you are away from the TV.  
     -In the Sero, portrait mode is automatically turned on instead of the Magic Screen. 
     -On the monitor, your content is automatically turned on instead of the Magic Screen.  
1. Please select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'.
2. Turn on 'Automatic Switch on Magic Screen' here. 
 
## Start Smart View on another device to mirror your cell phone screen on a nearby device screen.  You can enable it using following steps:
1. Please select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'> 'Start Smart View on another device'. 
2. Turn on the device you want to use this feature in the device list here. 
 
##To Keep the screen turned on when using the app :
1. Please select 'SmartThings settings'> 'Advanced features'. 
2. Turn on 'Keep the screen on when using the app' here.

title: Tap view, tap sound
description:
Tap view, tap sound, You can mirror the screen of your phone or listen to the music of your phone on the device by facing the back of your phone against the device. 
 
## Tap view, tap sound on 
1. Turn on 'Tap View, Tab Sound' in 'SmartThings Settings'.  
* This feature is not available in sleep mode. 
* Use a cell phone case to protect your cell phone or touch the back of your cell phone slightly. 
* Supported devices: TV, sound bar, family hub refrigerator (some devices may not support it. ) 
 
## Tap view, tap sound off 
1. Turn off 'Tap View, Tab Sound' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Connected service
description: Connected service, You can manage or delete the service you are using by connecting to SmartThings. ## Check connected service 1. Select 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Connected Service'. 2. Check the service you want in the connected service list. On the service detail screen, you can check the device added to SmartThings through the service connection. ## Disconnect the connected service 1. Select 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Connected Service'. 2. Select the service you want from the connected service list. 3. Press the disconnect button on the service detail screen.

title: Using wallpaper
description: Using wallpaper, You can set the desired wallpaper in each place and room. You can change the wallpaper of each place and room in Place Management or Room Management. ## Turn on wallpaper usage 1. Turn on 'Use wallpaper' in 'SmartThings Settings'. ## Turn off wallpaper 1. Turn off 'Use wallpaper' in 'SmartThing Settings'.

title: Recommendation card
description: Recommendation card, The Favorites tab displays cards that recommend useful features. ## Turn on the recommended card 1. Turn on the 'Recommendation Card' in 'SmartThings Settings'. ## Turn off recommended card 1. Turn off the 'Recommendation Card' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Notification
description:
Notification, The SmartThings app provides a variety of useful information through notifications, including real-time status of devices in your home, energy usage, home care services, and real-time control buttons for nearby appliances. For example, you can receive preset notifications when appliances like washing machines and AirDressers finish their cycles, when sensors detect anomalies, or when automations are executed. You can receive or block notifications for each device or service through notification settings.

##Receiving Notifications
1. In 'SmartThings settings', find 'Notifications' and turn the switch on.

##Turning Off Notifications
1. In 'SmartThings settings', find 'Notifications' and turn the switch off.

title: Favorites Synchronization
description: Favorites Synchronization, Synchronize favorites with your Samsung account. Synchronizing Favorites allows you to view the same Favorites on all devices with the same Samsung account logged in. ## Turn on Favorites Synchronization 1. Turn on 'Sync Favorites' in 'SmartThings Settings'. ## Turn off Favorites Synchronization 1. Turn off 'Favorite Synchronization' in 'SmartThings Settings'.

title: Samsung Account
description: Samsung Account, Shows the set Samsung account. Click to go to the Samsung account screen. 1. Check 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Samsung Account'.

title: Use this cell phone as my location
description: Use this cell phone as my location, I use this phone to check my location in the routine and other members check whether I am at home or not. 1. Please select 'SmartThings Settings'> 'Use this mobile phone as my location'. 2. Switch on where you want to go.

title: Encryption of Secure Folder
description:
Encryption of Secure Folder, Secure Folder Encryption' is a feature that protects Secure Folder data to be transferred with Smart Switch by encrypting it.

1. Select 'Secure Folder Encryption' in the 'Smart Switch Settings'.
2. You can choose between 'Encrypt with Samsung Account' and 'Encrypt with Password'.

title: External storage encryption
description:
External storage encryption, External Storage Encryption' is a feature that protects data to be backed up to external storage using Smart Switch by encrypting it.

1. In 'Smart Switch Settings', select 'External Storage Encryption'.
2. You can choose between 'Encrypt with Samsung Account', 'Encrypt with Password', or 'Do not Encrypt'.

title: Enhanced transmission security
description:
Enhanced transmission security, Enhanced Transfer Security' is a feature that protects the data to be transferred via Smart Switch through security code authentication.

1. Check 'Enhanced Transfer Security' in 'Smart Switch Settings'.
2. You can turn the feature on or off by pressing the switch.

title: Set Samsung Free (Samsung News)
description:
Set Samsung Free (Samsung News), Go to the setting screen provided by Samsung Free
Select 'Settings' from the Samsung Free -> 'More View' menu.

title: Private sharing history
description:
Private sharing history, Check and manage files exchanged through private sharing. 

## Shows private sharing history. 
'Quick Share settings'> 'Private sharing history'.

title: Use only Wi-Fi
description:
Use only Wi-Fi, You can set whether to use mobile data when sharing with QR Code, sharing with contacts, and copying links. 

## Turn on settings to use only Wi-Fi when sharing links: 
'Quick Share settings'> 'Use  Wi-Fi only'> Turn on.

## Turn off settings to use only Wi-Fi when sharing links:
'Quick Share settings'> 'Use  Wi-Fi only'> Turn off.

title: Display shareable devices directly on the shared panel
description:
Display shareable devices directly on the shared panel, Share panel displays devices that can be shared directly to QuickShare. 

## Turn on display of devices that can be shared directly on the shared panel:
'Quick Share settings'> 'Show available devices on shared panel'> Turn on.

 ## Turn off display of devices that can be shared directly on the shared panel:
'Quick Share settings'> 'Show available devices on shared panel'> Turn off.

title: Quick Share - who is allowed to share
description:
Quick Share - who is allowed to share, Discover your device and choose who you can share with.

##Setting who you can share with
You can access it through the following methods.
Method 1. Quick Panel > Tap 'Quick Share' > Tap 'Settings' to allow sharing > 'People who can share with me'
Method 2. Quick Panel > Long tap 'Quick Share' > 'People who can share with me'
Method 3. 'Settings' > 'Connect between devices' > 'Quick Share' > 'People who can share with me'

title: Quick Share Configuration
description:
Quick Share Configuration, Quick Share related settings:

You can set up multiple options, such as device name, share allowed target, etc., or check app information. You can enter through the following two methods to enter the Quick Share setting.

1. Quick Panel> Press 'Quick Share' for a long time.
2. Go to 'Settings'> 'Connected devices> 'Quick Share'.

title: Gaming Hub
description:
Gaming Hub, This is how to check the settings related to Gaming Hub.

Open Gaming Hub app -> Select the three dots at the top right -> Settings

- Samsung Account: Displays the current Samsung account. It will take you to your Samsung account.
- Dark Mode: You can change the theme settings of the Gaming Hub app. You can choose whether or not to use Dark Mode.
- Display Game Apps: You can turn on/off displaying game apps on home/app screens. You can choose whether games will be displayed on home screen, app screen, or only in Gaming Hub.
- Autoplay Videos with Mobile Data: Depending on your network environment, you can choose whether to autoplay videos.
- Notifications: This takes you to notification settings for the Gaming Hub app.
- Delete Personal Data: You can request deletion of personal data from server.
- Ad Personal Information: Personal information related to advertisements.

title: Authenticate password/biometrics at the time of purchase
description: Authenticate password/biometrics at the time of purchase, When purchasing a paid app from the Galaxy store, you can specify whether to use password or biometric information or not. 1. Select the Galaxy store -> menu tab and select the cogwheel icon. 2. Select the Password/Biometric Authentication menu when purchasing. 3. If you want to disable it, enter your password.

title: Automatic video playback
description: Automatic video playback, You can specify the network type when using or not automatically playing the video banner played on the Galaxy store main screen. 1. Select the Galaxy store -> menu tab and select the cogwheel icon. 2. Click the auto-play video menu to specify no or network type.

title: Automatic app update
description: Automatic app update, You can specify the network type when you do not automatically update apps installed through the Galaxy Store or set up usage. 1. Select the Galaxy store -> menu tab and select the cogwheel icon. 2. Click the App Auto Update menu to specify No or Network Type

title: Galaxy Store Configuration
description: Galaxy Store Configuration, Go to the setting screen provided by Galaxy store 1. Select the Galaxy store -> menu tab and select the cogwheel icon.

title: Automatically delete completed reminders
description:
Automatically delete completed reminders, To help you manage your reminder list neatly, a new option has been added to automatically delete completed reminders after a certain period of time.

##Automatically delete completed reminders
1. Run the ‘Reminder’ app.
2. Turn on ‘Reminder Settings’ > ‘Delete Completed Reminder’ to use Delete Completed Reminder.

Completed reminders are automatically deleted after the set period.

title: Status bar
description:
Status bar, You can change the settings related to the status bar.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Notification' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Status bar' menu.

By selecting this menu, you can change the notification style of the status bar to 'Icon', 'Dot', or 'Hide'.
Also, you can change the setting for battery remaining display.

title: Contact Account Synchronization
description:
Contact Account Synchronization, You can add a contact account or change Sync ON/OFF.

If you need to add an account or modify to synchronize, follow the below steps.

1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Click 'More' on the right and select Settings.
3. Select 'Sync Contact Account' from the additional settings.
4. If you need to add an account, select '+ Add Account', and if you need to change synchronization, click the right switch of the account you want to change and switch to ON/OFF.

title: METHOD FOR INTEGRATING DUPLICATED CONTACTS
description:
METHOD FOR INTEGRATING DUPLICATED CONTACTS, There is a way to connect contacts stored with the same name, phone number, and e-mail address and integrate them into one contact.

To integrate duplicate contacts, follow the steps mentioned below:

1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Click 'More' on the right and select Settings.
3. Select 'Integrating redundant contacts' from the contact management items.
4. Select the contact you want to integrate and click 'Integration' at the bottom.

title: Share over the Internet
description:
Share over the Internet, Even if two devices become distant from each other during file transfer via Quick Share, files can continue to be shared over the Internet (Wi-Fi or mobile network).
Both the sending and receiving devices must be turned on and connected to the Internet.

# # # Sharing on the Internet
'Quick Share Settings'> 'Share on the Internet'> On

## Turn off sharing on the Internet
'Quick Share Settings'> 'Share on the Internet'> Turn off

title: Keep the lock screen until you push the screen
description:
Keep the lock screen until you push the screen, When you unlock with your fingerprint, the lock screen is maintained until you push the screen. Turn off this feature to display the last screen you were using right away.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Fingerprint' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Keep the lock screen until you push the screen' menu.

title: Export Contacts
description:
Export Contacts, You can create contacts stored on your device as vcf files.

To create a saved contact as a vcf file, follow the below steps:

1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Click 'More' on the right and select Settings.
3. Select 'Export Contacts' from the contact management items.
4. Select a location to save the contact file and click 'Export'.

title: Import Contacts
description:
Import Contacts, There is a way to get contacts saved as vcf files.

To import a contact from a file, follow the steps below.

1. Run the Contacts app.
2. Click 'More' on the right and select Settings.
3. Select 'Import Contacts' from the contact management items.
4. Click the store where the file is located, select the contact you want to import, and then click 'Complete'.
5. Select a location to save the imported contact and click 'Bring'.

title: Fingerprint icon display
description:
Fingerprint icon display, How to enable/disable the fingerprint icon on the lock screen when the screen is turned off.

1. Run the 'Settings' app.
2. Select 'Lock Screen and AOD'> 'Screen Lock and Biometrics'> 'Fingerprint' menu.
3. You can find the 'Show Fingerprint Icon' menu here.

title: Block malicious messages
description:
Block malicious messages, Automatically block malicious and spam messages.
When you turn on the "block malicious messages" function, messages and phone numbers classified as malicious are automatically blocked from the message app. In addition, when the 'block with AI' function is turned on, messages suspected of malware classified by AI filters are automatically blocked.

## Turn on malicious message blocking
Message app> More view> Settings> Spam and blocking number management> Malicious message blocking on

## Turn on the block with AI
Message app> More view> Settings> Spam and blocking number management> Malicious message blocking on> Block with AI

title: Blocking international caller messages
description:
Blocking international caller messages, Settings allow you to block messages from international callers.

## Blocking international caller messages
Message app > More View > Settings > Spam and Block Number Management > Turn on Block International Caller Messages

title: Automatically delete OTP authentication messages
description:
Automatically delete OTP authentication messages, Authentication messages, including one-time passwords (OTPs), automatically move to the trash after 24 hours.
Authentication messages moved to the trash can will be deleted after 30 days.
However, if there is no trash can, the authentication message will be completely deleted after 24 hours.

## Automatically delete OTP authentication messages
Message app > More view > Settings > Additional Settings > Turn on Automatic deletion of OTP authentication messages

title: Health Assistant
description:
Health Assistant, Get personalized insights and guides based on your health data.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Galaxy AI' menu.
3. You can find the 'Health Assist' menu here.

When wearing a Galaxy Watch or Ring, it calculates an energy score using recent sleep, physical activity, and heart rate. You can plan how to recover and spend the day based on the message provided with the energy score.

Health Assist cannot be used for medical purposes and should only be used for exercise and health management.

The information provided by Health Assist may not be accurate and may vary depending on individual conditions or usage environment. If you experience any health or physical abnormalities during use, please consult a medical professional.

For more information on the enhanced intelligence features of Galaxy AI, please refer to the terms and conditions.

title: Ability to decorate notes with AI-generated labels
description:
Ability to decorate notes with AI-generated labels, You can set the cover of notes created by Samsung Notes.

## How to set 'create cover' of written note
1. Open the created note file.
2. Click 'Title' at the top.
3. Click the 'Edit Note' icon in the upper right corner.

## How to set 'sign generation' of notes using AI
1. Press and hold the note you want to generate the cover page.
2. Click 'More' - 'Create Covers' in the lower right corner.

title: Weather and Time Wallpaper
description:
Weather and Time Wallpaper, You can use AI to see how your photos change depending on the weather and time.

Depending on the default location of the weather app, it can make your photos sunny, rainy, or snowy,
and change them to morning, day, evening, or night.
This effect analyzes your photos with AI and reflects the effects, and you can create more beautiful wallpapers by using photos taken outdoors during the day.

1. Settings
2. Galaxy AI
3. Weather and Time Wallpaper

title: Call
description:
Call, When two SIM cards are active, you can set the primary SIM for voice calls.
Here, the two SIM cards refer to USIM or eSIM.

1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'SIM card manager' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Calls' menu.

When two SIM cards are active, you can set the SIM for 'Calls' under 'Primary SIM card' here.

title: Mobile data
description:
Mobile data, When two SIM cards are active, you can set the primary SIM for mobile data usage. Here, two SIM cards refer to USIM or eSIM.

1. Launch the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connections' > 'SIM card manager' menu.
3. Here, you can find the 'Mobile data' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of your device's screen to open the 'Quick settings' panel and toggle the 'Mobile data' icon on or off.

title: Quick Share
description:
Quick Share, Quick Share allows you to share content with nearby devices via Wi-Fi Direct or Bluetooth. You can also change the settings related to 'Quick Share'.

##How to Access Settings
1. Open the 'Settings' app.
2. Select the 'Connected devices' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'Quick Share' menu.

Alternatively, you can swipe down from the top of the screen to open the 'Quick Settings' panel and tap the 'Quick Share' icon to turn the feature on or off.

##How to Use Settings
Set Search Range
You can set the range within which other devices can search for your device or send files.

title: S Pen
description:
S Pen, S Pen is a tool that recognizes touch, assisting in performing detailed selections, drawing, and writing that could be difficult with fingers. It can be used on Galaxy Note or other Galaxy devices that support the S Pen.

You can set up the environment for using the S Pen.
1. Launch the 'Settings' app on your Galaxy device.
2. Select the 'Advanced features' menu.
3. Here you can find the 'S Pen' menu.

You can make settings related to the S Pen here. You can set menus such as ON/OFF setting, Air Actions, Air Command, Air View, text input with S Pen, screen-off memo, additional S Pen settings and so on.

title: Download and delete personal data
description: Download and delete personal data, Galaxy Store is guiding you on how to download or delete personal data. 1. Select the Galaxy store -> menu tab and select the cogwheel icon. 2. Select the Download and Delete Personal Data menu. 3. Select Samsung's Personal Information Protection Link.

title: Time
description:
Time, You can display the time in the watermark. 

'Camera settings'>'Watermark'>'Time'

It as two types Time 24-hour format or Morning, Afternoon.

title: Inquire
description:
Inquire, You can inquire about questions or find frequently asked questions. 

Camera Settings> Contact us

title: Vibration feedback
description:
Vibration feedback, Set certain situations such as pressing the photographing button can be notified by vibration.

 'Camera settings'>'Vibration feedback'

title: Permissions used by this app
description:
Permissions used by this app, You can check the permissions required to use the Camera app. 
Camera app > Settings > 'Permissions'

title: Digital Wellbeing and parental controls
description:
Digital Wellbeing and parental controls, You can use features that help you check product usage history and avoid being disturbed by other things. 

1. Open the 'Settings' app on your device.
2. Select the 'Digital Wellbeing and parental controls' menu.

You can also manage children's product usage through parental control features.

title: Display frequently used contacts
description:
Display frequently used contacts, You can see people you have contacted frequently over the past 30 days in your contact information and phone app.

To check your frequently used contacts, follow the steps below:

1. Open Contacts App
2. Check the contacts displayed at the bottom of 'frequently used contacts' in the contact list

# # # Contact 'Show frequently used contacts'
Turn on the Contacts app> 'More'> 'Settings'> 'Show frequently used contacts'.

title: Minitimer display
description:
Minitimer display, Mini Timer Display' is a feature that allows you to check the running timer on screens other than the clock app.
If you want to set or change the mini timer to be visible, follow these steps:

1. Clock app > 'More' > Select 'Settings'.
2. In the 'Timer' section, turn on 'Show mini timer'.

If you do not want to display the mini timer, tap 'Show mini timer' to turn it off.

title: Notify the alarm that will ring soon in advance
description:
Notify the alarm that will ring soon in advance, The 'Upcoming alarm notification' feature notifies you of an upcoming alarm before it rings, allowing you to know in advance.
To set and change the 'Upcoming alarm notification,' follow these steps:

1. Go to the Clock app > 'More' > Select 'Settings'.
2. Select 'Upcoming alarm notification' under the alarm category.
3. Choose the desired time:
    → '5 minutes before'
    → '15 minutes before'
    → '30 minutes before'
    → 'Off'

If the clock is on in the customized service, you may receive an upcoming alarm notification even if it's not at the selected time.

title: sound
description:
sound, 'Sound' is a function that can be set to the desired sound when the timer of the clock app ends and rings.

##If you want to set and change the sound of the timer, set it as follows:
1. Run the 'Clock' app > Tap on the More view button in the upper right corner > Select the 'Settings' menu.
2. Turn on the 'Sound' in the 'Timer' item.

If you want to change the sound of the timer, press the 'Sound' part to select the desired sound source and volume.

title: Alarm background
description:
Alarm background, Alarm Background' is a feature that allows you to set an image or video as your alarm background, when the alarm rings.
There are two places where you can set the alarm background:
If you want to set the default alarm background when creating an alarm, select 'Alarm Background' in the clock app's settings.
If you want to set or change the alarm background for a specific alarm, you can do so through the alarm background located at the bottom of the alarm edit screen.

##The method to set the alarm background is as follows:
1. Clock app > More button > Select 'Settings'.
2. Select 'Alarm background'.
3. Tap on the option 'Background'.
4. Select the desired image or video on that screen.
5. Press the 'Done' button at the top right to finish.

Please note, if you choose a video for the alarm background, it can display for up to 15 seconds.
If you want to set it as an AR Emoji, you can create and set an AR Emoji through the 'Create AR Emoji' in the more menu at the top right.

Once you select the desired image or video, you can check the preview screen with the applied screen.
You can also change it to your desired style by pressing the clock part within that screen.

title: Touch feedback
description:
Touch feedback, You can select Touch Feedback to specify whether to play sound or transmit vibration when you press the keyboard. 

##Here's how you can set Touch Feedback:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Select 'Touch feedback'.

title: Keyboard input reading
description:
Keyboard input reading, You can select Read Keyboard Input to turn on or off the ability to read keyboard letters aloud.

##Here's how you can enable Read Keyboard input aloud:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon from toolbar > Select 'Swipe, touch, and feedback' > Enable 'Speak keyboard input aloud'.

title: Browsing Assistant
description:
Browsing Assistant, 'Browsing Assist' is an AI assist feature available in the Samsung Internet browser. It provides web page translation and web page summarization functions.

# Limitations
- Scope of application: The summarization function may be limited on very short web pages or paid sites.
- If there is no language pack, translation will not be executed, and language pack download can be checked through the translation settings menu.

# How to run
1. Open the page where Browsing Assist is needed in the Samsung Internet app.
2. Select the 'Browsing Assist' icon.
3. Select the desired function.

# Setting check
- You can check the detailed settings for the summarization function in 'Internet Menu' > 'Settings' > 'Browsing Assist'.

title: Do not set
description:
Do not set, This is the way to opt out the voice input. 

##Here's how you can disable voice input:
1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icon on toolbar > Select 'Voice input' > You can select 'None' to disable voice input here.

title: General
description:
General, You may or may not display keys on the left and right sides of the space bar by adjusting general items. It is a method of adjusting the arrangement of keys on the left and right sides of the keyboard space bar. 

1. Run 'Samsung Keyboard' > Select 'Settings' icons on the toolbar > Select 'Layout' options > Select 'General' items.

You may or may not display keys left and right of the space bar here. To adjust the key that appears when you enter an email, you can set the "Email address input" section. 
To adjust the key that appears when entering a web address, you can set the "Enter Web Address" part.
